It is located about 50 miles southwest of Korvosa on a narrow plateau named after one of Korvosa's founders, Montlarion Jeggare, and is on the edge of the southern Mindspin Mountains.

properties.Name: Citadel of Flame
properties.text:
The Citadel of Flame was the headquarters of a cult of the archdevil Moloch that arose in the Meraz Desert of Qadira three centuries ago. It is located in the western Meraz Desert, near the shores of Obari Ocean.

Thought to have been annihilated and covered by a stand storm, the citadel was rediscovered by the Pathfinder Society in 4709 AR. Upon sending Pathfinders to investigate, it was discovered that the cult was resurgent and under the control of a powerful cleric of Moloch named Hafshi Al-Moloch, who hoped to open a permanent planar portal to Malebolge. The Pathfinders defeated the cult and returned its magical idol of Moloch to the Grand Lodge in Absalom.

properties.Name: Citadel of the Alchemist
properties.text:
Artokus Kirran discovered the secret of making the sun orchid elixir in 1140 AR. The five city-states of Thuvia banded together to protect the elixir, and together they built a fortress in the Thuvian desert to protect the alchemist and his laboratories.

This fortress is known as the Citadel of the Alchemist, and is carved out of the base of a mountain in the Barrier Wall known as the Bent Razor. Above ground it appears as a modest stone structure. However, below ground there are vast tunnels housing alchemical traps and guardians. Hidden somewhere in this network are some of the best alchemical laboratories in the Inner Sea region.

The citadel houses a powerful alchemist. He has not left the citadel in living memory, but most believe him to be Artokus Kirran himself.

Every year a blind, mute servant comes forth from the citadel with six vials of the elixir, to be auctioned off in one of Thuvia's five cities.

The citadel serves as an alchemy school, although it is unknown how its students are chosen. Artokus Kirran teaches his alchemical lessons via Tukalo, his meerkat familiar. Recently two hobgoblins sent by General Azaersi were accepted into it by Artokus, though he is keeping any motives for his decision close to his chest.

properties.Name: Citadel of the Supreme Elect
properties.text: The Citadel of the Supreme Elect is a walled complex that houses the offices and residence of the Supreme Elect, who is the chief executive of the democratic nation of Andoran, and who also serves as the mayor of its capital city, Almas. The small keep stands near the western end of the Field of Concord in the Liberty District of Almas. The citadel is topped by a large copper dome, and guarded by a battalion of Steel Falcons. The House of the Demarchy Assembly, which holds the offices of the ministers who advise the Supreme Elect, is also located within its walls, as are buildings that contain the offices of consuls, ministers, and other state officials.

properties.Name: Citadel of the Weary Sky
properties.text: The Citadel of the Weary Sky, formerly known as the Jaizun Citadel, is a mysterious and enigmatic historical site located in the realm of Rahadoum. It holds a significant place in the history of the Jistka Imperium, a once-powerful empire known for its mastery of elemental magic and extraplanar conjurations.

properties.Name: City of Bleeding Stones
properties.text: The City of Bleeding Stones is the largest set of Ghol-Gan ruins on the island of Devil's Arches in the Shackles. It is nestled in a cove beside the island's vast, hilly rainforests. Many major expeditions have been sent to the City of Bleeding Stone, but each has ended in disaster, even in the expedition's group complete disappearance. The few survivors claim that some primordial evil plagues the ruins. The Pathfinder Society has expressed interest in exploring the city.

properties.Name: City of Whistling Swords
properties.text:
The City of Whistling Swords is the ruined first capital of the pre-Lung Wa nation of Ootoya, the site of which is now the Successor State of Kwanlai in Tian Xia. This lost city is located in the western foothills of Kwanlai and mostly ignored by its tengu inhabitants.

Still, it draws outsiders and adventurers seeking to loot the city's supposedly untouched armouries, a difficult task since the city is infested with rat kings, oni, and other foul spirits, all led by the hateful underworld dragon Mujihi who was exiled to the surface world that he so despises.

properties.Name: Clenchjaw's
properties.text:
Clenchjaw's, named for its owner Rinston "Clenchjaw" Jom, was once a much quieter tavern than it is now. Sitting in the Yolubilis Harbor district of Kintargo meant that, when the nearby Thrashing Badger burned down during the Night of Ashes, Clenchjaw's gained an influx of rowdy dockworkers and wannabe revolutionaries that has disrupted the once quieter bar. Now brawls and intrigue have become a regular part of the bar's life.

Little known to either Clenchjaw's owner or its patrons is that much of this trouble is due to a new resident, a mischievous faerie dragon intent on causing trouble.

properties.Name: Clicking Caverns
properties.text: The Clicking Caverns are set of underground tunnels and caverns known to connect to the Darklands of the continent of Tian Xia and are located on the border between the nations of Xa Hoi and Nagajor. They are inhabited by flesh-eating clockwork constructs haunted by the souls of their extinct builders.

properties.Name: Cloudreaver Keep
properties.text:
An immense fortress called Cloudreaver Keep guards the eastern border of the Grand Duchy of Alkenstar. It is one of the three points connected by the massive Bridge of the Gods, the other two being Alkenstar City and Dongun Hold on the far side of the canyon. While the keep was intended to serve as a defense against outside threats, since its construction it has been plagued almost constantly with hauntings from ghosts within and attacks from nearby bands of yetis.

The keep stands on the western bank of the Ustradi River, and all trade from Nex passes through it.

properties.Name: Cloven Hoof Society
properties.text: The Cloven Hoof Society is an organisation that helps cambions throughout the city of Kintargo, the nation of Ravounel, and lands beyond. Its headquarters are located in the slums of the city's Redroof neighborhood.

properties.Name: Clover's Crossing
properties.text: Clover's Crossing was a thriving village in the north of the Ustalavic province of Canterwall until it was overrun by a large numbers of ghouls who rose up out the local church's graveyard. As of 4711 AR, Clover's Crossing was a ghost town that few willingly agree to enter.

properties.Name: Coastal Cairns
properties.text: The Coastal Cairns are located near the banks of Lake Encarthan in the nation of Razmiran and are believed to have been built by a race that predates human settlement in the region.

properties.Name: Collapsed Halls
properties.text: The Collapsed Halls are the haunted ruins of a castle located on the upper Maiestas River west of the Barrowood, near the borders of the Chelaxian Archduchies of Menador and the Heartlands.

properties.Name: Cormegi Manor
properties.text: Cormegi Manor was once the seat of Hest Cormegi, a wealthy plantation owner in the southwest of Sinaria county in Ustalav. When the cheap and morally bankrupt Cormegi began to kidnap the youth of Graidmere Swamp to work his fields, the people rose up against him. They were no match for Cormegi's thugs, however, and afterwards the corrupt landowner simply used their bodies to fertilize the soil. The children were finally freed, when their dead parents arose from their tilled graves and murdered Cormegi and his men. Having nowhere to run, the young people decided to occupy the manor home and continue farming it, still under the watchful eyes of their undead progenitors. The place is now staunchly avoided by the swampers of the region.

properties.Name: Corveilles
properties.text: Corveilles, sometimes spelled Corveiles, was a large city in the Thassilonian kingdom of Cyrusian. As of 4707 AR, its location had not been rediscovered.

properties.Name: Counting House
properties.text: The squat building of the Counting House served as the first moneylender in Kintargo and is located in the prosperous district known as The Greens. As of 4724 AR, it now serves as a meeting hall for Silver Council meetings with members of Kintargo's aristocracy.

properties.Name: Courtesan and Unicorn
properties.text: The Courtesan and Unicorn is a combination harrow parlor and brothel run by Vanyavi Czanji in the Lowcleft district of Magnimar. The harrow readings are often performed by non-Varisians dressed up as a caricature of true members of this ethnicity. Shoanti guards fanatically loyal to Czanji monitor the premises. Their pay consists of credit with the prostitutes.

properties.Name: Covenant Rock
properties.text:
Covenant Rock is a small, flat rock that sits along the northern reaches of the Flood Road. The only thing exceptional about this otherwise uninteresting rock is its use. Caravans traveling the Flood Road place here their tribute to the dragons of Raschka-Tor in exchange for safe passage through the dragons' territory. These tributes can consist of anything ranging from treasure to livestock to slaves. Regardless of what is given, it is seen as better than facing the wrath of the dragons of Raschka-Tor. Since 4710 AR, the orcs of the surrounding Whisperfall region have also started paying tributes to the dragons.

The dromaar alchemist Rzonca the Clever resides in a small hut in the shadow of the Covenant Rock and acts as the agent of the red dragons of Raschka-Tor.

properties.Name: Crabbe Estate
properties.text: Crabbe Estate is home to Dame Parthena Crabbe and is located near the hamlet of Moost.

properties.Name: Crackspike
properties.text: Crackspike is a formation of prospectors' bones in Devil's Perch, erected as both a warning and summer roost by the area's native Windspire tribe of strix around 4690 AR. The Chelaxian provincial authorities attempted to secure Crackspike around 4711 AR as a base for mining silver from Sorvus's Strike about two miles northwest of Crackspike; the strix subsequently burned the settlement to the ground.

properties.Name: Cradle of Immortality
properties.text: The Cradle of Immortality, located in the Tian Xia nation of Lingshen far to the north of the Golden River, is where artisans have sculpted terracotta likenesses of soldiers serving King Huang. His wizards have connected the statues to the souls of the warriors with the underworld dragon's blessing. Whenever one of these warriors dies, their soul is transferred to the terra-cotta soldier to continue serving their lord until the simulacrum is destroyed.

properties.Name: Creeping Watcher
properties.text:
The Creeping Watcher is a 70-foot-tall statue in the heart of the Vargas Swamp.

Though draped in vines and surrounded by dense trees, the Creeping Watcher resembles its sister statue, the Crouching Jackal. its body is sleek and cat-like, though covered in carved scales while its head is clearly reptilian. Unlike the Crouching Jackal, the Creeping Watcher is not carved from a single solid lump of stone, and its eyes are made of some sort of luminous yellow stone. Like its sister statue, the Creeping Watcher's origins are surrounded by mystery, though it is generally held that the Creeping Watcher is the more sinister of the two. Some even suppose that the Crouching Jackal serves as some sort of guardian keeping the Creeping Watcher in check. Whatever the truth is, the location has a bad reputation nowadays as it is believed to be the site of foul worship and evil rituals.

properties.Name: Crimson Citadel
properties.text: The headquarters of the feared Red Mantis Assassins, the Crimson Citadel is one of the few settlements on Mediogalti Island aside from the city of Ilizmagorti. Only the Red Mantis know its exact location and features, but there are numerous rumours about the place. This means that anyone who wishes to contact the Red Mantis, must make their intentions known in the more cosmopolitan city of Ilizmagorti.

properties.Name: Crimsonlight Dig
properties.text: The Crimsonlight Dig is one of the few archaeological sites in Kahlehlin. So far, the dig has unearthed ruins, an obsidian menhir, several glowing red stones, and more.

properties.Name: Crissali's Fine Tomes
properties.text: Crissali's Fine Tomes, located in Jarvis End of Kintargo in Ravounel, is one of the city's many flourishing bookshops. Crissali's is particularly renowned for both its collection of rare books and magic items, including a collection of minor magical scrolls and even a more powerful scroll of teleportation. It is also unusual that the shop's owner, Nandy Crissali, is noticeably apolitical in a city brimming with rebellion.

properties.Name: Crooked Falls
properties.text: The Crooked Falls are a series of five 10- to 30-foot waterfalls over a one-mile course on the Shrike River in southern Brevoy. Its challenging features prevent river trade between Brevoy and lands to the south, with most trade traditionally using the East Sellen River through Hooktongue Slough instead.

properties.Name: Crouching Jackal
properties.text:
Located in northern Katapesh, the Crouching Jackal is a huge statue that stands nearly seventy feet tall and appears to depcit a jackal, although the body looks more like that of a cat (or possibly an Osirian sphinx). The head has the upright, pointed ears of a jackal and a jackal's bushy tail.

No one knows who built the Crouching Jackal or why, though some rumours claim that if a person sleeps in front of it, they will be transformed into a jackalwere. Other theories include the Crouching Jackal being a hollow and unopened treasure vault, or a vast construct used in ancient wars as a terrifying weapon. Many also believe that it is a sister statue to the lizard-like Creeping Watcher of the Vargas Swamp. Regardless of its original purpose, the Crouching Jackal can be seen for miles around and is used as a convenient landmark by local travellers.

properties.Name: Crow
properties.text: The Crow is one of the ten remaining pilings of the Irespan in Magnimar. Standing 220 feet high, there are no known entrances into the piling.

properties.Name: Crowhollow
properties.text: Crowhollow is a sinkhole in the Sellen Hills of northeastern Numeria, and the site of a piece of the Divinity that fell during the Rain of Stars. It is also the home of a half-mechanical lich named Alling Third, a former Technic League agent who sought immortality in order to fully exploit its technology.

properties.Name: Crypt of Angus Amberleg
properties.text:
The Crypt of Angus Amberleg is believed to be the resting place of not only the notorious and successful pirate, who ravaged the Inner Sea and plundered 100 ships, but also his treasure. It is located somewhere in the interior of Mediogalti Island and is arguably the most famous of the region's numerous pirate crypts.

According to legend, the crypt was built by slaves who became a permanent part of the construction by being buried alive once the work was finished. It is believed that their ghosts now guard the treasure along with the undead pirate himself.

The treasure is believed to include ancient artefacts and large jewels, some the size of an ogre's fist.

properties.Name: Crystal Falls
properties.text: The Crystal Falls is a 100-foot-tall waterfall in western Andoran, located in the southern Aspodell Mountains near the border with Cheliax. The beautiful site has the reputation of being haunted and is generally avoided by the local populace.

properties.Name: Crystal Palace
properties.text:
The Crystal Palace was the palace of Xin, founder of Thassilon, and the site of his death and location of his remains. Upon his death, the Palace itself became infused with his restless spirit. It is located inside of a mountainous spire of crystal at the city of Xin, on an island about 100 miles west of Magnimar in what was formerly the southern coast of the Thassilonian realm of Bakrakhan.

The Palace sank along with the rest of the island upon which the city of Xin was located during Earthfall, and it remained on the floor of the Arcadian Ocean until parts of the island were raised by adventurers in 4712 AR.

properties.Name: Crystalrock
properties.text:
Crystalrock is a large, natural cavern located in the Mindspin Mountains of south-eastern Varisia near the banks of the Falcon River. It was discovered by the dwarves of Janderhoff who also call it the "Heart of the World". Within the cavern is an enormous crystal formation which hangs suspended from crystal threads. Dwarven elders have gathered here annually for centuries to watch the formation shake and give off a low pulse which can be felt for miles around. Lately the "heartbeat" has been occurring more rapidly, a fact which has caused the dwarves much concern; at the moment, it is aligned to the changes of the seasons.

The cavern also gave its name to the Treaty of Crystalrock, signed here in 4472 AR between Janderhoff and the nearby Chelaxian city of Korvosa.

properties.Name: Cutter Canyon
properties.text: The Cutter Canyon is located east of the Mindspin Mountains on the Deepcut River. The canyon is overrun with bandits, bugbears, xulgaths, and minotaurs who make strongholds in the caverns and caves that dot the canyon. The adult crystal dragon Calcatrine has his hoard somewhere in the tunnels that connect the caverns.

properties.Name: Cynosure Tower
properties.text:
Cynosure Tower is the temple to the goddess Desna's within the Varisian city-state of Magnimar and is located in the south of the poorer Keystone district. Even though it is unusual for Desna's priests and priestesses to build permanent structures in her honor, they chose to do so in Magnimar because it is home to so many of her devotees, especially among the Varisians.

The building is circular with a central courtyard open to the sky, and is maintained by a single priestess, Bevaluu Zimantiu. The temple is named after the goddess' fabled home in the heavens, the Sevenfold Cynosure.

properties.Name: Daigaki Castle
properties.text:
Daigaki Castle (pronounced dai-ga-kee) is a haunted stronghold in southern Linvarre in Tian Xia, and the lair of a large group of undead led by the ghost of Tsubokandu.

After the fall of Imperial Lung Wa in 7108 IC, the city of Kamikobuâ€”now known as New Opparaâ€”was besieged by a dozen bandit warlords and Tsubokandu was considered the cruelest of them all. Tsubokandu was a disgraced samurai warlord from the neighbouring kingdom of Songbai who chose exile over an honourable death.

Tsubokandu was defeated by the founder of Linvarre's predecessor colony of Amanandar, General Orphyrea Amanandar, but after his death his ghost returned to Daigaki Castle and began gathering an army of the dead to reap some unknown terrible revenge.

properties.Name: Darkreach
properties.text:
The settlement of Darkreach was established on the Vanji River around 30 years ago. It was intended to serve as a trading post between the mines of the Bandu Hills and the markets of Bloodcove in the Mwangi Expanse and of western Sargava.

At first it thrivedâ€”only to be razed to the ground by forces unknown. The people vanished, and all that was left of the buildings was the charred outline of the foundations. No natural fire cuts buildings off smoothly at ground level, and leaves no ash behind.

Some suspect the Aspis Consortium of wiping out a competitor; others wonder if the diamond miners had taken action against the tariffs charged on river traffic.

properties.Name: Dauphenal Vineyard
properties.text: The Dauphenal Vineyard has existed since Nidal was under Chelaxian occupation. The vineyard produces a highly sought-after wine called Dauphenal alvarino.

properties.Name: Dawdlefoot Ranch
properties.text: The Dawdlefoot Ranch is a sheep ranch founded by a former Chelaxian halfling slave on the Nesmian Plains in Nirmathas. It was used by the Bellflower Network to smuggle slaves out from Cheliax and provide the former slaves with forged paperwork to start new lives. It is run by Hannah Dawdlefoot, the granddaughter of the ranch's founder. The ranch has numerous magical illusions along with mundane disguises and defenses such as thorny, poisonous plants.

properties.Name: Dawnflower Library
properties.text: The Dawnflower Library is a temple of Sarenrae and library located on 10 Dawnflower Street in the town of Otari, on the southern coast of the Isle of Kortos. Its high priestess is Vandy Banderdash, a talkative halfling woman. While the temple also hosts shrines to Cayden Cailean, Erastil, and Gozreh, most of the building is dedicated to its publicly available collection of books. The temple also offers medicine, magical healing, and divine spellcasting services.

properties.Name: Dbede
properties.text: The tower of Dbede is 100 feet tall and 50 feet wide and was built by termites. It dominates the skyline near the center of the Screaming Jungle in the southern Mwangi Expanse, and early explorers mistakenly assumed it marked the site of an ancient lost city. Millions of termites inhabit the tower, and they fiercely defend their home against any trespassers, as is evidenced by the thousands of clean-picked skeletons that litter the ground around it. The Screaming Jungle's intelligent inhabitants occasionally use the termites' ferocity to execute captives in a truly gruesome manner. Hundreds of similar termite mounds can be found on the Korir Plains north of the jungle, but none compares in size to Dbede.

properties.Name: Dead Man's Dome
properties.text: Dead Man's Dome is a cairn to a fallen soldier who died defending what used to be a mighty watchtower against a force of giants and undead. It is located far to the north of the continent of Tian Xia on the polar ice of the Crown of the World and overlooks the tundra basin of Ruun Uvas near the Path of Aganhei. The site is said to still be guarded by the spirit of the dead warrior whose name was never known.

properties.Name: Dead Slave Cove
properties.text: Dead Slave Cove is a barren beach of Raptor Island, one of the westernmost islands of the Shackles, located near the mouth of the island's main river of Broken Hope. Sailors use the wild island to maroon troublesome enemies captured in battle as well as malcontents and traitors. Most castaways deposited on Dead Slave Cove are destined to spend the rest of their lives on Raptor Island. The rocky shores and the jagged reefs prevent ships from approaching Raptor Island, so a ship must anchor about a quarter-mile offshore and use a longboat to reach Dead Slave Cove.

properties.Name: Dead Villages
properties.text:
The Dead Villages are a collection of abandoned villages in the Brazen Frontier section of southern Osirion. They were once inhabited by Pharasmin death cults who believed that one's afterlife could be positively influenced by choosing the time of one's demise. This led the villagers to engage in ritual combat to the death as well as suicide. These practices guaranteed that the cult soon ran out of members, leaving the villages empty.

As of 4714 AR bones could still be found in the central squares of these empty settlements, and distressed undead such as allips haunt them at night. Although the cultists believed they were worshiping Pharasma, its leaders secretly were devotees of Sifkesh, demon lord of heresy and suicide.

properties.Name: Deadeye Lodge
properties.text:
The wooden Deadeye Lodge is the city of Magnimar's church of Erastil, and is located in the northeast of the Keystone district on the edge of Seerspring Garden.

Looking more like a rustic hunting cabin, Deadeye Lodge seems quite out of place among the townhouses of the city, but that does not seem to bother the devotees of Old Deadeye, who attend in large numbers. Its head priest, Father Lorgell Fendus, holds services three times-a-week, and is known for his welcoming nature. The Lodge also hosts a dozen archers who serve their god by keeping the streets of Keystone safe for all. This brings them into occasional conflict with the similarly armed followers of Calistria's Dome of the Savored Sting, whose methods and morals while maintaining the peace are quite different.

properties.Name: Deadeye's Haunt
properties.text: Deadeye's Haunt is a narrow valley on the border between Molthune and Nirmathas, at the southern edge of Fangwood. It is the site of the bloodiest battle in the war between the two nations.

properties.Name: Deep Sky
properties.text: Deep Sky is a ruined fortress in the Napsune Mountains of Rahadoum that had once been settled by a group of Jistkan elementalists escaping the elemental storms at the Citadel of the Weary Sky with their elemental servants and golems. Under the elementalists' direction, it was constructed by four genies bound to obey their orders. However, the genies conspired to find a way to curse their masters, and succeeded in creating a curse that led to their masters' downfall.

properties.Name: Deepmar Penal Colony
properties.text: Under Chelaxian rule, Deepmar hosted a small penal colony known as Deepmar Penal Colony, where the prisoners mined crystals useful as arcane reagents. The prison camps were abandoned before Ravounel's secession in the Kintargan Rebellion, and the new government has let them remain so.

properties.Name: Defiant's Garden
properties.text: Defiant's Garden is the mayoral residence of the city of Magnimar, located in the Vista district directly next to the Seacleft. It is the largest and most impressive home in all the city. Defiant's Garden became the official mayor's residence only with the rise of the decadent Lord-Mayor Haldmeer Grobaras; before Grobaras, the mayor's residence was a humbler place within the city that kept him in touch with the people. Grobaras, however, wanted nothing so humble and took Defiant's Garden, which had previously been a palace for visiting dignitaries, as his personal home. The building itself is closer in scale to a small castle than a manor, at eight stories tall and filled with room after room of salons and lounges all devoted to the mayor's pleasure.

properties.Name: Delronge Estate
properties.text: Delronge Estate, located in The Greens district of Kintargo, Ravounel, is the home of House Delronge.

properties.Name: Deng
properties.text: The ruins of the city of Deng can be found on the on the southern coast of Cheliax on the Inner Sea. The dead of the city are said to rise at night and reenact the lives they lived as if nothing had changed.

properties.Name: Derexhi Villa
properties.text: Derexhi Villa is the seat of House Derexhi, one of the Varisian city-state of Magnimar's founding families. Located in the upscale Alabaster District, it is run by the family's head, Randred Derexhi, who is a member of the Justice Council.

properties.Name: Deromas
properties.text: Little is known about Deromas, a settlement of western Osirion during its First Age located in what is now Rahadoum. The city was known for its lawful nature and situated on the southern banks of the Uta River.

properties.Name: Desert's Mouth
properties.text:
Desert's Mouth is a black pit at the bottom of a conical hole in the shifting sand dunes of the Osirian Desert near the Thuvian border. It resembles the lair of a giant ant lion and its circular hole is a strangely regular entrance into a huge cavern which is probably connected to the Darklands. Phosphorescent gases drift out of the pit at night and those who stay too near the pit report hallucinations about dark caves dripping with water. Descending the sandy slopes is difficult but ascending is almost impossible. The Desert's Mouth hasn't been explored in recent memory but ancient texts describe forests of glowing fungus and strange crustaceans skittering in the dark.

The Yerbira are said to use the Mouth to execute those who breach their few taboos. They lower the condemned into the pit with a rope and throw the rope after him. If the condemned can climb out the pit he is considered forgiven. No one has ever climbed out the pit so far.

properties.Name: Desgard's Thousand Columns
properties.text: Desgard's Thousand Columns is an ancient Thassilonian ruin in eastern Varisia. It is a field featuring a large number of towered pillars and pylons of jagged crystal. They were used by the runelords of Sloth, particularly Krune, for conjuring armies of extraplanar forces to defend the realm of Haruka. They were activated by secret runes given to Krune by Lissala.

properties.Name: Desolation Blade Mounts
properties.text: The Desolation Blade Mounts are a set of mysterious mounds of hardened clay. No one knows who made them, but visitors often return with stone markers marked with a symbol of a pale hand and blackened blade on them.

properties.Name: Deverin Villa
properties.text: Deverin Villa is the main residence of House Deverin, an aristocratic family in the Varisian city of Magnimar. Located in the Naos district, Deverin Villa is currently occupied by Hobart Deverin, the head of the family. A walled compound with a central main building and several secondary structures, Deverin Villa is sandwiched between Kaijitsu Manor and the House of Welcome, Magnimar's most exclusive brothel.

properties.Name: Devi
properties.text:
The Devi is a 200-foot-tall statue located on an island in the Kalyan River, near where it becomes Sona Lake, in the Vudran region of Golden Basin.

The Devi depicts the legendary psychic Vanitapati, who defeated the Spawn of Rovagug known as Kothogaz, the Dance of Disharmony, at this site. The Devi is both a site of pilgrimage and potent psychic nexus.

properties.Name: Devil's Drain
properties.text:
Devil's Drain is a dangerous whirlpool in the Steaming Sea located between the coasts of Southmoor and the Ironbound Island of Dragon's Rib. On a good day there is just enough room either side of the Devil's Drain for a ship to pass through, though it is always treacherous. Using this route saves enough time on the passage to Varisia that desperate captains will still sometimes risk it.

Devil's Drain appears to be a natural occurrence formed by oceanic currents but adventurers who have returned from its depths report mysterious deep rifts in the ocean floor below it. To make matters worse, the area surrounding Devil's Drain has at times been home to dragon turtles, fjord linnorms, scyllas, and krakens who often drive ships into the whirlpool to feast on the shipwrecked sailors.

properties.Name: Devil's Nursery
properties.text: The slums of Devil's Nursery, located in the Redroof neighborhood of Kintargo, are named for the large proportion of its residents who are cambions, most of whom fled here from less tolerant corners of Cheliax.

properties.Name: Diggen's Rest
properties.text: Diggen's Rest is a watchtower in the Verduran Forest of eastern Andoran, north of the town of Fusil and on the border between Andoran and Galt. It served as the final location of the records from Pathfinder lodges once founded by Kerinha Napsunar, one of the first Pathfinders.

properties.Name: Dim Gate
properties.text:
The Dim Gate is an interplanetary gate deep beneath a peak in the Napsune Mountains of the eastern Sodden Lands. It is under construction by the lich diviner Meyi Panaho under the patronage of a mysterious being calling himself Tzriek, a bone sage from the dead planet Eox. Tzriek convinced Meyi to become immortal through lichdom in order to have the time to unlock the secrets of the universe.

A narrow trail winds up the mountain's peak to the Dim Gate complex's observatory, which overlooks a narrow, secluded valley. The mountains protect the observatory from the perpetually rotating arms of the Eye of Abendego that deluge the lowlands of the Sodden Lands, and the observatory's elevation provides a clear view of the sky on most nights. Skeletal champions patrol the grounds around the observatory, and a nightwing called Gloomtide soars above the site keeping watch for intruders.

properties.Name: Dinosaur Graveyard
properties.text: It is believed that the dinosaurs of Mediogalti Island are led by instinct to a specific site within the jungle interior when it is time for them to die. This dinosaur graveyard is said to contain countless dinosaur bones, which supposedly animate and attack intruders. Some legends claim that all of the island's unclaimed buried treasure has somehow found its way to the graveyard, where it lies among the bones.

properties.Name: Dome Hive
properties.text: The Dome Hive is one of the cyclopean monuments of ancient Thassilon, built with the labor of enslaved rune and stone giants. It is located in the modern Ironbound Archipelago, which was the Thassilonian nation of Edasseril.

properties.Name: Dome of the Savored Sting
properties.text:
The Dome of the Savored Sting is a church of Calistria in the Varisian city of Magnimar, and is located on the northern edge of that city's Keystone district. The building is topped by a yellow and black dome with a black spire, and is considered somewhat garish.

Access to the temple prostitutes is only granted by the priests and priestesses to those whom they deem worthy. The church also offers paid revenge services, which the temple mistressâ€”Ayamyra, as of 4712 ARâ€”personally oversees, and dispatches patrols of leather-clad ruffians to keep the peace in the Keystone district.

These patrols often run afoul of the archers sent out by the Deadeye Lodge, Magnimar's temple of Erastil. Conflict between the two groups is exacerbated by territorial disputes, compounded by differences in how each group accomplishes their goal of keeping the streets safe.

properties.Name: Domora
properties.text: The ruins of the city of Domora sit on the Sarkorian Steppe of the Sarkoris Scar, at the edge of a dried lakebed that once was the famous Sarkorian Hume's Pool.

properties.Name: Doorway to the Red Star
properties.text:
The strange Doorway to the Red Star lies north of Lake Ocota in the Mwangi Expanse. It consists of a ring of mysterious, humming red stones that hangs in an empty courtyard surrounded by overgrown cathedrals.

Its earliest recorded use was as the headquarters of a nihilistic cult called the Throat-of-Nothingness. Later, it was the stronghold of the King of Biting Ants: a sorcerer who was defeated long ago by the legendary Ten Magic Warriors, but the Doorway and the cathedrals were left untouched, by command of Old-Mage Jatembe himself. Indeed, some legends state that Jatembe himself slew the King of Biting Ants and then sealed up the ruins of the Doorway to the Red Star.

Those Mwangi spellcasters who possess the ability to tap into the latent spiritual energies of the ruins of their ancestors say that the Doorway to the Red Star is second only to the Ruins of Kho in potency.

Several Zenj tribes shelter in the triad of the half-collapsed cathedrals surrounding the doorway as even their ruined, crumbling structures are shelter against the harsh jungle. They never go too far inside the complex out of fear of the artifact within. A core group of powerful magi guardians known as the Iobane, led by Warder-Chief Mpondo, keep outsiders from reaching the Doorway to the Red Star, believing they dishonor their ancestors. They see themselves as the spiritual successors of the Ten Magic Warriors.

properties.Name: Dortrot Ranch
properties.text: Dortrot Ranch is a large horse ranch located on the plains of the eastern Gravelands just south of the Path River. The family of the owner, Chap "Old Man" Dortrot, has been raising both draft and warhorses there for 11 generations.

properties.Name: Dragon Temple
properties.text: The Dragon Temple, also known as the Celestial Dragon Temple, is a retreat in the Wall of Heaven mountains on the western border of Quain that is a famous center for martial arts training in Tian Xia. It is also a temple dedicated to the god Irori. Students come from across the continent, including distant Minkai, to study under the masters of the Dragon Temple.

properties.Name: Dragon's Gullet
properties.text: The Dragon's Gullet is an expansive tunnel which lies deep under the Sanctum of the Sorrowmaker on Dahak's Fang island in the Shackles. Aashaq sleeps and feeds in the Sanctum but she spends the majority of her time gloating over her precious hoard in the Dragon's Gullet. The entrance to the tunnel is a cave mouth at the bottom of Lake Rogshagrox which leads to a vertical cavern over 4 miles in length. The heat at the bottom of the Dragon's Gullet is unbearable.

properties.Name: Dragonfen
properties.text: The Dragonfen is a wetland in central Taldor. Centuries ago it was the domain of the great wyrm black dragon Aeteperax, until the creature was killed by Lady Tula Belhaim.

properties.Name: Dread Dungeons
properties.text:
High in the Fog Peaks of Galt is a building with a dark past, even by the blood-soaked standards of this anarchic nation. Built to house political prisoners and other undesirables, soon after its construction it was discovered that its deepest cells connected to tunnels that led even further below into the Darklands. The building built by a temporary government known as the Galtcreed Pact was named Galtcreed, but the deep tunnels and cells below were eventually named the Dread Dungeons. Some of the cells are infested with dangerous cytillesh fungus.

Primarch Bremovir, one of the leading lights of the Galtcreed Pact, allied himself with the dero of Kmlin-Bru, using them to seize dissidents from their beds and also to serve as some of the prison guards. The staff at the prison remained loyal to Bremovir, and he was able to flee here when the Galtcreed Pact was overthrown as part of Galt's endless cycle of revolution. Successive governments have tried to discover the prison's location, but without success.

Numerous prisoners were executed in the prison, and others have been taken by the dero for their warped experiments, but a considerable number still remain. It is rumoured that amongst their number is a prisoner who could bring lasting peace to troubled Galtâ€”the guards will not kill him but also dare not let him escape.

properties.Name: Dreamer's Reach
properties.text:
The barren peak of Dreamer's Reach is also one of the highest in the area. It holds special significance for the Kellid people, who often seek divine guidance at this site. They undergo a spiritual journey to the mountain's summit, where they remove all of their clothes above the waist and wait in the harsh cold conditions for a waking dream from Desna. Barring that, they continue waiting until spirits take them away to the Boneyard.

Despite its spiritual importance, Dreamer's Reach is a place rarely visited by animals and giants, thus, the physical challenges and exposure to the elements most threaten those who make the treacherous climb. However, this location is also a place where the boundary between the Universe and the Dreamlands is thin, and people who seek visions at Dreamer's Reach might find themselves engaged in fierce battles with nightmares that become dangerously real.

properties.Name: Dreaming Dryad
properties.text: The Dreaming Dryad is a high-class drug den in Magnimar. Situated in the Lowcleft district, customers receive privacy and uncontaminated drugs. Proprietor Vert Klydus designed the building to be a mix of maze-like corridors leading to variously sized rooms both above- and below-ground. The exterior's illusory appearance is of a beautiful glade. However, the glade appears to be sun-filled at night and nighttime during the day.

properties.Name: Dretha's Cradle
properties.text: Dretha's Cradle serves as the home and laboratory for the orc alchemist known as Mother Chot and her apprentices.

properties.Name: Driftwood
properties.text: On the shores of Katapesh, north from the metropolis of Katapesh, Driftwood is a seemingly inhospitable inlet ringed by sheer-walled cliffs. Jagged rocks protruding from the surf increase its treacherous appearance from the sea. Those familiar with the area, though, know how to navigate around the rocks and into the inlet, where a shallow, sheltered cove is revealed. While it is relatively unknown among the trade ships and slave galleys of the area, smugglers and pirates of the region are better informed.

properties.Name: Drillstones
properties.text: The Drillstones is one of the many Thassilonian ruins in the wilds of the Linnorm Kingdom of Southmoor. More than three dozen spire-like, 60-foot-tall stone monoliths rise from the northern Kodar Mountains foothills 50 miles southeast of Kopparberget. Each of these monoliths is decorated with strange spiralling gouges, almost as if they were immense drills sent up from underground. Each stone vibrates slightly to the touch, but some nights of the year these vibrations increase into a disturbing buzz. The stones' purpose is unknown, but a mysterious doorway was recently discovered at the base of one of the monoliths that leads to a strange labyrinth, and deactivated clockworks were found inside. Some scholars believe that the Drillstones were the upper edge of a war machine buried underground.

properties.Name: Droskar's Crag
properties.text:
Droskar's Crag is an active volcano located in the Five Kings Range. The mountain consists of two primary peaks known as the Hammer and the Anvil. The Hammer reaches 28,822 feet in altitude, while the Anvilâ€”which hosts the active crater known as Rovagug's Calderaâ€”is 28,305 feet tall and grows by about one and a half feet per year. These heights make Droskar's Crag the tallest known active volcano on Golarion and the Five Kings Range's tallest mountain.

Several rivers originate or are fed from glaciers on the Crag, including the Coldforge River (from the Coldforge glacier), the Slagiron River (from the Slagiron glacier), and the Goldmelt River (from the Gold glacier). The crag also hosts the East Gold, Sunset, Silver, Peakcrest, Eastrise, and Deaddrop glaciers.

The volcano last erupted in 3980 AR in a massive explosion known as the Rending, which destroyed the capital of Tar Khadurrm at Jernashall and transformed the region. At the time Droskar's Crag was known as Torag's Crag; its name was changed after the Rending to reflect the more hostile nature of the volcano, since the evil dwarven god Droskar is the patron of endless toil and suffering. To date, it has shown no major activity, though the peaks constantly spew ash and smoke into the air as a constant reminder of the threat that exists beneath the snow-capped mountain.

properties.Name: Droskar's Crucible
properties.text: Sleeping in the southern shadow of Droskar's Crag on the edge of Darkmoon Vale lies the now-ruined monastery once known as Droskar's Crucible. At its prime, the monastery was home to dwarven clerics of the malevolent god Droskar, who urged them to ever toil in making weapons on their great forges. The evil forge spurned which came as a result of their worship eventually drove the dwarves out of their haven, and left behind a now-haunted shell of a building. After its fall to decadence and decay, legends began to spread among the dwarves telling of vast riches now lost beneath the crumbling citadel. The greatest dwarven hero, Druingar the Glintaxe, ventured into the depths below the once-sacred site in search of secrets and the ancestral gauntlet the Grasp of Droskar, but he was never heard from again, and inhabitants of the Vale still talk of his ghost haunting the ancient ruins. In the dungeons beneath, the Truescale Kobolds now make their home, ever balanced between their desire to delve deeper into the earth and their fear of what frightening beings lie in wait for them there.

properties.Name: Drowning Stones
properties.text: The ruins of the city of Drowning Stones, located in the northern Mwangi Jungle of the Mwangi Expanse, were abandoned by its population when it began to sink into the swamp. It sits about halfway between the Olongo River to the north and the Vanji River to the south. Today, only the central fortress remains relatively dry. The city takes its name from the massive standing stones that served as pillars for the central forum.

properties.Name: Dunholme
properties.text: Dunholme is a ruined settlement in Taldor's Verduran Forest. The site fell victim to a mysterious event known as "the Dunholme Doom" in which an as-yet-unknown threat emerged from a well, first claiming the lives of townsfolk Verniya Klamer, Maix Vivermer, and Jasmique Tunhold. A trade road still runs through Dunholme toward Belhaim and Wispil further north.

properties.Name: Eagle Garrison Fort
properties.text: The Eagle Garrison Fort is a fortress of the Eagle Garrison located in the northern Kortos Mounts foothills, about 100 miles' travel from Diobel on land by way of Meravon.

properties.Name: Earthnavel
properties.text:
In the eastern Tusk Mountains of the Realm of the Mammoth Lords lies a deep pit that resembles an inverted 13-layer ziggurat. The layers are littered with the bones of massive animals; and the lower the layer, the larger the bones, until they dwarf those of the largest creatures known to walk the surface of Golarion today.

At the bottom of this pit is an opening just large enough to admit an average-sized humanoid, known as the Earthnavel, or sipapu to the local Kellid tribes. Below it stretch miles of freezing-cold tunnels which lead down into Nar-Voth, the upper layer of the Darklands. These passages show signs of collapse, suggesting that there may have once been larger tunnels here that extended beneath Nar-Voth into the deeper Darklands. It is possible many large beasts of the Tolguth in the Realm of the Mammoth Lords migrated there from Deep Tolguth in Orv via now-collapsed tunnels.

properties.Name: Edammera's Folly
properties.text: Edammera's Folly is a tall spire locked behind large rune-scribed steel doors. It is one of the Towers of the Fiendlorn constructed to serve the experiments toward immortality by Mesandroth Fiendlorn, but was sealed after a planar rift to the Netherworld opened in its base in -398 AR and flooded the tower with creatures of shadow.

properties.Name: Eel's Skull
properties.text:
The Eel's Skull is a disused fortress in the Shackles. It is situated on Nalt's Island located between Bag Island and Shark Island, standing at the edge of a sheer cliff on the northern expanse of the island's eastern shore.

At one time it was the fortress home of the notorious pirate Nalt Tarbrow. It is said that there are Ghol-Gan dungeons beneath the fortress, but Tarbrow destroyed the fortress in a fit of madness, and no entrance to any dungeon has been found in the ruins. Yet the lowest levels of Eel's Skull still hide an entrance to the ancient Ghol-Gani region of the Darklands known as the Sleepless Realm. The ruins are still visible from the ships passing and every sailor knows that wealth lies somewhere deep within the cursed castle's abandoned halls and caverns.

Only two adventurers are known to have emerged from the dread dungeons of Eel's Skull alive and both were terribly altered by the experience. No attempts restore either to full health or sanity. Their eyes remained blind and pupil-less, their skin remained ash white and they continued to tremor. One eventually committed suicide by setting himself on fire (as Nalt's own fiery end), while the other, a Pathfinder named Gelrue Palane, is last rumored to have set off for Besmara's Throne.

properties.Name: Egregzia
properties.text: The ruins of the Ghol-Gan city of Egregzia are located on the western side of the Terwa Lake in the Mwangi Expanse. The ruins are mostly buried beneath the alluvial grime that has spread from the lake in the thousands of years since Ghol-Gan's fall. Freshwater monsters lurk in the sunken structures of the dead cyclopes' waterside city, such as merrows, scrags, and ulat-kinis.

properties.Name: Ekbet
properties.text: The ruined city of Ekbet in Osirion is known as Gralgor-Ot by its sphinx residents. The ancient ruins are protected by the timeless guardians called living monoliths. These magically enhanced sentinels, powered by the sphinxes, protect the ancient ruins.

properties.Name: El-Amara
properties.text:
The ruins of el-Amara are in western Osirion, close to the border with Thuvia. The ruins lie close to where the Junira River and the Scarab River meet.

On the other side of the Junira, in nearby Thuvia, are the Ruins of Akhenaten.

El-Amara was once the provincial capital of Thuvia, when Thuvia was still part of the Ancient Osirion. It was abandoned and fell to ruin when pharaohs started to ignore their distant vassal state. It was in el-Amara that High Theurgist Fentet-Pesu, the last Osirian governor of Thuvia, was assassinated in -841 AR. Since its fall, few had visited the half-buried spires and crumbling bell towers of el-Amara, until a few centuries ago when disciples of Ahriman took to the ruins to establish a base near Osirion. As of 4712 AR, el-Amara was populated by sepid divs led by general Karesh-Ekhial and hordes of ghul and edimmu thralls.

properties.Name: Elara's Halfway House
properties.text: Elara's Halfway House was an orphanage in Darkmoon Vale located on a hill at the edge of Darkmoon Wood eight miles from Falcon's Hollow. It burned down under suspicious circumstances around 4707 AR with everyone within already dead, leaving it a fire-blackened ruin.

properties.Name: Elfmeet
properties.text: The Elfmeet is a location in Icemark where the Ilverani set up camp whenever they visit the region. They generally travel along a coastal route to avoid the dangers of the inner Stormspear Mountains. Elfmeet features a double ring of standing stones overlooking the sea. The Varki do not treat this site as one of their villages but often visit the location and engage in trade with Ilverani. The Ilverani are fond of Varki scrimshaw, and often trade potent magical items for well-crafted Varki art.

properties.Name: Embassy Building
properties.text: The Embassy Building in Magnimar is set aside for officially invited ambassadors from other countries. Many nations rejected the offer, but those who accepted exchanged functionaries and also receive lowered tariffs and increased trade. As of 4712 AR, the nations with representatives in Magnimar were Absalom, Andoran, Cheliax, Katapesh, Osirion, Qadira, Sargava (now known as Vidrian), Taldor, and Ustalav. Korvosa maintains offices here, but they are rarely used and remain empty most of the time. This two-story building is located in the city's Ordellia district.

properties.Name: Emerald Spire
properties.text:
The Emerald Spire is a strange ruin in the northwestern River Kingdoms. Located in a large clearing in the Echo Wood near the Crusader Road, six miles northeast of the Hellknight-ruled settlement of Fort Inevitable, the spire is well known to locals and travellers in the region.

Believed to be an Azlanti ruin from the era before Earthfall, most think the Emerald Spire refers to the ruins of large tower of green glass that rises above the clearing. However, the spire itself is far more ancient, a needle of magical crystal that reaches two miles into the earth, into the very vaults of Orv.

properties.Name: Emperor's Footprint
properties.text: The Emperor's Footprint is a massive sinkhole in the southern Chang Liao Jungle of the Tian Xia nation of Po Li. It is a sight of religious pilgrimage, but it rarely visited because of the many dangerous creatures and hostile Sunsu Godae tribespeople who live there. Those who survive the journey to the Emperor's Footprint find that prayer and meditation connects one directly to one's patron deity in Heaven. A rare purple flower that holds resurrection or geas powers, and only blooms once every 144 years, is also said to grow here.

properties.Name: Emperor's Pass
properties.text: Emperor's Pass is a mountain pass in the northern edge of the Southern Range mountains of Taldor, directly north of the town of Tribulation.

properties.Name: Endless Cairn
properties.text: The Endless Cairn is an ancient elven mausoleum located in the southern Fierani Forest of Kyonin near the border with the Tanglebriar.

properties.Name: Erithiel's Hall
properties.text: Erithiel's Hall is a serpentine earthen mound located in the western Fierani Forest of Kyonin. Several stories in height, between 20 feet to 100 feet across and several miles in length, the mound is said to predate the elves and is rumoured to be connected to the fey of the First World. According to the most popular myth, Erithiel's Hall is named for an ancient fey hero, Erithiel, who in the dawn of history fought against the earth serpent Garukresh. Their epic battle is said to have left deserts and seas in its wake before Garukresh was finally slain where he now lies at Erithiel's Hall. The victorious Erithiel supposedly then built a vast barrow-palace within the remains of his defeated foe. Those few elves who have tried to excavate Erithiel's Hall have found themselves plagued with bad luck and earning the hatred of the region's fey creatures.

properties.Name: Erran Tower
properties.text:
The Erran Tower is one of the aeon towers that Aroden placed around the Isle of Kortos. The tower is a 300-foot-tall mudbrick step pyramid with a flat top.

The tower is located on the east side of the Isle of Erran, and is responsible for magically giving life to the area.

properties.Name: Erspurn
properties.text: Little is known about Erspurn, a settlement of western Osirion during its First Age located in what is now Rahadoum.

properties.Name: Everrest
properties.text: Everrest is the ruins of a Chelaxian manor house built in the Nesmian Plains of Nirmathas by House Arvanxi before Cheliax lost its claim to Molthune and Nirmathas. Abandoned by House Arvanxi since the Chelaxian Civil War, the current occupants of the ruins are exiles of the Thornscar orc tribe, led by Krov Thirdmother, a fanatical follower of Lamashtu.

properties.Name: Eyes of the Bronze Man
properties.text: The Eyes of the Bronze Man are part of the Face of the Bronze Man, a bronze-plated monument to Pharaoh Djederet I (died -1653 AR) that is shaped in his likeness. It is located in southern Osirion's Brazen Peaks. Each of the eyes is an entrance to a played-out mine, one of tin and the other of copper, which legend tells were important to the development of bronzeworking in humanity's distant past.

properties.Name: Eyes of the Hawk
properties.text: Eyes of the Hawk is a monument in the Dockway district of Magnimar. It depicts the Eyes of the Hawk adventuring party and its twin wizards Cailyn and Romre Vanderale defeating the spider-like shriezyx in 4623 AR. Local lore suggests mediating here grants a mystical advantage when injuring aberrant creatures.

properties.Name: F & M's Exotic Meats
properties.text:
F & M's Exotic Meats, located in the Low Eastwind district, is a unique butcher's shop in the pirate capital of Port Peril.

F & M's Exotic Meats is run by the odd pairing of Mizrah, an aiuvarin cleric of the goddess of invention Brigh, and Festerscale, a kobold. With their unique magical storerooms that keep the meat cool, they can provide fresh meat to the people of Port Peril despite the tropical heat. They provide meat for a range of customers, from expensive prime beef and outrageous exotic meats to basic sausages.

Fewer people know that F & M's Exotic Meats also disposes of unwanted corpses, typically by surreptitiously incorporating them into one of their other clients' meals.

properties.Name: Faded Hall of Lorngrim
properties.text: The Faded Hall of Lorngrim was built by a long-forgotten dwarven lord of Zavaten Gura to serve as a summer palace. It is located in the Hills of Mournful Calling near the Avistani approach to the Crown of the World and overlooks a necropolis of dwarven tombs, barrows, and mausoleums.

properties.Name: Fair Fortune Livery
properties.text: The Fair Fortune Livery is a horse stable in the Redroof neighborhood of Kintargo, Ravounel. As of 4715 AR it had been abandoned and fallen into disrepair, but by 4724 AR it had been recently reopened by the Delronge family.

properties.Name: Falling Runewheel
properties.text: The Falling Runewheel is one of the cyclopean monuments of ancient Thassilon, built with the labor of enslaved rune and stone giants. It is located off the western coast of modern Varisia, which was the Thassilonian nation of Bakrakhan.

properties.Name: Fancy Reefclaw
properties.text: The Fancy Reefclaw is a gaudily painted, but successful, brewery located in Magnimar's Lowcleft district. The front is painted red and yellow, with an image of a well-dressed reefclaw. Owned by House Deverin, it is operated day-to-day by Golliver Haskinswurth. The brewery is best known for its raspberry ale and lambics.

properties.Name: Fangspire
properties.text:
Fangspire is one of the shelters of the Abendego Piercing created by the Knights of Salvation after the Eye of Abendego devastated the Sodden Lands.

The magically constructed tower of stone and metal has withstood the storms for centuries and remains in good condition. However, the storms have undermined its foundations, and as a result the tower leans over the sea at a dangerous angle.

Fangspire is the traditional domain of the largest of the region's boggard tribes. The constant warfare between the various boggard tribes ensures no tribe can claim the honour for very long.

properties.Name: Fangwood Keep
properties.text: Fangwood Keep is a fortress near the Nirmathasâ€“Molthune border in the Marideth River valley. Ownership of the fortress has alternated between the two nations since the beginning of the Nirmathi war of independence. It was built on top of the ancient tower of an elven wizard.

properties.Name: Farsouth Mine
properties.text: The Farsouth Mine is a site in the Mwangi Expanse section of the Bandu Hills close to the border with Sargava. It was founded in 4164 AR after gold was discovered here by dwarves.

properties.Name: Feasting Hall of Cayden Cailean
properties.text:
In Mivon of the River Kingdoms, an unusual hill devoid of vegetation has a ring of standing stones on its summit. At irregular intervals these stones transform into a feasting hall from which comes music and laughter, and those who enter on these occasions can join in the revelry. Some say that this is the Feasting Hall of Cayden Cailean, the god of ale and wine.

In the morning, the standing stones replace the hall once more, although the hillside reeks of ale and wine. As of 4710 AR, the last occurrence was also marked by the presence of a large quantity of blood among the stones.

properties.Name: Feathered Fox
properties.text: The Feathered Fox is an inn in the Jarvis End neighborhood of Kintargo, Ravounel, that serves traveling playwrights, theater directors, and writers who pursue their arts in the Silver City's creative venues. As of 4724 AR its proprietor was Tob Basalwain.

properties.Name: Felicity Vale
properties.text: Felicity Vale is a valley in the Nesmian Plains in Nirmathas. It once held a Kellid village, but the Kellids lost their home after a tyrant jelly took control of a hive of giant bees. The bees have made the vale's natural ecosystem very productive with numerous fruit trees and flowers growing there. Despite its seemingly idyllic nature, numerous adventurers and lost wanderers are sealed in wax in the giant bees' hive.

properties.Name: Fey's End
properties.text: Fey's End is a mysterious pit hundreds of feet deep. How it was formed and its exact nature are a mystery, but the effects it has on any nearby fey are clear. Fey creatures are drawn to the pit, and when they reemerge, they are dark, twisted versions of themselves.

properties.Name: Field of Bones and Black Glass
properties.text: The Field of Bones and Black Glass on Whyrlis Rock island in the Shackles is thought to be the field where the disastrous final battle between Raugsmauda and Gray Whyrlis occurred. The gruesome site is a magically dead zone about 4 miles in diameter. The place looks as though hundreds of skeletons clad in ancient armor were trapped and frozen in glassy black tar. A closer look reveals that the skeletal soldiers are fixed fast in solid obsidian as the earth beneath the victims boiled and solidified in seconds. Few adventurers dare to enter the place and snatch a sword or helm, and the field has remained undisturbed for thousands of years.

properties.Name: Field of Maidens
properties.text:
The Field of Maidens stretches across the southern border of Geb and appears to be large plain dotted with the statues of many female human warriors. The truth behind its origin is much more sinister, however.

In 4329 AR, the pirate queen Mastrien Slash led an army of warrior women in an invasion of the undead kingdom of Geb. They were driven north by conflict in their southern land of Holomog and sought to create a new home for themselves. The undead necromancer ruler of Geb, also called Geb, turned the entire army to stone, and today they are known as the Field of Maidens. Individual statues are occasionally transported off the Field and sold as macabre works of art all over the world.

Occasionally, the spirit of a dead warrior will somehow return and animate the stony corpse, transforming it into an undead creature known as a petrified maiden. If this occurs to a statue which has been removed from the Field of Maidens, it does whatever it can to return to the Field.

A medusa of mysterious origin known as the Lonely Maiden walks among the statues of the dreaded Field.

properties.Name: Fields of Jaadja
properties.text: The Fields of Jaadja are an area of plains in southern Garund located east of the Shattered Range and close to the southern border of Geb. It is bordered by the Copper River to the west, the Axanir River to the north, and the Jaadja River to the east and south.

properties.Name: Fields of Pain's Forgetting
properties.text: The hidden Fields of Pain's Forgetting in Ombrefell are filled with bio-luminescent, hallucinogenic mushrooms, white poppies, the powerful analgesic flayleaf, and other plants that produce some sort of addictive pain-relieving drug. Some are intentionally poisoned to expose black-market sellers of pain-avoidant substances heretical to Kuthite beliefs, while pure specimens are distributed to religious and independent torturers. Mistress Cultivator Preali Dhat, a representative of the Umbral Court, oversees distribution and fulfills requests.

properties.Name: Fiendslair
properties.text:
Fiendslair is one of the Towers of the Fiendlorn constructed to serve experiments toward immortality conducted by Mesandroth Fiendlorn. Related to Fiendlorn's experiments with reverse possession of a demon and forms of controlled undeath, it was sealed and abandoned after the assistant tasked with its maintenance, Eledwyn, attempted and failed to betray Fiendlorn. It is located in the Umbral Basin northeast of Ridwan.

An expedition to Fiendslair in 4714 AR, involving agents of the Aspis Consortium and rebels against House Thrune's rule over Cheliax in pursuit of a nightblade, resulted in a catastrophic failure.

properties.Name: Fifth Wind
properties.text: The Fifth Wind is a stone weather vane that rises from the Dockway district in Magnimar. The sides feature carvings of air elementals and cloud dragons. All of Outcast's Cove can determine the speed and direction by looking up at the windsocks. Those who spend time observing this monument are rumored to avoid seasickness.

properties.Name: Figwort Hollow
properties.text: Figwort Hollow is a marsh that feeds into the Deepcut River in the Nesmian Plains of Nirmathas. The Foxclaws travel to the marsh every summer to harvest figwort, which can be used either as a poison or medicine. Due to a Nidalese ruin in the marsh, there are rifts to the Netherworld, forcing the Foxclaws to fight off numerous incursions.

properties.Name: Firepelt
properties.text: The Firepelt is one of the ten remaining pilings of the Irespan in Magnimar. There are no known entrances into this piling, which stands 160 feet tall.

properties.Name: Firewatch Peaks
properties.text:
The Firewatch Peaks are a series of squat bunkers manned by soldiers from Ustalav located in the Tusk Mountains of the Hold of Belkzen, just south of Whisperfall Pass.

In total, there are twelve bunkers in operation, all under the control of the County of Canterwall and with the intention of monitoring orc (and sometimes dragon) activity in the area. The structures themselves predate the inhabitants of Ustalav, however, instead bearing markings of dwarven design.

In addition to underground tunnels, connecting each fortress, individual bunkers can communicate to each other (and the outside world) via trained hawks. More impressive is that in times of attack the stone roofs are capable of being lowered into the ground, making the bunkers virtually impervious to attack. This makes the defenses ideal against the ever-present threat of dragon attacks from Raschka-Tor.

The fortifications are often tested by orc attack, most notably from the nearby Skull Eater tribe.

properties.Name: First Step
properties.text: First Step is a massive fortress located at the heart of the Exalted Wood in the nation of Razmiran. Here, new recruits to the Church of Razmir are trained to become missionaries for placement both at home and abroad.

properties.Name: Fish Tank
properties.text:
Owned by Jaster Frallino, the head of the Magnimarian Sczarni gang known as the Gallowed, the Fish Tank bears images of glassy-eyed sea serpents and scandalously clad mermaids staring stupidly from this peeling sea-blue caravan wagon's timbers. Within, the roomy wagon holds a single battered stool and a four-foot-tall glass aquarium filled with murky water.

Inside the glass tank laze Frallino's three fat pet swamp barracudas: Verna, Argarno, and Big Mal. In Frallino's displeasure, several lazy thugs and untrustworthy business partners have lost a toe, a nose, or a whole hand to "The Boss's Fish," and more than one of the crimelord's enemies have gone into the tank head first. It is also rumored that the Sczarni boss keeps a collection of mysterious, rusted keys at the bottom of his chummy aquarium, guarded by his beloved pets.

properties.Name: Folly of the Feast
properties.text: Folly of the Feast is an abandoned orc settlement that still contains many orc skeletons from their last battle.

properties.Name: Footprint of the Lost Saint
properties.text: The Footprint of the Lost Saint is a massive cenote located in the midst of the arid grasslands south of the Mildanesi Mountains in Xopatl. The Footprint of the Lost Saint is believed to have been caused by the death of one of Xopatl's hero gods. Very few who venture to the Footprint of the Lost Saint ever return; those who do tell tales of enormous creatures made of living crystal, and claim the cenote hides a link to the Darklands. Some say the Darklands vault below the Footprint is abandoned, but others claim it is some sort of prison.

properties.Name: Forestheart
properties.text: Forestheart is a powerful rift between Golarion and the First World. It is a dark glade in the ancient Grungir Forest surrounded by giant trees. In the center of the glade there is an otherworldly calm and clear pool. By observing the reflections in the water's surface a visitor could look at any place in the First World and, by leaping into the pool, he could be transported to the place the pool was reflecting. The journey is one-way and the visitor has to find another way back. A capricious and demanding nymph named Imavajana guards the pool and controls the destinations.

properties.Name: Forgotten Track
properties.text: The Forgotten Track is a prison mine located at the bottom of a large canyon in a region of Razmiran known as the Tracks. Those who have lost faith in or displease the Church of Razmir are sent here; it is called the Forgotten Track because that is the eventual fate of most who are sent there.

properties.Name: Fort Dagh
properties.text:
Fort Dagh is located at the summit of a mountain peak south of Tar-Kazmukh and overlooks the Great Pass of the northwestern Five Kings Mountains. It is renowned for its view despite a reputation among soldiers as a hardship posting, and its commander is First Captain Hannah Drasten, a rare human among the Five Kings Mountains' militlary leaders.

A nearby peak bears the Carved Kings sculpture of King Kazmukh of Doggadth, which also overlooks the Great Pass.

properties.Name: Fort Hazard
properties.text: Fort Hazard stands on the bluffs overlooking Port Peril, capital of the Shackles. Its strategic position allows it to control both the town and the harbour. It was the stronghold of the late former Hurricane King Kerdak Bonefist. The tallest of its seven defensive towers is also the location of the lighthouse known as Besmara's Beacon.

properties.Name: Fort Indros
properties.text: Fort Indros is located at the north-easternmost point of Magnimar, amongst the riches of the Alabaster District on a spur of land that juts out into the Varisian Gulf. The fort is named after its designer Alcaydian Indros, the founder of Magnimar and a watchful paladin of Aroden. The fort gives an unmatched view of the surrounding Gulf and serves as a deterrent to any pirates (from Riddleport or anywhere else) who might think of attacking the city. The fort bristles with siege weapons and bowmen. As of 4707 AR, it was overseen by the dwarven commander Vanns Wynmerd.

properties.Name: Fort Landing
properties.text: Fort Landing is an ancient, ruined stone fortress on the western coast of the Isle of Terror in Lake Encarthan. The fort has crumbled over the centuries and is now little more than a series of interconnected walls that surround a partially collapsed tower covered in arm-thick ivy. The true name of the fort has been lost to time, and its current one stems from the fact that the white sand beaches near the ruin are the easiest place to land when approaching the island from the west. The ceaselessly blowing wind blows against the fort's western wall, sometimes forming sand drifts as high as 30 feet. The nightwing Jolanera actively avoids Fort Landing as part of an agreement made with the Whispering Tyrant.

properties.Name: Fort Morrine
properties.text: Fort Morrine is a Iomedaean fortification in disputed territory of the Hold of Belkzen.

properties.Name: Fort Nunder
properties.text: Fort Nunder is the Chernasardo Rangers' stronghold closest to the Nesmian Plains of Nirmathas. It sits against the west side of a steep hill called Nunder Scarp. Decades ago, the Rangers constructed a vault beneath the hill to secure specialized weapons and equipment. The two best trapsmiths among the Rangers, Dargrit Foehewer and Ekaterin Fletcher, built two separate, trapped passages leading to the vault. Fort Nunder is more of a storehouse than a fortress. A handful of barracks are available, but the bulk of the fort is dedicated to storage space.

properties.Name: Fort Ozem
properties.text: Fort Ozem is a Chernasardo Rangers fortress in Southern Fangwood. Fort Ozem was once used as a staging post in the war against the Whispering Tyrant. It is said that the fort was briefly home to Iomedae herself. The Rangers use it as a hideout. The worn outer walls are overgrown with vegetation. Its appearance has been deliberately neglected to indicate that there is nothing inside worth investigating. If enemies ever do draw near, the fort can be evacuated at a moment's notice.

properties.Name: Fort Rannick
properties.text: Fort Rannick is a remote fortress in the Valley of Broken Trees of central Varisia. Established by the mayor of Turtleback Ferry to help protect river-trading interests from the region's ogres, its rangersâ€”the Order of the Black Arrowsâ€”defended the river pass for more than four decades before being routed by ogres and ogrekin in 4707 AR.

properties.Name: Fort Ristin
properties.text:
Fort Ristin marks the easternmost edge of the Chernasardo region. It is one of the oldest structures in the Southern Fangwood and is made of weathered blocks of smooth, gray stone. Chernasardo Rangers have occupied the fort for decades. It provides an excellent staging area against Molthuni forces invading Nirmathas from the south. Its location makes it an ideal base for border patrols. The fort's four stout towers, large keep, and sturdy walls provide a formidable defense. Its architecture is distinctly Chelaxian.

Fort Ristin was constructed by a regional governor named Abdel Ristin during the Everwar.

properties.Name: Fort Scourbone
properties.text: Fort Scourbone is a location in northwestern Geb about which little is known. It is located on the western edge of the Shattered Range near the Mana Wastes.

properties.Name: Fort Serenko
properties.text:
Fort Serenko is an abandoned fortification in southern Brevoy. It is located along the Shrike River, upriver from the Crooked Falls.

This wooden fortification has stood for years, but with the growing tensions between Rostland and Issia, the soldiers and scouts stationed here have been recalled to Restov.

properties.Name: Fort Trevalay
properties.text: Fort Trevalay is the only fortress that the Chernasardo Rangers built entirely themselves. It is located in the Southern Fangwood and is constructed atop a massive stone column in the center of a spacious and deep gorge formed by the Sixjaws River. Fort Trevalay was built in 4687 AR of the same light gray stone that it stands upon and is accessible only via rope bridges. It was designed from the start to fully meet the rebels' needs. It features a training hall, war room, and forge as well as many other necessary accommodations. It is the most defensible of the Chernasardo Rangers' forts. The buildings within the fort are 10 feet high, except for the main tower which rises to a height of 45 feet. The stone curtain wall around the fort is 12 feet high and rises from the edge of the stone pillar upon which the fort is built.

properties.Name: Founder's Archive and Museum of Ages
properties.text: The Founder's Archive and the Museum of Ages are cultural and historical institutions that share a joint campus in the Capital District of the Varisian city of Magnimar. In Varisia, the museum is rivaled only by the Jeggare Museum in Korvosa.

properties.Name: Founder's Flame
properties.text: Founder's Flame is a magical fountain in the Naos district of Magnimar. Antholus Kaddren built it as a gift for city at its founding. Green oil fills the bronze bowl and is perpetually on fire. The color of the fire cycles from yellow to orange to violet to blue. Legend holds that if a spellcaster meditates here, she casts fire-based spells more strongly.

properties.Name: Founder's Honor
properties.text: Founder's Honor is a 50-foot-tall statue of Alcaydian Indros, the founder of the Varisian city of Magnimar, which stands near Castlegate in the Keystone district of the city. Offerings of fruits and flowers are regularly left within the lion's mouth alcove at the base of the statue; local belief is that this grants the person making the offering a piece of Indros' skill at diplomacy.

properties.Name: Fountain of Tabis
properties.text:
Countless adventurers have set off into the Mwangi Expanse in search of the fabled Fountain of Youth. It remains undiscovered (unless legendary Pathfinder Durvin Gest actually managed to find it).

However, the Fountain of Tabis in the north eastern Mwangi Jungle does grant youthâ€”at a price. Whoever drinks from it dies and is reincarnated as a young child, and not necessarily of the same ancestry or gender, with very little memory of their previous life.

The locals do their utmost to prevent outsiders from drinking from the fountain but adopt any who succeed and raise them as part of the tribe. Especially honoured tribal members may be allowed to drink from the fountain when they become old or infirm.

properties.Name: Foxglove Manor
properties.text:
Foxglove Manor is a haunted mansion on the western coast of Varisia (also known as the Lost Coast), approximately halfway between Magnimar and Sandpoint. Constructed in 4624 AR by minor Magnimarian noble Vorel Foxglove, and funded by the Brotherhood of the Seven, Foxglove Manor was intended to be the ancestral home of Foxglove's family for 100 years before reverting to the Brotherhood's ownership. Three generations of Foxgloves have met tragic ends in the Manor, from Vorel and his wife to Aldern Foxglove, who perished in 4707 AR. The manor consists of three stories overlooking a high sea cliff, a basement and natural cave network, and a ruined outbuilding.

As of 4710 AR, Foxglove Manor is believed to still be haunted by Vorel's malign spirit and is currently uninhabited.

properties.Name: Friendly Merchant
properties.text:
Despite its name, the tavern known as The Friendly Merchant is anything but. Located in the Shadow of the vast Irespan in the Underbridge slum district, The Friendly Merchant is run by an aiuvarin named Siov Cassimeel, who uses this ramshackle tavern as a front for petty crimes, but specialises in smuggling by using hidden docks attached to the tavern.

Siov rents out the docks to anyone willing to pay his high prices, though he drops the price for any member of the Night Scales. He is also rumoured to keep track on anyone using his dock and reports them back to the Night Scales.

properties.Name: Frost Giant's Fist
properties.text: Frost Giant's Fist is a huge fortress made of bone and granite that perches atop the southern edge of the Winterwall Glacier in the Bleakmarch province of Irrisen. It is the prison-fortress of the prideful frost giant Jarl Ceszac, who marched alongside Baba Yaga and commanded a legion of frost giants and young white dragons during the Winter War.

properties.Name: Frothripper
properties.text:
Frothripper is a waterfall about 200 feet tall that is fed from the Kortos Mounts north of Absalom.

The waterfall hides an abandoned bardic college once known as Allegro College.

properties.Name: Frozen Pines
properties.text:
The Frozen Pines is a nightmare glade in the Grungir Forest that even the forest's fey fear to visit. This frozen region consists of several dozen square miles of territory.

Its pine trees have adapted to the frost, but nothing else grows here, including any of the forest's normal undergrowth. Frozen Pines is said to be under the control of the White Witches of Irrisen, but in truth it serves as the hunting grounds for powerful wendigos.

properties.Name: Gallowspire
properties.text: Gallowspire was the former fortress-headquarters of the Whispering Tyrant, and until 4719 AR was the prison wherein the powerful lich was confined after his defeat in 3827 AR at the end of the Shining Crusade. It was located in Ustalavic county of Virlych, at the center of the destroyed city of Adorak, and consisted of a single tower of jagged black stone and torn iron, with an extensive dungeon complex below. Gallowspire, which also acted as a headquarters for the Whispering Way, was destroyed in 4719 AR when Tar-Baphon freed himself from his imprisonment, and now only a blasted crater remains where the tower once stood.

properties.Name: Ganderhal's Lair
properties.text: Ganderhal's Lair is an underground vault on the Chelaxian side of the Menador Mountains, where the mountains form the border between Cheliax and Nidal. The lair is north of the Doracium River and south of the Nidalese settlement of Ridwan.

properties.Name: Gap of Valballus
