properties.text: The Gap of Valballus is a wide, low mountain pass that connects the Hold of Belkzen to Ustalav to the east. It runs between the Tusk Mountains to the north and the Hungry Mountains to the south. Orc raiders traverse the Gap to sack the Ustalavic settlements in Canterwall. Varisian caravans and merchants also use the pass heading to or from Urgir.

properties.Name: Garden of Lead
properties.text: The Garden of Lead, also known as the Pleasure Palace of the Dead, is a horrifically haunted place even by the standards of Virlych. It hosts endless "parties" among pools of molten metal where tortured ghosts of costumed revelers and undead servants provide grotesque entertainment for their dread mistress, the Skeleton Countess Dissayn.

properties.Name: Gardens of Delight
properties.text: The Gardens of Delight, or Garden of Delights, are a gigantic tiered group of gardens located in the Holoma province of Juttar. The gardens are presided over by Juttar's Grand Omwa Holo Enyana's palace, and host not only beautiful plants but also a large menagerie of unusual and magical animals. The wildlife here is entirely tame, and celestial hybrids of dinosaurs native to Holomog display particularly unusual and eye-catching characteristics.

properties.Name: Gauntlight
properties.text: Gauntlight is a ruined keep on the edge of the Fogfen swamp near Otari that includes a lighthouse. Unbeknownst to the nearby town's residents, the keep's dungeons extend deep below ground.

properties.Name: Gecko
properties.text: The Gecko is one of the ten remaining pilings of the Irespan in Magnimar. Standing 250 feet high, this piling is still connected to the bridge's deck. There is an entrance into the piling, but it is rumored to be haunted.

properties.Name: Gembasket
properties.text: The Gembasket spans an area in the Barrier Wall mountains approximately a mile in diameter, across razored peaks, unexpected drops, rocky ground, and impassable rises. Natural resources are abundant within the Gembasket, including nodes of gemstones, precious metals, and veins of minerals that run its rocky walls. A narrow and dangerous path navigable only by experienced travelers winds up through the mountains to the Gembasket.

properties.Name: Gensmaren
properties.text: The ruins of an ancient Taldan supply post, Gensmaren is located in the Vergan Forest of Razmiran and is now the lair of a stranded group of driders who try not to attract the attention of the local human authorities.

properties.Name: Gerduhm
properties.text: Gerduhm is an extremely secret dwarven fortress located high in the Tusk Mountains of the Hold of Belkzen, approximately 50 miles north of the Cenotaph. It is operated by the Oathkeepers, a society of dwarven priests of Kols who help maintain an ancient bloodline.

properties.Name: Ghasterhall
properties.text:
Ghasterhall is an infamous library located in Virlych. It is also known as the Palace of Travesties. Although a place of retained knowledge, Ghasterhall displays horrific methods of storing information. Ghasts possessing oracular power stalk the blood-splattered halls and dead victims are nailed to the walls, used for necromantic experimentation.

Ghasterhall has been described as an inverted tower-pit, serving as both prison and library. The demi-lich Geir acts as head researcher for the Whispering Tyrant, establishing himself as curator of the massive library, laboratory, and prison. Although a horde of undying scholars still possess tremendous accumulated knowledge, only Geir continues with his endless experimentation on esoteric matters. Ambition for dark knowledge has waned with the imprisonment of the Whispering Tyrant.

For a time, Lucimar the Lich-Wolf sequestered himself in the prison-library. Today, Ghasterhall acts as a headquarters for the Whispering Way.

properties.Name: Ghataking
properties.text: Located in the central Napsune Mountains of Rahadoum, the mountain Ghataking is most famous for the foul inhabitants who dwell upon it. Ghataking is the lair of a zahhak, a powerful type of azi dragon, named Khanjar-Khanayr but more commonly known as "Stone Maw". He lairs on this peak awaiting a divine prophecy delivered by foul Ahriman himself and is served by a cult of Usij, evil div-worshippers all but wiped out by the church of Sarenrae.

properties.Name: Ghorcha Pass
properties.text:
The Ghorcha Pass, or Ghorcha Passage, is a rugged and hilly valley primarily in the Ustalavic county of Amaans, but also spreading into Virlych. The area is located in the Hungry Mountains, but with higher mountains on the western and eastern side, traveling north or south through the Ghorcha Pass is relatively easier than trekking through the harsh mountains.

Despite this, few are willing to travel there as it is believed that the valley is haunted by strange whispers and hunting undead. Such rumours are passionately spread by the local populace of Amaans, and the supposed dangers are the lingering legacy of the imprisoned Whispering Tyrant in Virlych.

properties.Name: Ghorvaul's Crossing
properties.text: Ghorvaul's Crossing is a small pass through the Mindspin Mountains into Molthune and is guarded by the colossus Speakers of the Ehrotai.

properties.Name: Gilded Cage
properties.text: The Gilded Cage is renowned as Magnimar's most decadent night spot. A garishly decorated club in Lowcleft that is built directly into the cliffs of the Seacleft itself, the Gilded Cage is known throughout the city. It is run by a former prima donna of the more classy Triodea theater called Jayleen Mordove who, despite her role as a night club owner, still maintains many connections with the city's artistic elite.

properties.Name: Gloaming Arbor
properties.text: Gloaming Arbor is a region of the western Verduran Forest with an intense connection to the Netherworld.

properties.Name: Gloaming Wood
properties.text: The Gloaming Wood is a small and light evergreen woodland in the Nesmian Plains of Nirmathas, west of the Inkwater River. An elven ruin predating Earthfall known as Glemrielle is located inside the forest and contains many wards to drive out and control fey creatures that remain in effect; the Gloaming Wood still contains no fey creatures. A Pathfinder Society expedition led by the gnome Thisben Gibwane has been exploring the area, but the scholars are mainly gnomish and their fey nature has led them into deep paranoia.

properties.Name: Gloomspires
properties.text: The Gloomspires are a collection of rocky spires that rise from the Arcadian Ocean. They are located due south of Mediogalti Island, north-northwest of the Shackles, and southwest of the Eye of Abendego.

properties.Name: Godsgate
properties.text: The Godsgate is the largest gate in the outer walls of the Andoren capital of Almas. It is also the easternmost gate, and from here visitors can easily access the East Hill, Portside, and Liberty District. Ever since the People's Revolt of 4669 AR brought democracy to the nation, the doors of the Godsgate have never been closed, a source of great pride for the people of Almas.

properties.Name: Gold Canyon
properties.text:
Gold Canyon is not a natural canyon but rather the remains of an ancient strip mine used in Taldor's early history. It is located in Meratt County within Tandak Prefecture, east of Cassomir. The ravine is 80 feet wide, 30 feet deep, and runs for almost 10 miles in total, and its bottom is filled with stagnant water.

It once had a stone bridge crossing it, but this collapsed decades ago during a small earthquake. While it is the responsibility of Baron Telus, he has shown no interest in repairing the structure. Locals on foot can still cross the canyon relatively easily due to steps cut into the canyon's already stepped sides, but this route is impassable for horses and wagons.

Gold Canyon once boosted a rich vein of gold and quartz that was mined out over 4,000 years ago, and most of the metal was used to mint early Taldan currency. The canyon is thus a minor holy site of Abadar, and local worshippers make small pilgrimages to the site. Such followers search the bottom of the canyon for any remaining gold, taking even a small flake of it as a sign of Abadar's favour. Unbeknownst to these pilgrims, the canyon's floor is also home to a dangerous snake-like creature known as a Goldpebble.

properties.Name: Golden Aerie
properties.text: The Golden Aerie is the headquarters of the Eagle Knights of Andoran, and is located at the center of the Field of Concord in the Liberty District of the capital city of Almas.

properties.Name: Golden Cathedral
properties.text: The Golden Cathedral is a former temple of Aroden located in the Liberty District of Andoran's capital city of Almas. Situated at the east end of the Field of Concord, this structure has been re-purposed as a library and repository of work dedicated to the concept of Common Rule.

properties.Name: Goldenflame
properties.text: Goldenflame is an abandoned college town in southeastern Lastwall, immediately north of the Iomedaean Goldenflame College.

properties.Name: Golemworks
properties.text: The Golemworks is one of the most iconic industries in Magnimar. As its name implies, it produces golems.

properties.Name: Gorum Pots
properties.text: Gorum Pots are a site of abundant geothermal hot springs and mud pots located in the Numerian Plains region of central Numeria, near the source of the Dagger River. It is a traditional breeding ground for the dangerous insects known as zhen worms.

properties.Name: Gorum's Tankard
properties.text: Gorum's Tankard is a dark lake in the foothills of the Stormspear Mountains in the north of the Thanelands in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. It is the setting for tales about the hero Bjorlan and his enemy, the dragon witch Aservalg. As of 4711 AR, the lake was guarded by dwarven druids.

properties.Name: Gozarin Necropolis
properties.text: The Gozarin Necropolis is a vast field of tombs, crypts, and graveyards within the Tremor Valley in central Osirion, west of the Pillars of the Sun.

properties.Name: Gozreh's Pool
properties.text:
Gozreh's Pool is located in the Mwangi Jungle, north of the Ocota River. It is 15 feet across and is nearly a perfect circle. The unusually cool and clear pool is home to a pair of water elementals, which require that the pool is shown the proper respectâ€”typically evidenced by some form of prayer or sacrificeâ€”before it is approached.

A dip in the pool is refreshing, and also reputed to cure any disease or parasitic infection contracted in the jungle.

properties.Name: Grand Exchange
properties.text: The Grand Exchange is the largest money exchange in the Andoren capital of Almas. Located in the East Hill neighborhood of the mercantile Portside district, it stands close to Godsgate, and is home to agents and currency exchanges from nearly every nation of the Inner Sea region. These factors deal not only in their own currency, but also in information, alliances, and veiled threats. Many adventurers come to the Grand Exchange looking for sponsorship to explore Golarion's hidden corners.

properties.Name: Grand Grounds of the Splendid Statuary
properties.text: The Grand Grounds of the Splendid Statuary is a market and showcase of statuary near Rhuzam, Druma, that is owned and operated by the dwarven Prophet Jurgan Khrest. Khrest has long employed the finest sculptors from across the Inner Sea region to craft the mundane and magical works he displays on the grounds, though his expenses have begun to overtake his profits and he has begun resorting to using his sold statues to scry secrets from his fellow prophets.

properties.Name: Grand Temple of the Peacock Spirit
properties.text: The Grand Temple of the Peacock Spirit, headquarters of the cult of the Peacock Spirit, is located on an island in a lake within a hidden valley near the source of the first tributary of the Chavali River, deep in the Kodar Mountains.

properties.Name: Grave of Moyoshi Shoda
properties.text:
The grave of Moyoshi Shoda is the burial site of the hobgoblin warlord who founded the nation of Kaoling. The site includes a shrine of four statues depicting Shoda as a youth, a young leader, Kaoling's Warlord, and an elder advisor, and the crypt containing the bones of Shoda and his War Generals of the Council of Nine. The crypt is also surrounded by grave markers of those killed during the War of Redemption.

Military leaders make pilgrimages to the site, which is tended to and protected by an honor guard.

properties.Name: Gray Falls Lodge
properties.text:
Just west of the Embeth Forest, a gray and weather-worn gristmill leans wearily over a trickling stream that slowly feeds into one of the dozens of winding tributaries of the Sellen River. The gristmill belongs to Sayrin Firewyne, a gnome with a romanticized interest in her fey roots who specializes in the lost knowledge of the First World.

The Gristmill serves as the front for the unlikely venture-captain's Pathfinder lodge, called the Gray Falls Lodge. It also serves as a sanctuary for a handful of local fey, in addition to being the permanent residence of a small band of pixies who nest in the rafters, and a nixie who resides in the stream.

The Gristmill contains an observatory and is powered by a secret magical contraption that resides behind a waterfall near the cottage.

properties.Name: Great Temple of Lissala
properties.text: The Great Temple of Lissala, located in central Bakrakhan, was the largest and most famous temple of Lissala, the patron goddess of Thassilon, and home to the Chalice of Lissala, an artifact gifted by the goddess herself. The temple sank beneath the Varisian Gulf when Earthfall hit, and it is now home to Vanush, a kraken who uses the Chalice of Lissala to lure sailors to their dooms. Vanush seeks to gather sacrifices and relics so the kraken can restore Lissala's faith in the Inner Sea region, with itself as leader.

properties.Name: Greengate
properties.text: The Greengate is Kintargo's easternmost gate, located in The Greens district. It is the main overland link with the rest of Ravounel, and as such it normally remains closed. The Greengate is mostly used by visiting dignitaries and nobles but sees little actual trade, unlike the busier Nightways Gate to the north.

properties.Name: Greenwall House
properties.text: Greenwall House is a tenement standing in the somewhat forlorn Villegre district of Kintargo. It is known to be inhabited by at least one member of the fallen, former aristocracy of Kintargo.

properties.Name: Ground of Lost Tears
properties.text: The Ground of Lost Tears, located in the Ustalavic county of Odranto, is the site of a brutal massacre that occurred during the Demonskin War.

properties.Name: Growling Skald
properties.text: Growling Skald is a mountain ridge of the larger Mindspin Mountains range that contains one of its few volcanically active areas. The low rumble churning underneath is a clear sign of geological activity, though the more poetically minded say that the rumble is a restless giant spirit that haunts the ridge. The ridge's elevation averages 11,000 feet.

properties.Name: Gruankus
properties.text: The massive rune-covered wheel of Gruankus lies half-buried on the shore of the Varisian Gulf. Presumably a Thassilonian artifact, its original purpose remains unknown, much the same as the Cyphergate in Riddleport to its east. It was the location of the signing of the Treaty of Gruankus between the pirates of Riddleport and the leaders of Magnimar at some point after 4607 AR, ostensibly to reduce the danger of piracy to traders travelling the Varisian Gulf.

properties.Name: Grundlescorn Lair
properties.text: The Rovagug-worshipping hag sisters Grava, Mopple, and Polnivaar Grundlescorn dwell in a marshy section of Ravounel Forest known as Grundlescorn Lair, in a ramshackle hut partially built into the boughs of an ancient oak tree and supported by several crooked but sturdy stilts. The hut overlooks a low hillock in the marsh atop which the hags keep their cauldron and fire pit.

properties.Name: Guardians
properties.text: The Guardians are a monument in Magnimar's Naos district, located just inside the Twins' Gate at the south end of the Avenue of Hours. Two 200-foot-tall statues depict the local twin heroes Cailyn and Romre Vanderale, who saved the burgeoning settlement of Magnimar from a shriezyx attack unleashed from the Irespan. The statues wield flaming staves that form the namesake arch of the city's Grand Arch district. Scholars of magic maintain that studying this monument improved their concentration.

properties.Name: Guardians
properties.text: The Guardians are a monument in Magnimar's Naos district, located just inside the Twins' Gate at the south end of the Avenue of Hours. Two 200-foot-tall statues depict the local twin heroes Cailyn and Romre Vanderale, who saved the burgeoning settlement of Magnimar from a shriezyx attack unleashed from the Irespan. The statues wield flaming staves that form the namesake arch of the city's Grand Arch district. Scholars of magic maintain that studying this monument improved their concentration.

properties.Name: Guidestar of Desna
properties.text: The Guidestar of Desna is a haunted lighthouse and former temple to Desna located on Phahalen Island's southern cliffs. Despite being unmanned, its light still serves as a beacon for ships traveling around the Eye of Abendego.

properties.Name: Guiltspur
properties.text: Guiltspur is an ancient Thassilonian ruin on Varisia's northern Storval Plateau connected to the dread realm of Leng.

properties.Name: Gull
properties.text: The Gull is one of the ten remaining pilings of the Irespan in Magnimar. There is an entrance to the interior of the piling located near water level. This 250-foot-tall tower is still connected to the bridge deck. Local rumors indicate the Sczarni use the interior as a base; and indeed it is the home of the particularly unpleasant Creepers gang of Sczarni.

properties.Name: Gutblood Labyrinth
properties.text:
The Gutblood Labyrinth is located in the Rechiend's Plains, in a section of mostly featureless grassland west of Free Station in the western Mwangi Expanse. It is beneath a fissure so abrupt that many unwary travellers have nearly fallen into it. It is so treacherous that the locals know it as "Calistria's Grin".

Those who descend into the fissure find nothing for hundreds of feet until reaching depths where the sun is but a memory. In its deepest reaches, a series of disconnected caverns dot both sides of the fissure and wind off in every direction for miles.

Though once part of the region of the Nar-Voth known as the Sleepless Realm of Reguare, the Gutblood Labyrinth was cut off from the wider region for reasons unknown. The only hint at what the ancient Ghol-Gani cyclops might have been trying to contain is in the bodies of those who try to explore the Gutblood Labyrinth's depths. Within weeks Their corpses inevitably wash up along the coast of the Fever Sea bloated and mutilated almost beyond recognition.

properties.Name: Gyanpad
properties.text: Gyanpad is a mountain within the larger Lohaparbat Mountains of Vudra. It is most famous for the garuda monk Mahadev, who has meditated near its peak for over a decade. A small cult has developed around Mahadev to help keep his body nourished and alive, although they claim his spirit has already ascended to a higher plane and may be in the process of becoming a god. Mahadev's psychic emanations have also drawn monstrous yetis and wendigos to Gyanpad and the surrounding area.

properties.Name: Habe's Sanatorium
properties.text:
Habe's Sanatorium, formally known as the Saintly Haven of Respite, is south of Sandpoint along Cougar Creek near the Ashen Rise.

Erin Habe used his wealth from years as a mental health and diseases expert in Magnimar to build the sanatorium. To raise funds for upkeep and his research, Habe has taken a silent partner, the elderly Varisian Caizarlu Zerren. Habe employs two cambion brothers, Gortus and Gurnak, as orderlies. Habe maintains a working laboratory where he conducts experiments on his patients that might cross ethical boundaries.

properties.Name: Haeringar's Keep
properties.text: Haeringar's Keep is the massive fortress of Haeringar the Everlasting. It is located in the Irriseni province of Feyfrost just south of the edge of the Winterwall Glacier. The fortress has enormous walls and 18 ice-encrusted stone towers which are patrolled by ice elementals. Haeringar's Keep was built there long before Baba Yaga's Winter War. Haeringar is an ancient fiendish frost giant oracle who is revered by the frost giants of Irrisen and Winterwall Glacier. Even the great Jarl Grungginnir of Holvirgang presents himself to him for counsel and blessings. Haeringar eats human flesh and is attended by a harem of ogresses. The gates of the fortress are always open but all the past adventurers, who have entered the keep trying to steal Haeringar's vast treasure, have failed.

properties.Name: Halfling Coast
properties.text: The Halfling Coast is part of the southern shoreline of the largest of the Rampore Isles in the Shackles. The cruel rakshasa Bedu Hanji, who rules the Rampore Isles, has maliciously named it "Halfling Coast" because he used to crucify captured sailors from Bag Island ships there.

properties.Name: Hanging City of Teskra
properties.text: The Hanging City of Teskra is an ancient ruin of the Jistka Imperium, located in the modern-day nation of Rahadoum in the Napsune Mountains.

properties.Name: Harborhorn
properties.text:
The Harborhorn is the home of Port Peril's harbormaster, who is responsible for inspecting every ship that docks at the pirate port. It is located on its own small island just off the larger island of Crescent Harbor.

As of 4712 AR, Harborhorn was the home of the notoriously stern dwarven harbormaster Tsojmin Kreidoros. Little goes on within the bustling city that escapes the harbormaster's notice.

properties.Name: Harbormaster
properties.text:
In Magnimar, the Harbormaster refers to the building housing the harbormaster. As of 4712 AR, the harbormaster was Vert Aigerd, who replaced Odie Phexen by displaying an incredible ability to memorize ship schedules and names.

This three-story stone building is located in the Beacon's Point district. The distinctive red skiffs of the Harbormaster guides ship traffic through the complexities of Outcast's Cove.

properties.Name: Harpy
properties.text: The Harpy is one of the ten remaining pilings of the Irespan in Magnimar. It is still connected to the bridge deck, which is 250 feet above the water. There are no known entrances into the piling. This piling is the home and workshop of Ayavah, a cambion artist.

properties.Name: Haunted Crater Lakes
properties.text: The Haunted Crater Lakes are a series of five bodies of water northwest of the town of Slipcove on Bag Island. They are believed to have been created following impacts from meteorites several hundred years ago. The entire area is believed to be haunted by ghosts from the asteroid-belt known as the Diaspora according to Amberose Ysilde, who lives in Rumbutter.

properties.Name: Hawk's Nest
properties.text: Hawks' Nest is the fortress-headquarters of the Daggermark Assassins' Guild in the River Kingdoms.

properties.Name: Heavywater Perch
properties.text: Heavywater Perch is a tiny site, little more than a single large rock near the southern end of Pangalley Atoll in the Shackles. The site's sole resident is a beautiful merfolk, Crimson Clepsana, with a tail of an enormous red snapper. She can usually be found sitting atop the rock when the Screaming Reaver is leaving or returning to port. The residents of Fort Benbem stay away from Heavywater Perch for fear of being enchanted by Clepsana's captivating song that lures many unwary sailors to their deaths. Captain Coal-Dark has informed her crew that anyone found staring at the sensuous merfolk while aboard her ship will receive a dozen lashes from her wicked cat-o'-nine-tails. As a precaution, she uses moist kelp to plug her crew's ears. Some of the crew wonder why Coal-Dark fails to simply take care of the seductress herself.

properties.Name: Heibarr
properties.text:
The ruins of Heibarr are situated on a branch of the Sellen River in the River Kingdoms, downstream of Mormouth in Pitax and upstream of Outsea.

It was established in 3756 AR, eventually becoming established on both sides of the river, with a bridge in 4109 AR linking both sides. The settlement prospered until 4434 AR, when Mayor Aindon decided to build a toll gate underneath the bridge in order to tax river traffic in contravention of the third of the River Freedoms.

Discontent over the mayor's actions turned to open revolt thanks to the seditious activities of followers of Gyronna. Civil war was the result, and within twelve months the town's three thousand inhabitants were all either dead or fled, and the toll gate was destroyed. It is now a place of pilgrimage for priests of Gyronna, who leave offerings on the edge of the town.

Since then, few who have entered the ruined town have returned to tell the tale. Generally, the survivors are those who did not remain after sunset, and who did not take anything from the town. It is said that every person who died in the city now walks the streets as an incorporeal undead creature. At night they re-enact the carnage that resulted in their deaths.

The bridge still stands, and those brave (or foolhardy enough) to use it to cross the river prefer to enter the town at dawn and leave before dusk. Those who navigate the river through the town after dark have reported that sometimes ghostly figures stare at them from the river banks.

properties.Name: Heidmarch Manor
properties.text:
Home of the noted Pathfinders Canayven Heidmarch and Venture-Captain Sheila Heidmarch, Heidmarch Manor is the first Pathfinder lodge in all Varisia, serving as the Pathfinder Society's base of operations into the rest of Varisia. Heidmarch Manor is located in Magnimar, the so-called "City of Monuments", within the prosperous Alabaster District of the city's wealthy Summit area. The manor lies just north of the Triodea in the neighboring Naos District. The manor contains all the usual amenities of a Pathfinder lodgeâ€”including some with a Varisian twist.

As the lodge is also the residence of Canayven and Sheila Heidmarch, it contains their personal residence decorated with mementos of their earlier adventures, ranging from Taldan suits of armor to the stuffed remains of fearsome monsters. The lodge has individual cottages for visiting Pathfinders, known as the Thassilonian Houses, each named after one of the ancient Thassilonian realms that once ruled over the land: Eurythnia House, Bakrakhan House, Shalast House, and Haruka House. The actual lodge is known as the Meeting House and features a meeting room, a lecture hall, a library with a large collection of Pathfinder Chronicles and essays on Varisian history, and a showroom lined with ancient Thassilonian artifacts. Currently, along with the owners, the lodge serves as the home for two other Pathfinders: Almya Gorangal and Joadric Heimurl, both of whom are planning expeditions into different areas in central Varisia.

Sheila and Canayven would fund any mission that Pathfinders were sent out to Heidmarch Manor to do, however, after recent discoveries in Varisia, the Decemvirate has funded all endeavors in the region.

properties.Name: Hekastor
properties.text: Hekastor was a city and golemworks of the Jistka Imperium known to be active ca. -3600 AR. It was destroyed and buried by earthquakes of divine nature millennia ago. Golems still roam the site, and its former residents slowly evolved into morlocks who remain active in the area. These Jistkan morlocks obsessively work to power 17 glowing magical pylons out of fear of releasing a destructive threat. The morlocks have been unable to power the pylons by any means other than the sacrifice of arcane magic spellcasters beneath the pillars.

properties.Name: Heliu's Folly
properties.text: Heliu's Folly was one of the westernmost fortresses of the defensive line known as the Sunwall in the Hold of Belkzen.

properties.Name: Hemachandra
properties.text: The Hemachandra, also known as the "Seat of the Golden Moon", is a legendary adventuring site in the eastern Divine Garden region of Vudra. The terraced tower contains a shrine to each of the thousands of deities of the Vudran pantheon, from hundreds of minor gods on its lowest level to Irori alone on its highest level nearly a day's climb upward. Acolytes and priests live in some of the tower's middle levels.

properties.Name: Herne's Oak
properties.text: Herne's Oak is a barrow deep within the Estrovian Forest of Mendev and the final resting place of the ill-fated hunter Herne Vilhaur. It is guarded by his descendants that were transformed by the curse of the winterthorn: the herne.

properties.Name: Hero's Rest
properties.text:
Hero's Rest, in the Hagreach region of the Lands of the Linnorm Kings, is a memorial to honor the most famous of those who have died defending Hagreach from the Irriseni raiders and whose bodies have not been recovered, remaining where they were slain across the border in Irrisen. All Hero's Rest cairns and graves are empty and the memorial is also known as the Empty Boneyard. The hilltop memorial which overlooks the eastern border is protected by a silver dragon named Avaleru. The dragon has no true love for the violent Ulfen neighbors, but she hates the Irriseni witches and their agents. It is said that Avaleru uses a part of the regular yearly tithes she gets as a guardian to grant magical boons to kind and good-mannerly Ulfen, assuming the form of a mysterious silver-haired woman.

The hill of Hero's Rest is located on the western bank of the Iceflow River, 50 miles north of Blackraven Hall and opposite Ï„he Irriseni towns of Yensa and Soduras.

properties.Name: Heskott Bay
properties.text: Heskott Bay was a town founded on the cursed island of Whyrlis Rock in the Shackles. It was located on one of the three decent anchorages left on the island. It was built as an outpost for the fleet of the pirate lord Baillie Heskott in the early years of the Shackles. It seems that three years after its foundation, all the residents of the town vanished into thin air. Those few who visited the abandoned town said that they heard the sounds of a busy city interrupted by screams of terror.

properties.Name: High Harbor
properties.text: High Harbor is a once-grand settlement reduced to ruins located on the northeast coast of the Scrape region of the Isle of Kortos.

properties.Name: Highforest
properties.text: Highforest is a petrified forest of unknown origin in the Nesmian Plains of Nirmathas. It is speculated that the cedar trees that made up the original forest were fossilized by magical ash from Earthfall. Aberrations and vermin have made the forest home.

properties.Name: Highpoint Tower
properties.text: Highpoint Tower is an abandoned garrison and watch point located close to the capital of Bildt on the island of Aegos, in the Linnorm Kingdom of Broken Bay. As of 4711 AR it was the home of a tribe of winter wolves and worgs.

properties.Name: Highwall Market
properties.text: The Highwall Market, located near the towering walls of Castle Kintargo in Kintargo's Castle District, serves the inhabitants of the castle by selling supplies such as paper, ink, and other mundane essentials to bureaucrats of all stripes. The market also offers other distractions for the weary workers who frequent it, such as food stalls and masseurs. A statue of the ancient war hero Tellorus Carmus stands at its center.

properties.Name: Hocum's Fantasmagorium
properties.text: The long-shuttered and storied building once known as Hocum's Fantasmagorium, located in the northern end of the Redroof district in the city of Kintargo, Ravounel, was purchased by Maercin Kelimber at some time recent to 4724 AR. Its renovation into a dry goods warehouse has been delayed by infestations of unusual vermin and imps.

properties.Name: Holding House
properties.text: The Holding House, located in the Old Kintargo district of Kintargo, was the city's original jail. It fell out of use when Castle Kintargo and Kintargo Keep began to be used to hold the city's prisoners.

properties.Name: Hollow Garden
properties.text:
The Hollow Garden is a large entertainment module of the spaceship Divinity which was detached from its deck and slammed into Numeria, in the area now called Sovereign's Reach, during the Rain of Stars. It is currently run by Celmak Toysiel, a malfunctioning mannequin robot, who turned it into a trap for adventurers who have to provide 'entertainment' by traversing a dungeon customised by Celmak that only ends with their deaths.

Celmak uses the entertainment module's remaining functional sensors to scan for potential victims. When someone approaches within a mile of the Hollow Garden, it begins to emit pulses and holograms (particularly idyllic gardens) to entice them. The doors to the bunker are always open with flickering lights, outwardly resembling a recently opened, malfunctioning, undefended section of the Divinity, ripe for plunder. Once the prey enters, the door seals and the only escape from that point is death; no teleportation is possible within the Garden.

Celmak then greets explorers and explains that they are destined to make history; if they survive, then the rewards will be great, turning them into heroes rich beyond imagining. At the same time, it also scans their brains for their emotions and abilities, and analyses them to optimise the entertainment it provides, before opening the doors to the Hollow Garden. As its guests traverse the dungeon, fighting robots, and overcoming obstacles, Celmak records their thoughts and actions via hidden cameras, and crafts each encounter to test the responses of explorers, sometimes releasing psychoactive chemicals to 'heighten the drama', or offering commentary if its victims are having a too easy or too hard a time. Occasionally, a minor item from Celmak's hoard is given to its current victims, hand-picked to prolong the entertainment but never allowing success.

In addition to Celmak and its robots, the Hollow Garden has recently become refuge to a group of demons fleeing the Worldwound. They accepted Celmak's offer to be occasionally sent into scenes as desired, but their leader Vlathherex found that they cannot teleport within the Hollow Garden, and now suspects that Celmak will never allow them to leave, and seeks to disable this lock.

properties.Name: Hollow Mountain
properties.text:
Hollow Mountain is among the highest peaks of Rivenrake Island in the Varisian Gulf. It boasts one of the most intriguing Thassilonian ruins in Varisia. Near the summit of the mountain, an enormous carving of a woman's face looks sternly towards the south, half of her visage rent away by an ancient apocalypse; she looks over the ruins of the bridge that, in ancient times, spanned from Rivenrake to Argavist Island. Exposed underneath, the onlooker can see that countless corridors and rooms must honeycomb the entire mountain.

The aged ruins of what some scholars believe to be the city of Xin-Bakrakhan, the Thassilonian City of Wrath and once the capital of the domain of Bakrakhan, are located at its base. These ruins are said to be one of the few remnants of this mountainous realm which disappeared into the Varisian Gulf following the destruction of the empire in -5293 AR. The split face near the summit is conjectured to be that of Runelord Alaznist herself.

Hollow Mountain was built with the labor of enslaved rune and stone giants.

properties.Name: Holy Xatramba
properties.text:
The ruins of Holy Xatramba (sometimes also spelled Xatremba) lie in the eastern jungle of the Mwangi Expanse, southwest of the city of Kibwe.

The city was founded in 3699 AR, at the site of Volnagur's first defeat (which happened in 909 AR). Its religion was an unique mix of ancestor worship and worship of Pharasma and its memory is revered by the Mwangi people.

properties.Name: Hook Ford
properties.text: The Pale River may not be particularly wide but it is for most of its length deep, with Hook Ford one of the few places where it can be forded. Hook Ford is a vital asset to the nearby town of Bronze Hook which once grew rich of the toll charged to cross the river. As land based trade across the Uwaga Highlands trade route became less common, Hook Ford became less and less important. Now, the only reminder of its former importance is a watchtower manned by a single guard. The only other notable feature is the pride of dragonnes that live in the nearby hills that the lone guard keeps placated with offerings of meat.

properties.Name: Hook Mountain
properties.text: Hook Mountain is the southern-most peak of central Varisia's Iron Peaks, located just south of the Storval Deep and north of the expansive Sanos Forest. It is synonymous with the Kreegs, the most bloodthirsty clan of ogres on Golarion, who until recently claimed the region around the mountain as their personal domain.

properties.Name: Hope Lost
properties.text:
The Hope Lost mine in the Irrisen province of Wintercrux produces the rare blue quartz crystals known as ice diamonds that are notoriously arduous to excavate. Many forced to work here by the White Witches or Cold Sisters die quickly due to the mine's brutal conditions.

The vicious Countess Grinnelise, whose palace is carved into the face of the mountain, oversees the mine. Enslaved miners prefer the daily beatings of the ice troll gang bosses over being summoned to the countess' palace, where the screams of victims during her notorious orgies of cannibalism and torture are unbearable.

At some point recent to 4712 AR, some slaves escaped using a secret tunnel and the help of yetis who dwell in a large warren deep in the mountains. The slaves gave stolen ice diamonds to the yetis in thanks.

properties.Name: Hor-Aha
properties.text: The great lighthouse of Hor-Aha is located on a small island north of the Coast of Graves in Osirion. During the height of ancient Osirion, the lighthouse was a key navigation aid. Its magical light not only marked the location but also gave information about the upcoming weather. Hor-Aha has remained dark for thousands of years, but recently lurid red and purple light strobes from its lantern room, the sign of violent gales. The few vessels that have since made landfall on the small isle were never heard from again.

properties.Name: Hostel Sepet
properties.text: The Hostel Sepet is a keep at the top of Sepet Pass on the trade route between El-Fatar and Ipeq in Osirion. It is built on top of an ancient Osirian fortifications on the eastern edge of the saddle of the mountain. It is surrounded by thick stone walls that rise up several stories. The ruined keep has been sealed up tightly, with only one heavily fortified gate and the narrowest of windows. The inside of the keep is a paradise of fountains and flowers. Hostel Sepet is the absolutely safe harbor for the caravans perilously journeying across the Brazen Peaks with kholo raiders and dangerous wildlife plaguing the journey the entire way.

properties.Name: House Beumhal
properties.text: House Beumhal is located in south-western Odranto, one of the counties of Ustalav.

properties.Name: House of 1,000 Silks
properties.text: The House of 1,000 Silks is a silk-producing facility in northwestern Quain in Tian Xia known for its magically-infused garments. The secrets of its trade are carefully protected by the martial artists who own the establishment.

properties.Name: House of Ensland
properties.text:
The House of Ensland is one of the two most notorious ruins of noble houses and estates in the blasted wasteland of the Furrows, along with Candlehalls.

The house is located four leagues from the ruins of the village of Feldgrau amidst the vast and blackened trench system called the Dead Man's Maze. The estate is almost certainly haunted, as ghost lights are seen playing around the grounds and other-worldly gamblers frequent these noble houses trying to entrap wanderers across the charred lands.

One unsuspecting gambler was Lecit Ghazts, a greedy knight officer who gambled away his body to a devil in the House of Ensland. Ghazts' head still rolls around the Furrows looking for his, or someone else's, body.

properties.Name: House of Golden Veils
properties.text: The House of Golden Veils is the largest bank in Kintargo and a temple to the god Abadar. It is located in the northeastern corner of the city's Temple Hill district. As of 4724 AR its high priest was Mhelrem Gesteliel.

properties.Name: House of Lies
properties.text: The House of Lies is the famous meeting place of the Guild of Liars, an organization of storytellers, con men, actors, and other conversational acrobats. Founded in 4354 AR and located on a river island in the part of Nidal's Uskwood north of the Usk River, the Guild meets here every five years to exchange stories, quips, tall tales, and other feats of verbal legerdemain. The person judged to be the most convincing liar is awarded the coveted title of "truth maker", and is given access to the House of Lies' extensive cabinet of curiosities.

properties.Name: House of Lords
properties.text: The House of Lords is a municipal building of Magnimar's city government in Varisia. Located in the wealthy Alabaster District, the temple-like structure holds offices for each of the city's seven great aristocratic families. Members of the public can appeal to the representatives of each of these families here in order to air grievances, ask for favors, or otherwise deal with the needs of the citizens at large. Magnimar's lesser aristocratic families do not have permanent offices here, but may rent them for a small fee should they so choose.

properties.Name: House of Oblivion
properties.text: The House of Oblivion is a vast structure in the heart of the Thuvian desert. Its black stone walls are hundreds of feet high and reflect no light. The air around the House seems strangely windless, and the House emits a low buzzing sound that can be heard from miles away.

properties.Name: House of Sky
properties.text: The House of Sky is an aerie high in the Five Kings Range that is the home of the giant owls of the Fierani Forest. These intelligent creatures have been allied with the elves of Kyonin for millennia, but are quite mistrustful of any other humanoid who makes the dangerous trek to their home. They hate Treerazer and his demonic minions, and can be summoned by the rulers of Kyonin in times of need via enchanted whistles. They are led by Winglord Kreiagh, who oversees a council of owls who frequently disagree with one another, but whose every word is taken to heart. Travel to the House of Sky is quite dangerous on foot, and is most easily accomplished by flight.

properties.Name: House of Truth and Clarity
properties.text: The House of Truth and Clarity is Kintargo's first courthouse, and its site in Old Kintargo was a centre of justice for the early city.

properties.Name: House of Welcome
properties.text: The House of Welcome is a high-class brothel in Magnimar, run by Remeka Abantiir. The building is grand enough for a noble's villa, and would be for the Abantiir family if not for the city law preventing villas being used for business.

properties.Name: House of Yanti PurnÃ¡llo
properties.text: The House of Yanti PurnÃ¡llo is the home of the last remaining hero-god of Xopatl, PurnÃ¡llo. While most of the hero-gods are mythic figures of ancient history who have long since ascended to true godhood, disappeared, or died, PurnÃ¡llo chose a different path. Thousands of years ago, PurnÃ¡llo undertook a unique process: she began to meditate while ritually wrapping herself in the enhanced vines and leaves of Xopatl's plant life, eventually effectively mummifying herself while still alive. This mummification resulted in PurnÃ¡llo reducing even her essential life processes to an almost imperceptibly slow speed. Over the centuries the people of Xopatl erected a temple around the remains of PurnÃ¡llo and now the people flock in pilgrimage to the House of Yanti PurnÃ¡llo to hear the saint's heart beat once per century.

properties.Name: House of the Beast
properties.text:
The House of the Beast is one of the most legendary temples dedicated to Rovagug in Katapesh. It is located on the barren slopes of the Pale Mountain in the Brazen Peaks. It is said that the temple had been built by a mysterious fire spirit who rose from the molten heart of the mountain.

As of 4709 AR it had become the lair of Ghartok, the Carrion King, warlord of the region's kholo tribes.

properties.Name: House of the Moon
properties.text: The House of the Moon is an ancient Desnan shrine located on the Storval Plateau of Varisia. It is frequently visited by the Lyrune-Quah tribe of the Shoanti, and is within their territory.

properties.Name: House of the Senses Awakened
properties.text:
The House of the Senses Awakened was the decadent project of Grand Prince Cydonus III, the ruler of Taldor who was so profligate in his spending that, during a mere five-year reign (4077â€“4081 AR), he nearly bankrupted the entire country. Cydonus spent his life wracked with anxiety over the possibility of an attack from neighbouring Qadira. He dealt with this fear by indulging his every whim and the culmination of this was the House of the Senses Awakened. A maze-like pleasure palace located in the wilds of the Porthmos Gap, Cydonus III effectively moved Taldor's capital from Oppara to this lavish pleasure ground during his reign. This included his harem of lovers and one in particular, Origen Sarlu, was especially fond of the Grand Prince.

In the wake of the Even-Tongued Conquest, Grand Prince Cydonus III was poisoned by a Qadiran agent (later identified by the Ballingar Accord). After the Grand Prince's death, Origen Sarlu absconded with his body and sealed himself, the Grand Prince's body, and a significant portion of Taldor's wealth within the House of the Senses Awakened, turning the complex into a trap-riddled hazard that has remained impenetrable to this day. Origen Sarlu still dwells within, having become a powerful form of undead known as a nemhain. The house is also protected by an array of other undead, including spectres, wights, and wraiths, as well as ancient stone golems.

properties.Name: Humbright House
properties.text: Humbright House was one of a number of smaller shrines to Aroden that once dotted Kintargo's Temple Hill district but has been abandoned since the god's death.

properties.Name: Hvorsuli
properties.text: Hvorsuli, also known as the "Snow Spires", is a ruined city of thin spires and massive gates located within a glacier in northern Iobaria. Only the foremost gatehouse and a few broken domes lie outside the glacier and allow treasure hunters and explorers access to the ruins. The creators of the city are unknown, but there are mentions of a great power that glows in the heart of the city, contained by the ice god Rheth.

properties.Name: Ice Spire
properties.text: Ice Spire is a vast dungeon located in the northern plains of the Thanelands in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings.

properties.Name: Icegraves
properties.text: The Icegraves is the traditional burial site for the leaders of the Varki people in the Linnorm Kingdom of Icemark. After having their brains and entrails removed (which are offered to the sky on a platform), the Varki bury the bodies in a grave melted out of the ice. Anyone who visits the burial site can see countless bodies amidst their burial goods perfectly preserved in the ice.

properties.Name: Icerift Castle
properties.text: During the First Mendevian Crusade, the government of Mendev decided to establish a stronghold on its northern border with the Worldwound. As a result, work began on building Icerift Castle at the source of the West Sellen River near the Crown of the World. Before the castle was finished, however, the Mendevian forces had a change of heart. Conscious of the difficulty in supplying and reinforcing such a remote outpost, they decided to cancel the construction. A party of soldiers was sent north to escort home the construction crew and their guards, only to find that they had all been slaughtered and their hearts had been torn out. Even stranger, the attack did not appear to have been carried out by demons. The superstitious indigenous people of Mendev blamed the legendary wendigo for the killing, but no investigation was carried out; instead the site was declared anathema and removed from the nation's records.

properties.Name: Imnuxeos
properties.text:
Imnuxeos is an ancient, haunted remainder of the long-collapsed Ghol-Gan empire. Located south of the Terwa Uplands and north of Bloodcove, Imnuxeos is now little more than a stretch of isolated badlands dotted with remnants of colossal masonry from 10,000 years ago.

At the height of the Ghol-Gan civilisation, Imnuxeos was the most brutal fighting pit in the kingdom, a colossal coliseum where cyclops gladiators faced off against captured monsters, slaves, or even other cyclopes in bloodbaths of exceptional spectacle. The ghosts of these ancient gladiators still linger, and every night as darkness falls Imnuxeos's champions rise once more to face each otherâ€”and any mortal foolish enough to remain. Those who linger after sunset face undead cyclopes, horrific aberrations, and reanimated beasts of ancient bone.

properties.Name: Impound Yard
properties.text: The Impound Yard is a set of docks owned by Magnimar's city government. Abandoned ships are moved here before being auctioned after 90 days. The auctions can be quite a spectacle since the contents of the holds may not be examined prior to bidding. The city takes possession of the cargo of ships not sold after six months, then scuttles the ships in the Varisian Gulf.

properties.Name: Imvrildara
properties.text: The ancient Calistrian temple of Imvrildara, located in the southern Fierani Forest of Kyonin, is the base for the goddess's most militant sect of worshipers: the Imvrildarai, defenders of the forest against Treerazer and its demonic armies.

properties.Name: Indros cul Vydrarch
properties.text:
The Indros cul Vydrarch is a tall marble sculpture that commemorates Alcaydian Indros' defeat of the famous Vydrarch in the place that would eventually become Magnimar. The monument sits in the middle of Indros cul Vydrarch Plaza, a busy square opposite the Usher's Hall, the seat of Magnimar's government, in the Capital District of the Varisian city.

Local legend has it that reciting the poem Upon a Serpent's Grave in Thalassic while admiring the statue gives the performer extra skill at arms against sea creatures.

properties.Name: Infinite Ossuary
properties.text: The Infinite Ossuary is the ruins of a fortress in the Nesmian Plains in what is now Nirmathas. The original fortress was built on top of an onyx mine, with the strategic purpose to secure the spell components to animate the armies of Tar-Baphon. To this day, the Infinite Ossuary holds General Kros Catternine, a graveknight, in stasis.

properties.Name: Irespan
properties.text: The Irespan, sometimes called the Giant's Bridge, is the largest and most impressive monument in all of Magnimar and overshadows the city's poorest district known as Underbridge. The Irespan is actually the remains of an enormous bridge that stretches into the Varisian Gulf, standing over 300 feet above the sea and over 100 feet wide. It is, like most of the monuments that dot the Varisian landscape, a remnant of ancient Thassilon.

properties.Name: Iron Mountain
properties.text: The Iron Mountain is located in the Wall of Heaven range of Tian Xia south of Quain. A platform guarded by sentinel statues of foo lions was built long ago near one of the peaks of the Iron Mountain. This platform contains twin gates: one leading to Heaven, and the other to Hell. Once every 12 years, the imperial dragon known in Quain as the Celestial Dragon visits the site and grants one wish to a royal maiden.

properties.Name: Iron Rose
properties.text: The Iron Rose is an opulent palace located in a verdant valley in the Menador Mountains of northeastern Isger, close to the border with Druma. Its mistress is Lady Kaltessa Iyis, the high priestess of the archdevil Mammon in the Inner Sea region. From here she directs her centuries-long plots on behalf of her infernal master.

properties.Name: Iron and Hoof Gate
properties.text: The Iron and Hoof Gate is the southwestern fortified entrance to the Andoren capital of Almas. It leads directly into the industrial and working class Tamuth District, and is wide enough to accommodate both draft animals and large wagons.

properties.Name: Isle of Arenway
properties.text:
The Isle of Arenway is located at the confluence of the Verduran Fork and Sellen River in central Taldor. Set in the heart of the Verduran Forest, it is the headquarters of the local druids of the Wildwood Lodge. It is said to contain a series of standing stones which create an annual connection to the demiplane known as the Circle Between every solstice.

In their summer solstice Moot of Ages, the Green Faith druids from all over Golarion gather in the Isle of Arenway to bring their discoveries before the entire druid community.

The Isle also contains an unnamed harbour outpost of the Taldan River Guard, although by the Treaty of the Wildwood, its sailors are forbidden to leave their walled compound, except to patrol the Sellen River and Verduran Fork. Ships traveling past often stop at the outpost to have their vessels blessed by the druids.

properties.Name: Isle of the Dreamers
properties.text: The Isle of the Dreamers is located in the eastern part of Lake Tapipallati, off the west-central coast of Xopatl. On this island the veil between the Universe and the Dreamlands is particularly thin, allowing easy access to people and for planar energy to seep through and transform local wildlife into alebrijes.

properties.Name: Iudeimus Tenement
properties.text:
The Iudeimus Tenement is one of the numerous high-stacked tenement buildings that still litter Old Kintargo and house many of Kintargo's poorer working-class residents. Its residents are nearly equally split between short- and long-term stays.

Like many such tenement buildings, it is run by a thoroughly disreputable manager, the hateful old crone Nurla Botve. The building is one of the taller ones in Old Kintargo and well built, with a bottom floor made of stone and top two floors made of wood.

properties.Name: Jaijarko Castle
properties.text: Jaijarko Castle refers to the collection of slum dwellings in Magnimar's Rag's End section of the Beacon's Point district where the slumlord Rassimeri Jaijarko lives and runs his businesses. The various buildings that make up this complex are connected by secret passages.

properties.Name: Jailed Emergence
properties.text: The Jailed Emergence is a sinkhole that plummets down into the Darklands, through Nar-Voth and into Sekamina, with a terminus near the drow city of Giratayn. The surface entrance is ringed with stone towers oriented toward defending the surface from subterranean interlopers, and Prophets of Kalistrade fund protective walls that also mask their far quieter slave trade with Darklands drow.

properties.Name: Jarvis Estate
properties.text: Jarvis Estate, located in The Greens district of Kintargo, Ravounel, is the home of House Jarvis.

properties.Name: Jhaltero Estate
properties.text: Jhaltero Estate, located in The Greens district of Kintargo, Ravounel, is the home of House Jhaltero. It resembles a large and opulent hunting lodge.

properties.Name: Jorgenfist
properties.text: Jorgenfist is a fortress in the center Varisia's Iron Peaks, near the Muschkal River within the Valley of the Black Tower. Its walls incorporate the Black Tower on its southeastern side.

properties.Name: Jundlan Wrecks
properties.text: The pirate lords of Issia (now part of Brevoy) once engaged one another in a massive naval battle on the Lake of Mists and Veils. During the battle, the fleets were caught up in a massive storm and wrecked off the coast of Brevoy in Jellicoe Bay. The wreckage remains there to this day, and is known as the Jundlan Wrecks. Presumably a considerable amount of pirate treasure can be found amongst the frost-covered tangle of wrecked ships and ancient, waterlogged corpses. However, numerous unfriendly fey now live amongst the destruction, building altars and structures made from the dead pirates' treasure. On moonless nights at midnight, ghostly bells toll here and gangplanks made of bone extend from the shipwrecks and invite all to board.

properties.Name: Justnoque
properties.text: Justnoque is a sunken city underneath the Steaming Sea, off the coast of Varisia and the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. In the times of ancient Thassilon, Justnoque was a center of learning and metallurgy in the kingdom of Cyrusian, but it now lies ruined under the waves; only about a dozen slick black stones jutting from the water mark its presence. The sunken city is feared by the Linnorm Kings, but adventurers sometimes set sail from the Linnorm King city of Jol to explore Justnoque; the few that return tell tales of aquatic giants inhabiting the ruins.

properties.Name: Kabirabad
properties.text: Kabirabad is a ruined underground labyrinth located in the north of Vudra's storied central region known as the Cradle. Kabirabad is haunted by ghosts that date back to the Age of Destiny.

properties.Name: Kaddren Villa
properties.text: Kaddren Villa is the stately city villa of the Kaddren family, and is located in the northernmost corner of Magnimar's Alabaster District next to Niroden Villa.

properties.Name: Kaijitsu Townhouse
properties.text: Kaijitsu Townhouse, sometimes termed Kaijitsu Villa, was the manor house of House Kaijitsu, one of Magnimar's newest aristocratic families. The townhouse has been mostly empty since 4687 AR when the family became more concerned with their interests in Sandpoint. Magnimar's other nobles wanted the Kaijitsus to either sell the property or return to properly care for it.

properties.Name: Kalexcourt
properties.text: Kalexcourt, the Fortress of Monoliths, or the Vault of the Witch-Priests, stands at the very north-westernmost point of Ustalav, in the county of Vieland, among the lower slopes of the Tusk Mountains. It is an ancient burial mound of the Kellid peoples dating from before the founding of Ustalav.

properties.Name: Kallow Mounds
properties.text: The Kallow Mounds are the burial grounds of the Shoanti clan known as the Skoan-Quah, and are located on the Storval Plateau approximately 50 miles east of Kaer Maga.

properties.Name: Kamawgyar Shrine
properties.text: The abandoned Kamawgyar Shrine is located in the Zho Mountains of Qadira northeast of the Pashman River. It features a massive statue of the god Irori placed over a natural cave where the priests who once served the shrine lived. It is now the home of a mother and daughter harpy who were exiled from the large harpy community at Al-Bashir, along with a small retinue of dire corbies.

properties.Name: Kashang
properties.text:
Kashang is a forbidden, ancient ruin of the long extinct Valashmaians that is located in the Chenlun Mountains' eastern foothills, in the depths of the deadly Valashmai Jungle. Shrouded by the surrounding jungle, Kashang is made up of a series of many-stepped temples that sit in utter silence, not a single beast from the surrounding jungles dares intrude on Kashang's unholy quiet.

Kashang's buildings are made from dark stone that is eerily clammy to the touch. Whatever horrors the ancient Valashmaians summoned to aid their long-gone empire lurks here still, waiting for any foolish explorers to upset the delicate magic of the ancient rituals that bind them to the ruins. However the lore and secrets that lurk within are enough to still draw reckless knowledge seekers to the ruins. Those who do seek the foreboding ruins risk paying a truly terrible price for the forbidden knowledge hidden within silent Kashang.

properties.Name: Keening Hills
properties.text: The Keening Hills are a haunted highlands to the east of the Kodar Mountains in the Hold of Belkzen, located southeast of the treacherous Dirt Sea. Although the Keening Hills appear green and inviting, they are stringently avoided by even the bravest orcs, who say that whatever lies dreaming beneath its surface should be left to its slumber. The few who have ventured there and returned speak of hearing songs that drive one toward suicide or call one to explore its trackless expanse. Fortune hunters looking for buried treasures in its barrow mounds find that their excavations fill with tar and close up with unnatural speed.

properties.Name: Kelimber's Dry Goods and Supplies
properties.text: Kelimber's Dry Goods and Supplies is a massive general store in the Redroof district of Kintargo. Kelimber's Dry Goods can provide most of the basic, day-to-day needs of its residents such as food, and even provides a small local postal service. Maercin Kelimber runs the store and is popular with both the locals and the adventuring community, as the store stocks a variety of basic adventuring equipment. In addition to serving Redroof, Kelimber's also supplies other smaller grocers across Kintargo.

properties.Name: Kembe
properties.text:
The ruins of Kembe are in the southern part of the Mwangi Jungle, in the Mwangi Expanse.

It consists of three concentric rings of buildings. The buildings of the inner ring are sized for giants, those of the middle ring are sized for humans, and those of the outer ring are sized for halflings.

According to the myths carved on the city walls, a race of giants arrived from the sky in silver craft. They built the inner ring of buildings, but over generations found themselves getting smaller and smaller, requiring the building of the middle ring, and then finally the outer ring. They eventually shrunk too small to be seen.

properties.Name: Kho
properties.text: The ruins of Kho were once the first flying city of the Shory Empire. Located in the Kho-Rarne Pass of the Barrier Wall Mountains between the Mwangi Expanse and Osirion, the former Shory capital fell to earth millennia ago.

properties.Name: Kho-Rarne Pass
properties.text: The gap between the Barrier Wall mountains and the Brazen Peaks is known as the Kho-Rarne Pass. It links the northeastern Mwangi Expanse, near the Ruins of Kho, to Osirion, near to the Ruins of Rarne. The pass is wide and easily traveled, but due to Osirion's lack of interest in the Mwangi region, it is rarely used.

properties.Name: Khopesh Span
properties.text: The Khopesh Span is a large stone bridge that crosses the Crook River in southern Osirion. It was built during the height of Osirian power in -2370 AR, and besides the shallows at the city of Ipeq, provides the only other place to safely cross the river. It is still operational to this day and is a part of the overland trade route between Osirion and its southern neighbor, Katapesh.

properties.Name: Khulo
properties.text:
The seaside town of Khulo, the only settlement on Valkus Isle, was once a favorite pleasure resort of the nobility of Nex. Failed experiments carried out in the island's interior by the archmage Nex saw the island overrun by dangerous planar forces and monsters, with unfortunate results for the town's population. The chaos meant that the settlement was run by crime lords and spirit nagas vying for power.

Today, the town (like the rest of the island) is cut off from civilization by the protective Stalwart Wall, so it is unknown what creatures (if any) currently dwell there.

properties.Name: Killik-Tura Oasis
properties.text: The Killik-Tura Oasis, sometimes spelt Kilik-Tura Oasis, is located in the western reaches of the Footprints of Rovagug region of Osirion, east of the Junira River. The water at the small oasis is cool and plentiful. Killik-Tura Oasis is a popular stop for caravans despite the rumors that large worm-like creatures occasionally emerge from the oasis. The oasis is formed as a perfect circle, effectively bottomless, and its subterranean, water-filled tunnels branch out for miles. A fantastical tale says that the tunnels open into dry caverns filled with crawling horrors and feral humanoids. The truth is that Crawlbrother, a distinguished agent of the nearby Darklands ghoulish city of Nemret-Noktoria, lurks beneath the waters.

properties.Name: Kintargo Keep
properties.text: Kintargo Keep is a part of the larger Castle Kintargo that dominates the Castle District of the city of Kintargo. The keep's five-storey spire juts from the north-western corner of the castle, and under the rule of Cheliax it served as Kintargo's most notorious prison. As of 4724 AR under independent Ravounel, it had been sealed since the Ruby Massacre in 4716 AR.

properties.Name: Kintargo Opera House
properties.text: The Kintargo Opera House in the city of Kintargo, Ravounel, is beloved by the local population and has been the stage for such famous soloists as Shensen. It is one of the most esteemed opera venues in Avistan.

properties.Name: Klarwa Fountain
properties.text:
The Klarwa Fountain is located in the desert of western Osirion, in the region known as the Footprints of Rovagug. The site is a bowl-shaped depression filled with rain water atop a steep cinder cone from a long-extinct volcano, which rises hundreds of feet above the surrounding area. The water never quite evaporates despite the heat, and gases occasionally vent from deep within the cone. The violent plumes of water are sometimes visible from miles away, and one such column drew the attention of the anchorite Klarwa as he was dying of thirst in the badlands during the Second Age, giving the landmark its name.

As of 4714 AR the hill is used by the few travelers making their way through western Osirion, and its water makes the ascent up the steep hill well worth the effort. Some hermits live within sight of the Klarwa Fountain and hike up its sides when driven by desperate thirst, as anchorite holy Klarwa was.

properties.Name: Koeh Lau
properties.text: Koeh Lau is a remote valley in the northern Wall of Heaven mountains of Tian Xia. It is thought to be a place of idyllic beauty and contentment, home to a people who live with each other in peace and harmony without the need for laws or government. The truth, however, is much darker, as Koeh Lau is the forbidden domain of a group of vampiric monks, witches, and oracles who oversee the human population like cattle. The vampires allow them freedom during the day so that they may feed on them to their heart's content at night.

properties.Name: Koor
properties.text: Koor is a ruined forge-city found in the northern part of Qadira in the Zho Mountains. Once known for producing incredible weapons and armor that were shipped throughout the Inner Sea region, Koor was abandoned in the 41st century AR.

properties.Name: Kopparberget
properties.text: Kopparberget is a huge open-pit copper mine located on the northern reaches of the Kodar Mountains in the Linnorm Kingdom of Southmoor. The mine sits at the point where several deep lucrative veins of metals converge. Although the mine has been in operation for many decades, it still provides a great portion of Linnorm Kingdoms' wealth.

properties.Name: Koumssa Gap
properties.text: The Koumssa Gap is the easiest place for the Path of Aganhei to climb from the tundra lowlands of northern Avistan to the high plains of the Hoarwell March. It is a break in the mountains that surround the high ice of the Crown of the World with a gentle ascent. At its foot sits the trading town of Unaimo.

properties.Name: Kublan Grove
properties.text:
The Kublan Grove is no clump of woodland but a tangled mass of rafters, scaffolds, and masonry that serves as a testament to the flighty whims of the Taldan aristocracy. Located in Taldor's Lingian Prefecture, the Kublan Grove began life as a construction project that started soon after the prefecture's rise in popularity. Approximately twenty years ago, three Opparan baronets, all cousins from House Kublan, borrowed against their family's ancestral lands, buying up several miles of farmland to construct a grand retreat for the nobility. In their lust to provide every possible luxury, the project's scope increased massively, bloating from an original plan for a simple manor house to, eventually, being an entire community devoted to vice and hedonism, but it was not to be.

Funding dried up and construction halted. Now the half-finished buildings lie abandoned amidst a forest of scaffolding, empty save for a few wild animals and a community of squatters. House Kublan occasionally hires bands of thugs to sweep through the grove and chase off the squatters, desperately hoping to attract new investors as the Lingian Prefecture's popularity grows.

properties.Name: Kuruban Swamp
properties.text: Kuruban Swamp is a line of heavily wooded islands in Vudra's Open Bridge region that was not fully connected to the mainland when the Obari Ocean receded in 4606 AR. Instead, the upheaval created a semi-sunken mangrove swamp. Unlike the rest of Open Bridge, which is infested with hordes of horrific aberrations, Kuruban Swamp is controlled by sedacthys who ruthlessly protect its borders. The sedacthys seem to be searching amongst the ancient ruins that dot the swamp, but no one knows for what.

properties.Name: Labyrinth of the Two Hells
properties.text: The Labyrinth of the Two Hells is an extensive series of caves under the northern Zi Ha mountains that is home to two tribes of fiendish xulgaths. The Gugrangmyal are the "children of the cold hell" while the Gutshadmyal are the "children of the hot hell", and both equally brutal groups are in a perpetual war against the other. The war, nurtured by the samsaran Baijan who manipulated the xulgaths' spiritual personas, has persisted for centuries.

properties.Name: Lady Docur's School for Girls
properties.text:
Lady Docur's School for Girls is the oldest of the many private schools in the Villegre district of Kintargo, but is somewhat overshadowed by the larger, more famous Alabaster Academy.

Lady Docur's School was founded approximately 300 years ago by its forlorn elven headmistress Lady Mialari Docur, who as of 4724 AR still operates the school. She founded the school when educating young ladies in elven ways was fashionable. Tastes changed over the centuries, however, and as of 4724 AR its students are primarily female aiuvarins from across Cheliax, Isger, and Molthune.

The seemingly innocent school harbours a strange secret, however, for Lady Docur educates the most talented of her students in not only etiquette but also espionage. Those she deems her most promising students are recruited into a secretive organisation of spies and messengers called the Lacunafex that operates across Cheliax and often cooperates with the Kintargo-based Sacred Order of Archivists.

properties.Name: Lady's Light
properties.text: The Lady's Light is an enormous statue located on the western end of Lady's Cape, in the south-westernmost reaches of Varisia's Mushfens approximately 50 miles from the city of Magnimar as the crow flies. Almost 200 feet in height, the statue resembles a woman in flowing robes with one breast bared, holding a staff aloft.

properties.Name: Lair of Fafnheir
properties.text: Dread Fafnheir is said to be the mightiest and oldest linnorm in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings, and he has existed for as long as the Linnorm Kingdoms themselves. The Lair of Fafnheir is located deep in the Grungir Forest. A legend exists that whoever slays Fafnheir will become king of all the Ulfen, and unite the squabbling kingdoms into a single nation.

properties.Name: Lake Platter
properties.text: Lake Platter is the largest lake entirely inside Nirmathi borders. Cool all year long due to its mountainous sources, Lake Platter is five miles long but less than a mile wide. The lake boasts several fishing hamlets along its coast, and contains several bagiennik populations: amphibious newt-like fey with healing powers.

properties.Name: Lamashtu's Flower
properties.text: Lamashtu's Flower is a hidden oasis and temple of Lamashtu located near the Osirian town of Eto. The site serves as the center of a kholo cult led by Nathrek the Pale and his consort Alashra.

properties.Name: Langitheath
properties.text: Langitheath was once a well-to-do manorial estate in the central Ustalavic province of Ardeal. It and the surrounding 900 acres of farmland were sold by the Loslimor family around ca. 4681 AR, after which the estate passed through a number of different owners before finally being abandoned. Despite the fact that no one is believed to have worked the land for decades, a new crop of flax still grows every year, forming strange spiral shapes around the old manor house. Those who have come close to the estate have reported seeing small figures capering through the fields, or report meeting unnatural children with eyes as cold and blue as the flax flowers of Langitheath.

properties.Name: Latchmin's Folly
properties.text: Latchmin's Folly is a squat sea fort constructed on a rise in the High Eastwind district of Port Peril.

properties.Name: Left-Handed Lobster
properties.text: The Left-Handed Lobster is a bar open only to the fishermen members of Magnimar's Outcast Fishery. It is located within the Fishery's complex in the Beacon's Point district.

properties.Name: Lenyenko Dark
properties.text: The cavernous failed mine in the Icerime Peaks of Brevoy known as the Lenyenko Dark leads to a pre-Earthfall complex that dates to Koloran, the ancient cyclopean empire of Casmaron. After a series of unfortunate events, the complex was sealed by the Brevic government around 4639 AR.

properties.Name: Lethaquel
properties.text: Lethaquel is a site in the eastern hills of the elven nation of Kyonin, halfway between the Fierani Forest and the Sellen River.

properties.Name: Lethe Springs
properties.text: Lethe Springs is a magical hot spring located high in the Southern Zho Moutnains of Qadira in sight of the mountains Zhonar and Zhobl. While the springs seem like the perfect place to relax and warm oneself from the chill mountain air, its waters carry a terrible curse: drinking the waters obliterates one's memories and transforms the body into a fiendish mockery of oneself.

properties.Name: Leydis
properties.text: Leydis is a moss-covered ruined city located in the wood north of Rookwarden in the River Kingdoms region known as Loric Fells. It was founded by a Taldan prospector who struck pay dirt nearby, but was abandoned soon after it was founded. Its marble buildings and water-stained mosaics, not to mention the wealth in the abandoned nearby mine, still attract creatures and adventurers, but no one has been able to claim it for more than a year. Those who enter the ruins often find the skeletons of their predecessors hanging from its walls. Leydis is currently held by the medusa Chryphaena and her blind zombies.

properties.Name: Liclac
properties.text: The ruined city of Liclac was once a thriving settlement of the now-extinct nation of Rastel. The ruins stand upon the banks of the Upper Korir River on the edge of the Screaming Jungle in the Mwangi Expanse. Just as with all other ruins of the Rastel culture, Liclac shows signs of fire, conflict, and cannibalism.

properties.Name: Liferoot Stone
properties.text:
The Liferoot Stone is one of the aeon towers that Aroden placed around the Isle of Kortos. The tower was a 300-foot-tall mudbrick step pyramid with a flat 10-foot-wide top and four uneven tiers, though it is now partially collapsed.

The tower is located in the Swardlands on the Isle of Kortos, and is the southernmost of the towers, located near the town of Castinlee.

properties.Name: Lightning Stones
properties.text: According to ancient Garundi legend, the Lightning Stones mark a battleground between earth and air elementals. In fact, this line of twenty-foot-tall menhirs only attracts these elementals, and when they encounter each other, old grudges ensure it does not end peaceably. The menhirs run through the southern reaches of the Katapesh section of the Barrier Wall mountains near the border with Nex. True to their name, the Lightning Stones attract lightning from the storms that are common to the area. The stones glow when struck by lightning, revealing runes and glyphs otherwise invisible to observers. This written language is unique but shares characteristics with the languages of ancient Katapesh and Nex, and the text appears to describe how to acquire and use power for the betterment of everyone.

properties.Name: Lightning's Call
properties.text:
Lightning's Call, also known as Lightning Top, is a mountain of the Five Kings Range located at the border of the Five Kings Mountains and Kyonin in central Avistan. It bears one of the Carved Kings sculptures featuring the visage of King Harral, which overlooks the southern side of the Great Pass.

The mountain derives its moniker from the perpetual gathering of storm clouds around its peak, a weather phenomenon that wizards of Tar-Kazmukh have determined is not magical in nature but remain mystified by.

properties.Name: Lion Sleeps Inn
properties.text: The Lion Sleeps Inn is a traveller's stop 35 miles north-east of the Taldan settlement of Zimar.

properties.Name: Little Miss Drurie's
properties.text: The Little Miss Drurie's is a dance hall located in the Jarvis End district of Kintargo. Dance halls in Kintargo combine the functions of a musical venue, tavern, and brothel. As of 4719 AR, it was one of Kintargo's most recently established dance halls and had garnered a following for its dance contests and experimental musical performances.

properties.Name: Long Roads Coffeehouse
properties.text:
The Long Roads Coffeehouse is one of numerous small restaurants, eateries, and coffee houses scattered across the Villegre district of Kintargo in Cheliax. It is located north of Villegre Park.

Its owner, Laria Longroad, has a dedicated if eclectic clientele: a mixture of wide-eyed students from the Alabaster Academy and other educational institutions alongside noble patrons from the neighbouring Greens district.

The Long Roads Coffeehouse's success is partially due to the quality of its drinks and food, including traditional halfling cuisine, but under Chelaxian rule it also served as a front for Laria's connections with the then-illegal Bellflower Network and seemingly every other rogue and revolutionary in the city.

She kept the Coffeehouse's role in these activities secret until they were exposed to the Scarlet Triad by Hundy Vosht in 4719 AR. The criminal organization briefly captured Longroad in a raid against her coffeehouse that killed several of its patrons, an act that quickly engaged her in efforts to rout the Triad from Kintargo. Its role in the Rebellion has since made it as much a tourist attraction as a cafe.

properties.Name: Lord-Mayor's Menagerie
properties.text: The Lord-Mayor's Menagerie is a public park located in the Capital District district of Magnimar. The park's unusual name stems from the collection of bizarre taxidermy and living creatures on display. Canayven Heidmarch and Sheila Heidmarch, a pair of local Pathfinders who run the Heidmarch Manor Lodge, use the park as a place to display their unique menagerie.
