This strange collection includes an eyeless, and therefore relatively harmless, basilisk, a tame 14-foot-tall ape named "Prince Mandali", and the egg of a tarn linnorm.

properties.Name: Lost Fortress of Mekshir
properties.text: The Lost Fortress of Mekshir guarded the trade routes from Osirion to its province of Thuvia until it was buried in a sandstorm during the khamsin season of -841 AR. The fortress is rumored to contain treasures including an armory of magical weapons and several months of payroll, but is said to be guarded by the undead.

properties.Name: Lost Lane
properties.text: Lost Lane is a street in Rag's End, one of Magnimar's poorest neighborhoods in the city's Beacon's Point district. It is also the location of the headquarters of Magnimar's premier thieves' guild: the Night Scales.

properties.Name: Lost Lodge
properties.text: Lost Lodge is a secret but forgotten Desnan safehouse in Nidal's southeastern Uskwood Forest that contains supplies, weapons, and relics of the Song of Spheres, but is surrounded by a nest of deathwebs, placed there by Shades of the Uskwood druids centuries ago.

properties.Name: Lost Mine of Siwat
properties.text: The Lost Mine of Siwat is a lost silver mine located in the Sahure Wastes of central Osirion. It was originally founded in 4349 AR, but mysteriously disappeared only a few years thereafter. Few people today even remember that the silver mine, and the small village of Siwat that grew up around it, ever existed.

properties.Name: Lost Mines
properties.text: The Lost Mines once dug deep into the roots of the Mindspin Mountains on the western border of Nirmathas. They, and all their miners, suddenly disappeared in an unexplained occurrence.

properties.Name: Lost Temple
properties.text:
Located in the southern reaches of the Katapesh desert near the border with Nex, the Lost Temple was clearly once a religious site, but no one knows which deity it was devoted to.

The ordered layout suggests that it was probably dedicated to a lawful god, but beyond that the evidence is confusing. The temple has small, individual cells that suggest it may have been a monastery of Irori. Beneath it is a huge vault reminiscent of those found in temples of Abadar, while the abandoned soaring towers look more like those dedicated to the sun goddess Sarenrae. There are even rumors that the temple may have been dedicated to the dead god Aroden, though there is no evidence of this.

The site often draws adventurers of a religious bent to the site determined to identify who it was dedicated to. This constant influx of armed adventurers has kept the site relatively free of the dangerous monsters that often use abandoned ruins as lairs.

properties.Name: Lucky Bones
properties.text: For centuries, Lucky Bones was a notorious gambling house and drug den sat in the heart of Old Kintargo, but it was burned down in a raid by Hellknights of the Order of the Torrent. Unbeknownst to most, Lucky Bones had long served as a legitimate front for the notorious Gray Spiders guild which operated out of the basement below it.

properties.Name: Lumber Consortium Camp
properties.text: As of 4708 AR, the Lumber Consortium Camp in Andoran's Darkmoon Vale was the lumber cartel's main camp in the region. It specializes in harvesting copses of valuable duskwood.

properties.Name: Lurching Mountain
properties.text: The Lurching Mountain is a towering volcano on Raugsmauda's Reach island in the Shackles. The volcano is the primary source of the yellow-gray clouds that loom over the island. Thick fumes always pour out of its crater at the top of the mountain and roll down its sides. The resulting ash looks rotten and it is unknown what chemical composition could create such a unique and unsettling ash cloud. It is said that the lich Raugsmauda practices her foul magic on the top of the volcano.

properties.Name: Magarai
properties.text: Little is known about Magarai, a settlement of western Osirion during its First Age located in what is now Thuvia. The city was known for its zealous nature.

properties.Name: Magilloch Ranch
properties.text: The Magilloch Ranch is a goat ranch on the Nesmian Plains of Nirmathas. It was originally built by the Magilloch family after the Shining Crusade and has remained in the same hands since then. Unbeknownst at the time, Willow Magilloch, a paladin, was infected by a wasting illness that eventually turned her into a vampire. A few undead-blooded sorcerers appear in the Magilloch family every generation. As of 4717 AR Gran Willow, her family, and vampire spawn created from passing Molthuni soldiers have created a massive tunnel complex beneath their ranch.

properties.Name: Magrevore
properties.text:
Magrevore is an enormous roiling magma pit located in the Darklands deep beneath the Qadiran city of Khoka. A portal at the heart of Magrevore leads to the depths of Malebolge, the sixth layer of Hell.

Magrevore is guarded by a powerful nessari named Mardehzuk, a servant of the archdevil Moloch, who controls a far-reaching network of hryngar slavers that funnels a constant stream of slaves to be sacrificed in Moloch's name.

properties.Name: Maiaji
properties.text:
Maiaji (pronunciation MY-yee) was once the southernmost city in the nation of Hongal in Tian Xia. It is now the home to an army of ogres and hill giants, led by the ambitious ettin Nghiem.

Nghiem is known for his love of horse flesh, his short temper, and his unbelievable fecundity. At last count, Nghiem has more than 400 sons and has lost count of his daughters. While Nghiem and Maiaji theoretically swear allegiance to the oni rulers of Chu Ye, in reality Nghiem aspires to build a kingdom of his own and bows to no creature. The ruler of Hongal, Kiriltai Khan, is aware of the threat posed by Nghiem and Maiaji but has proved reluctant, at least so far, to send his own followers to deal with this threat, instead recruiting adventurers to try to deal with the problem.

properties.Name: Mammoth Graveyard
properties.text: The Mammoth Graveyard is a mountain valley in the eastern foothills of the northern Tusk Mountains, where mammoths near the end of their lives travel to die. The valley has grown into an intelligent genius loci, guiding mammoths to itself while confounding travellers, who only find it by accident and never twice. The formation of the Worldwound, however, corrupted the Mammoth Graveyard, and mammoths ceased coming there; it became home to bone golems and a massive flesh colossus made from rotting mammoth corpses.

properties.Name: Mantarin
properties.text:
Mantarin was built in the southern Rimethirst Mountains during the First Mendevian Crusade as a penal colony, but after Drezen fell, all contact with Mendev ceased. After realizing the gravity of their situation, the commanders offered all of the prisoners freedom as long as they swore oaths to join the crusade and fight against the demons of the Worldwound in an effort to make it back to Mendev, but all were killed before completing half of the journey.

As of 4711 AR, the penal colony was populated entirely by half-fiends serving their demon masters. It is unknown what state the fortress and its population are in after the closing of the Worldwound.

properties.Name: Mapstone Monument
properties.text: The Mapstone Monument is in the Lowcleft district of Magnimar in the Seerspring Gardens. This block of marble has been carved into a scale model of the city. The church of Abadar updates the sculpture annually using spells. On some holidays, other illusion spells are used for appealing effects. Meditating here is reputed to increase your mental resistance.

properties.Name: Marching Springs
properties.text: The Marching Springs are a 30 square mile region of Nirmathas between the Fangwood and the Mindspin Mountains. Geysers erupt in a procession through the region.

properties.Name: Marsh Tower
properties.text:
The Marsh Tower, also known by locals as the Marsh Stone Tower or the "Tower of Empty Stones", is one of the aeon towers that Aroden placed around the Isle of Kortos. The tower is a 300-foot-tall mudbrick step pyramid with a flat 10-foot-wide top and four uneven tiers.

The tower is located on the northern side of the Isle of Kortos, near the small town of Willowside. Its aeon orb was stolen by the Circle of Stones in 4710 AR, and the tower was subsequently inhabited by a splinter group of the Circle's nature priests known as the Empty Stones. The loss of the aeon stone accelerated the advance of the Welt, a blight that as of 4720 AR threatened to overtake the tower despite the efforts of the Empty Stones.

properties.Name: Matador's Lodge
properties.text: The Matador's Lodge is a Magnimarian restaurant and tavern that features entertainment centered around cruelty to animals. The spectacle includes bull baiting, cow catching, and horse breaking. So dedicated to man's dominance over animals, no vegetarian food is offered in the restaurant. The lodge also sponsors the late summer rodeos popular in the city. A disfigured bull's head is mounted above the bar with a plaque identifying it as the "Felled One". The proprietor, Basaalee Minvandu, is a cruel man, disdainful of others' suffering.

properties.Name: Mavradia
properties.text:
Mavradia was once a great Iobarian city and capital of the breakaway realm of Zastel. Founded upon the ruins of a cyclopean settlement in The Caemorin in 1240 AR, nearly one third of the city was destroyed during the Drakeplague of 4519 AR, when dragons battled each other within the city's walls, convinced it held a cure. The city would later be attacked by giants from Fangard, and subsequently conquered by rebellious insurgents in 4607 AR.

Mavradia would finally collapse into ruin when the city was struck with a second plague that turned its survivors into "oozing deaths", mindless gelatinous creatures that attacked others. The settlement has remained abandoned since 4659 AR, left to the oozing deaths and dragons, both alive and undead.

properties.Name: Maw of Karth
properties.text: The Maw of Karth is a cyclopean ruin that dates back to the era of the Koloran Empire. Built in Iobaria's Icerime Peaks, the Maw of Karth is a massive fanged skull carved into the mountains, towering over two neighbouring peaks to create a gate, with Karth's tongue as stairs and fangs as siderails that connect a massive stone doorway to the Koloran Roads. Many monsters see Karth as a god, and creatures such as goblins and kobolds favour the site as a location for ambushes.

properties.Name: Mbaiki
properties.text:
In the past, the folk of the city of Mbaiki revered the animals of the jungle, and the jaguar above all others. The people all wished to emulate the jaguarâ€”and something answered their call. The people rejoiced until it became clear that instead of being shapechangers they were condemned to live in jaguar form forever. In their rage they destroyed their city and then they moved into the jungle in small groups. It is said that some of the jungle's jaguars retain the knowledge of the Mbakai tribe, and can offer sage advice to those who know how to ask.

Today, the remains of the city are home to the most numerous tribe of halflings in the Kaava Lands, the Hazh'a. They revere Lamashtu and Zura, and collect the heads of intruders.

properties.Name: Menador Gap
properties.text: The Menador Gap is the sole passage through the Menador Mountains and Ravounel Forest, connecting the northwestern corner of the Archduchy of Menador to southeastern Ravounel in Cheliax. Part of the gap is a treacherous stretch of narrow mountainside roads constructed long ago by dwarven engineers, with Menador Keep located at the roads' narrowest point.

properties.Name: Menador Keep
properties.text: Menador Keep is a two-story dwarven-engineered gatehouse at the narrowest point of the Menador Gap, which connects the Chelaxian Archduchies of Menador and Ravounel through the Menador Mountains. The keep forms a short, artificial tunnel that bottlenecks traffic, which House Thrune staffs with loyal soldiers who exert heavy taxes and strict regulations on travel.

properties.Name: Menhu Leng
properties.text: Menhu Leng, also known as Menhu Suu, is a ruined city high in the northern Wall of Heaven mountains of Tian Xia. Menhu Leng sits in the central portion of the mountain range, an area that is known for its links to the nightmare plane of Leng. The cause of this link is much speculated upon, some believe this is due to the height of the mountains tearing at the very fabric of reality itself, while others speculate that in the most distant reaches of the past the denizens of Leng worked to create a primal link with the mountains. Whatever the case, the denizens of Leng now rule over the basalt ruins of Menhu Leng, using their winged shantaks to visit across the lands of Tian Xia to further their sinister schemes.

properties.Name: Mephit Spring
properties.text: Mephit Spring is a valley in the Footprints of Rovagug mountains of western Osirion that is the locus of several powerful elemental forces. Located between the Kho-Rarne Pass and Tar Kuata, the springs once were the home of many scamps who communed peacefully with one another. As of 4714 AR the mood has darkened, as a demon had taken over the area.

properties.Name: Merchants' Guildhall
properties.text: The Merchants' Guildhall is the base for Magnimar's Merchants' Guild located in the Dockway district. Even though it houses the city's most wealthy and powerful guild, the building does not display that wealth, remaining a plain, functional structure.

properties.Name: Mermaid's Bucket
properties.text: The Mermaid's Bucket is a famous tavern located next to the main docks of Crescent Harbor in the pirate city of Port Peril. A rowdy bar, the Mermaid's Bucket is decorated with numerous depictions of merfolk, fish masks, and other nautical paraphernalia of all sorts, including an enormous mosaic of a mermaid behind the bar. The Mermaid's Bucket's proprietor Nefti Unwesha also supplies rum to every bar, tavern, and brothel in town, buying out her competition with strangely minted silver coins.

properties.Name: Merry Pranksters
properties.text: The Merry Pranksters is a group of two dozen pirates who survive on the island of Hesmene's Grotto in the Shackles.

properties.Name: Merry Widow
properties.text:
The Merry Widow is a ship that was scuttled off the southern coast of Slitherfish Island to the northeast of Mediogalti Island. It is now half beneath the waves; its water-filled lower decks are home to great numbers of sharks and devilfish.

As of 4711 AR the wreck was being used as a temple to the pirate-goddess Besmara, established by a sect known as the Merry Widows. This splinter group is made up of women who have lost their husbands at sea. It is said that some Mediogalti women donate unwanted males to the ship-temple as a sacrifice to the goddess.

properties.Name: Minaret
properties.text: The Minaret is a domed tower of humanoid construction located high among the Fog Peaks of southern Galt. Rarely glimpsed only through powerful spyglasses, the origins and purpose of the Minaret remain unknown.

properties.Name: Minderhal's Anvil
properties.text: Minderhal's Anvil is an ancient temple to the giant smith-god Minderhal located in the Iron Peaks on the shores of the Storval Deep. Built thousands of years ago in the Thassilonian nation of Shalast with the labor of enslaved rune and stone giants, the temple is dominated by enormous, cracked marble pillars, a gigantic forge-altar, and a stone statue of Minderhal seated on his throne looking out over the Storval Deep with his chin resting on his fist. Few modern giants visit this old site, and the immense furnace, traditionally fed by the bodies of convicted criminals, stands cold.

properties.Name: Mindurian Villa
properties.text: Mindurian Villa is home to House Mindurian of Magnimar. Filuvia Mindurian, one of the biggest gossips within the Magnamarian aristocracy, lives here.

properties.Name: Mines of Deeptreasure
properties.text: The Deeptreasure Mining Company has a hidden and secret base known as the Mines of Deeptreasure that is located on the edge of the Bandu Hills. The company uses a group of xorns to obtain gems from the hills, which are later sold in Eleder. The xorns have been promised a way home once they supply an unspecified number of gems.

properties.Name: Mirazha
properties.text: Years ago, the town of Mirazha in Katapesh was a waypoint for weary travelers, then an mysterious disaster struck the town. Mirazha was deserted and travelers found the bodies of the townsfolk in the oasis on the edge of town. The bodies were desiccated and withered, all the moisture seemingly drained. For a time, Mirazha stood abandoned. Eventually the desert sands covered over the town, the oasis dried up, and the town was forgotten. Recently, an evil has revived the memory of Mirazha and its doomed inhabitants. Travelers report seeing a little town on the edge of a sparkling oasis, but if someone enters the cursed town, the town and the new victim vanish from sight. Adventurers in the area have yet to spot the cursed town, but sometimes they find the mummified bodies of the victims, buried in the sand.

properties.Name: Mirnura
properties.text:
Mirnura was once the capital of Jistka Imperium, founded by the legendary hero Arustun. The city was named after Arustun's beloved wife. It was situated on what is now the northern coast of Rahadoum, on the Fallen Peninsula north of the Path of Salt.

Mirnura was the main target in Ancient Osirion's campaign to destroy the Jistkan empire. When Osirians burned the city to the ground, they used millions of tons of salt to eradicate all signs of life around it. The Path of Salt region was named for this epic razing.

Powerful sandstorms sometimes reveal hints of monuments, and the vaults of Jistkan emperors are thought to show themselves to individuals of royal Jistkan descent. One of these vaults, known among the treasure hunters as the Halite Crypt, lies in tremendous depths and is rumored to still be protected by a Jistkan behemoth golem by the name Helatoros.

properties.Name: Mistress of Angels
properties.text: The Mistress of Angels is a fine marble sculpture located in Magnimar's southern Ordellia district. It depicts Ordellia Whilwren, one of Magnimar's founders, scanning the horizon of the Varisian Gulf, seemingly looking out for danger. Whilwren was a cleric of Desna and one of Alcaydian Indros' colleagues at the founding of the city, and the statue is an occasional gathering place for Magnimarian Mystery Cultists.

properties.Name: Mistshroud Cliff
properties.text: Mistshroud Cliff is in the eastern reaches of the Eismonts mountain range, south of the Maiestas River in southwestern Cheliax.

properties.Name: Mistwatch
properties.text: Mistwatch is a semi-ruined stone castle located atop a granite cliff overlooking the Verduran Fork east of the Isle of Arenway, in the Verduran Province of Taldor.

properties.Name: Moak Harbor
properties.text: Moak Harbor was a port city on Shark Island in the Shackles that was home to more than 8,000 people at its peak more than 200 years ago, but today is only rotting ruins.

properties.Name: Mobhad Leigh
properties.text: From the Shoanti term meaning "steps into hell," this perfectly circular pit is located at the base of the Kodar Mountains, on the Storval Plateau of northern Varisia, approximately 25 miles northeast of the source of the Aloren River. A set of spiral stairs run around the edge of the hole, but ends after only a few hundred feet. Beyond this point it is necessary to climb the sheer walls or fly. Few people know how deep the Mobhad Leigh actually is, although some rumor that it is so deep that it bypasses the Darklands region of Nar-Voth completely and opens directly into Sekamina.

properties.Name: Monastery of Tala
properties.text: Located in central Mendev, the Monastery of Tala caters to many faiths of the crusaders going to fight the demons in the Worldwound. Run by a cloistered order of monks from numerous faiths named the Brotherhood of Tala, it was founded in 4702 AR as a place where the various churches could conduct research on how best to combat the demonic forces of the Worldwound.

properties.Name: Monastery of the Veil
properties.text: The Monastery of the Veil is home to an isolated and mysterious group of monks. It is located in the remote Hungry Mountains in the eastern reaches of Ulcazar county in Ustalav.

properties.Name: Monkey's Paw
properties.text: The Monkey's Paw is a 60-foot-tall statue in the shape of a simian forearm and six-fingered hand located on the northern shores of Lake Ocota in the Mwangi Expanse. The tips of each of the fingers is shaped like the face of a different species of ape, cleverly hidden in the folds of the fingerprints. The eyes of the apes seem to follow one around as one moves around the statue. Ancient glyphs surround the base of the statue that are written in an ancient hybrid of the Chthonian and Mwangi languages. A secret door in the statue leads one into a small religious shrine dedicated to the demon lord Angazhan.

properties.Name: Monolith Glacier
properties.text: The Monolith Glacier is located near the north-westernmost corner of the Thanelands in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings; it is formed in the western reaches of the high Stormspear Mountains range and is slowly moving southwards. The Monolith Glacier has a distinct, very symmetrical oblong shape and those few brave explorers who have ventured up onto the glacier report seeing a large fortress entombed within the very heart of the glacier. Monolith Glacier is a very dangerous place to explore: blizzards often engulf it; its surface is riddled with crevasses and ice tunnels created by the numerous deadly remorhazes that live in the glacier's depths. Unbeknownst to everyone, the glacier is a sentient elemental that speaks with a voice of grinding ice and might be willing to allow access to the strange structure at its heart to anyone who can rid it of the pesky remorhazes infesting it.

properties.Name: Moon's Eye
properties.text: The Moon's Eye is a black granite formation located on the Nesmian Plains between the Deepcut River and the Marideth River. The formation has some religious significance to Kellid tribes in the area, dating back centuries. Explorers of the region occasionally report finding Kellid ruins in the area surrounding the Moon's Eye, though all reports are inconsistent of the location and description of these ruins. There are reports of unusually large wolves in the area as well.

properties.Name: Moonpool Causeways
properties.text: The Moonpool Causeways are a series of magical pools ranging in width from a few feet to half a mile located in the northeastern Fierani Forest of Kyonin.

properties.Name: Moonwing's Bough
properties.text: Moonwing's Bough is a small pocket of oak trees in the evergreen Grungir Forest which hosts an ancient shrine to Desna built thousands of years ago, during the reign of the Thassilonian Empire. The shrine is one of the most sacred sites of Desna's faith but very few worshipers attempt to visit it, traveling through the dangerous Grungir Forest. Moonwing's Bough is named after the first priest of Desna who reached the shrine in the modern age. The shrine is preserved in very good condition.

properties.Name: Mother of Skulls
properties.text: The Ustalavic county of Barstoi boasts three Pharasmin monasteries: the Chapel of Guilts; the Mother of Skulls; and the Vault of Tears. The Mother of Skulls lies in the south-east of the county between the Evergray and the West Sellen River near the border of Ustalav with Numeria.

properties.Name: Moundlands
properties.text: The Moundlands, located near the confluence of the Whitegold and Vyalldehun Rivers, is where the early Linnorm Kings were buried. Here, scores of small burial mounds surround 99 larger hills, 50 feet in height, each one of which contains a buried burial complex. The larger hills house the graves of the Linnorm Kings, while the smaller ones contain their champions or lesser nobles. The area is now avoided by all, as the kings animated in their cairns after the 99th one was laid to rest here.

properties.Name: Mount Antios
properties.text:
Mount Antios is Taldor's third-highest point. It is a snow-covered craggy peak of the World's Edge Mountains that stands tall above the south-central Tandak Plains. It is named after Taldor's tenth emperor who constructed an enormous burial site there known as Antios's Crown, including many huge statues representing himself, as well as statues of eagles, lions, and statues of the ancient gods of Old Taldor.

Mount Antios is located about 150 miles northeast of Oppara.

properties.Name: Mount Carissa
properties.text: Mount Carissa is the seventh-tallest peak of the Five Kings Range at 15,126 feet. It is one of four mountains surrounding the city of Taggoret, alongside Mount Onik to its east, Mount Langley to its north, and Mount Soryu to its west.

properties.Name: Mount Dowama
properties.text:
The great Mount Dowama towers above the Screaming Jungle in the Mwangi Expanse. Its snowcapped summit is visible through every break in the tree cover and the jungle's natives revere it as a holy place. Foreigners, meanwhile, often see the mountain as a challenge to be climbed and reach the summit. These clashing viewpoints have led to cold diplomatic relations and other interactions between the two groups.

It is located on the south-eastern side of the jungle and access to it is extremely difficult. Legends suggest that the ruins of the Shory Empire city of Ulduvai are hidden somewhere within an isolated vale.

properties.Name: Mount Ganog
properties.text: Mount Ganog is a twin-peaked mountain in the northern Kortos Mounts, located on the Isle of Kortos within the domain of the city-state of Absalom. At 21,000 feet tall, it is not the tallest peak in the range, a title held by Arazlant Mox. Unlike the rest of the craggy mountains of that range, Ganog is known for its gentle slopes and small mining communities, but that does not mean that there are no songs and tales told about it.

properties.Name: Mount Gustus
properties.text: Mount Gustus is a mountain in the Five Kings Mountains located northeast of the Darkmoon Vale near Kykar. It is one of the tallest peaks in the area at an elevation of 14,806 feet, and the fearsome red dragon Daralathyxl lairs in the nearby foothills.

properties.Name: Mount Kaltafarr
properties.text: Mount Kaltafarr is the tallest peak in Taldor. This dormant volcano is located in the Southern Range of the World's Edge Mountains, east of the southern border town of Zimar. The ancient white dragon known as the Great White Wyrm is said to dwell on Mount Kaltafarr, even though he has not been spotted in over a century.

properties.Name: Mount Kla
properties.text: Mount Kla is the 12th-tallest peak of the Five Kings Range at 14,411 feet. It is located in the central parts of the range east of Emperor's Peak and west of the Verduran Forest and is visible from the sunlit East End of Highhelm's King's Crown layer.

properties.Name: Mount Kumijinja
properties.text: Mount Kumijinja is a dormant volcano in northeastern Minkai, on the Ikkaku Peninsula among the Kamifushi Mountains. The Ghost Path runs along its caldera and shines the only sunlight into the Darklands region of Sekamina.

properties.Name: Mount Langley
properties.text: Mount Langley is the fourth-tallest peak of the Five Kings Range at 17,400 feet and is the site of one of the Carved Kings sculptures, bearing the visage of King Taggrick I. The mountain is located at Kingtower Pass and is one of four mountains surrounding the city of Taggoret, alongside Mount Onik to its east, Mount Carissa to its south, and Mount Soryu to its west.

properties.Name: Mount Mist
properties.text: Mount Mist is the fifth-tallest peak of the Five Kings Range at 16,237 feet. It is located near the Five Kings Mountains village of Bowton, which also hosts base camps of climbers attempting to scale the mountain.

properties.Name: Mount Onik
properties.text: Mount Onik is the 10th-tallest peak of the Five Kings Range at 14,714 feet. It is one of four mountains surrounding the city of Taggoret, alongside Mount Soryu to its west, Mount Langley to its north, and Mount Carissa to its south.

properties.Name: Mount Osiki
properties.text:
Mount Osiki is the tallest mountain within the range of Brazen Peaks in northern Garund, east of the Pahmet settlement of Erekrus. Its foothills and smaller peaks extend almost to the Crook River.

An ancient stairway begins from a stone landing on the southern bank of the Crook, winding through the foothills and the peaks to end at the top of the mountain. Upon the peak is an ancient shrine to a forgotten deity, and the few people that climb the ancient stairway each year are rumored to have committed to the pilgrimage after being saved from death or ruin by a dark-cloaked stranger. Nothing is known about what happens at the shrine, as the pilgrims returning from the top of Mount Osiki do not talk about it under any inducement.

properties.Name: Mount Rein
properties.text: Mount Rein is a large, snow-topped mountain in the western end of the Fog Peaks, on the border between the nations of Galt and Taldor. It is used as a guide to the border between those two nations.

properties.Name: Mount Rinia
properties.text:
Mount Rinia is a 15,000-foot-tall peak in the western Menador Mountains, located in the Archduchy of Menador in Cheliax. It is the Maiestas River's source, and home to orcs, humans, and yrthaks.

The mountain is named for the subject of a Taldan ballad, a noblewoman who flung herself from a mountain to escape an arranged marriage, but sprouted wings and flew away to unknown freedom.

properties.Name: Mount Sinatuk
properties.text:
Mount Sinatuk is a volcano at the far western end of the Five Kings Range, near the border of Druma and Isger. It is approximately two miles tall.

While the surrounding lands contain large fragments of black volcanic rock as evidence of an ancient eruption, as of 4712 AR the volcano had not been geographically active during the recorded history of the dwarves of the Five Kings Mountains. The nearby independent dwarven Regulate of Grimsburrow had used the dormant volcano's geothermic properties to provide heat, light, and steam power, and discovered mineable diamonds deep within its vacant lava tubes.

properties.Name: Mount Soryu
properties.text:
Mount Soryu is the 11th-tallest peak of the Five Kings Range at 14,603 feet. It is one of four mountains surrounding the city of Taggoret, alongside Mount Onik to its east, Mount Langley to its north, and Mount Carissa to its south.

The village of Scryer is located at its snowline and is home to stargazers and surveillers.

properties.Name: Mount Spire
properties.text: At almost 16,500 feet, Mount Spire is the highest peak in the Menador Mountains. The Veil of the Spire falls more than 300 feet into a large pool that is the origin of the Yolubilis River. Bellezeph Villa caters to an elite clientele of tourists who come to admire the falls, try out their mountaineering skills, or engage in amateur spelunking. Behind the falls are extensive networks of caves, home to cave fishers, chardas, goblins, and kobolds.

properties.Name: Mount Tsukiyo
properties.text: Mount Tsukiyo is the tallest mountain in Zi Ha and one of the tallest on the continent of Tian Xia. Located in the Kelsang Mountains and named for the moon deity Tsukiyo, it attracts pilgrims who travel the month-long Tsukiyo Trek in pursuit of guidance from the sky dragon Shei Long, as well as adventure-seeking mountain climbers who race to its summit during the When Earth Touches the Sky Festival.

properties.Name: Mount Veshka
properties.text: The summit of Mount Veshka is the tallest point in Brevoy, and the city of Eagle's Watch is located near its summit. It is the sole mountain in the hills that span the Golushkin Mountains to the west and the Icerime Peaks to the east.

properties.Name: Mount of Black Fire
properties.text:
The Mount of Black Fire is an extraordinary mountain in the Tusk Mountains. Unlike other active volcanoes, this mountain spews forth a dark ebony flame. Even more strangely, this ebony fire puts out regular fire. This unstable fire comes from overlapping gates connected to the Plane of Fire and the Void inside the mountain.

Of particular interest is the attraction of the Blackfire Adepts, a group of powerful individuals associated with an arcane cult. The Blackfire Adepts are drawn to the Mount of Black Fire due to its connection to distant planes and the eldritch energies it possesses. However, despite their efforts, they have not yet discovered a means to fully master or control this unique and enigmatic power source.

properties.Name: Mourning Burrows
properties.text: The Mourning Burrows were once a mass burial ground for Kellids who lived in Druma long ago. Today, Razmiran insurgents who survived their failed raid on Twingate have settled in the interconnected tunnels between the many mounds here.

properties.Name: Mudpot
properties.text: The Mudpot is a region of Nirmathas near the source of the Deepcut River in the Mindspin Mountains. Characterized by the large hot springs that bubble throughout it, the Mudpot is largely avoided by humanoids due to the population of oozes and elementals that reside here. Those that do brave the Mudpot are attracted by the rare alchemical agents and gemstones that are created by the volcanic activity in the region.

properties.Name: Mundatei
properties.text: Found in a desolate valley at the foot of the Mindspin Mountains in north-eastern Varisia, the Obelisk Forest of Mundatei is a ruin from the time of the Thassilonian empire and was built with the labor of enslaved rune and stone giants. Thousands of ten-foot-high stones, some carved with runes, are scattered about the landscape, and it has long been rumored that they are hollow and hold treasure. A century ago, an expedition from Korvosa tried to confirm this by breaking open some of them. They found that the obelisks were indeed hollow, each holding the desiccated body of a human who had died in terror and horrific pain. According to the Korvosan survivors, they were assaulted by strange undead that night who dragged off a dozen of their companions. The next morning it was discovered that the broken obelisks had wholly reformed. The site has been avoided ever since.

properties.Name: Mystic's Redoubt
properties.text: Mystic's Redoubt is the only public arcane library in Port Peril. It is a six-winged circular tower in Crescent Harbor, and it charges fees of as much as 1,000 gold pieces per year for its use. A small number of apprentices join the library each year, while other scholars visit Mystic's Redoubt to study relics in its antiquities hall. Rare natural components also grow in an adjacent, well-maintained garden.

properties.Name: Naldak's Point
properties.text: Naldak's Point is an abandoned dwarven town near Dalun in Irrisen.

properties.Name: Nameless Spires
properties.text: The Nameless Spires are the ruins of an ancient city located on Golarion's geographical North Pole, in the Crown of the World. The city was built by the saumen kar after the formation of Golarion but before Earthfall.

properties.Name: Narona
properties.text: The ruined city of Narona is located on Hellmouth Gulf on the western coast of Cheliax on the Arcadian Ocean. The city was destroyed by the Chelaxian Navy because of its resistance against the rule of House Thrune. Unlike the inhabitants of the nearby city of Pezzack, Narona's residents never returned after the settlement's destruction.

properties.Name: Nazilli
properties.text: The ruins of the town of Nazilli are located on the southern edges of the Verduran Forest in Taldor. The settlement was destroyed by the black dragon Aeteperax during a period of Taldan history known as the Dragon Plague.

properties.Name: Ndele Gap
properties.text:
The Ndele Gap is a high-altitude mountain pass in western Nex between the Barrier Wall to the north and the Shattered Range to the south.

It is the most obvious and frequently travelled eastern route into the Mwangi Expanse, and Taldor's ill-fated Sixth Army of Exploration marched through the Gap on its way to disaster in the jungle.

The thin air and cold temperatures make travel difficult, and travellers are occasionally attacked by bandits and kholo.

properties.Name: New Krane
properties.text: New Krane is the fortress headquarters of the Hellknight Order of the Coil and is located in Sargava on the shore of Desperation Bay, northeast of the capital city of Eleder.

properties.Name: Newt Market
properties.text:
The Newt Market is located in Kintargo's scholastic district of Villegre and serves as both the district's main marketplace and a draw for adventurers. The market is known for selling a surprisingly large amount of rare goods and magic items, including a wand of greater invisibility.

The Newt Market is maintained by an organiser known as The Newt, a title that changes hands on a regular basis but by 4724 AR had been held for an uncharacteristically long time by a charismatic gnome alchemist who happily uses bribery and intimidation to protect his interests.

properties.Name: Nicyruse
properties.text:
Nicyruse was an ancient city of the Jistka Imperium located today in southern Avistan, on the Inner Sea coast. It housed one of the largest temple-forges in all the Imperium, rivaling even that of Rachikan. When Jistka's doom became imminent, divine earthquakes tore the region apart and city's forges were abandoned. Now the seaside ruins of Nicyruse have mostly eroded away by the Inner Sea.

In 4712 AR, reports from the Chelaxian city of Hinji to the east stated that a recent storm had cleared a new entrance to the buried site. Fisherfolk said that mechanical creatures began moving across the shore near the ruins, grabbing fish from the ocean with their bare hands, and taking them back into the ruins. The Pathfinder Society has called for adventurers to explore the ruins and bring back any information about lost Jistka.

properties.Name: Nidalese embassy
properties.text: The presence of the Nidalese Embassy in the Castle District of Kintargo is unsurprising given the city's proximity to the shadowy nation of Nidal and how much trade comes from these neighbouring.

properties.Name: Nightfall Station
properties.text: Nightfall Station is the most profitable of the Aspis Consortium trading posts in the Mwangi Expanse. It is thirteen days' travel by wheelboat against the current from Bloodcove (assuming the travelers push on for a while after dark on the last day and arrive at the station at night, hence the name) but the return journey with the current is only five days.

properties.Name: Nightways Gate
properties.text:
The Nightways Gate and the Night Road are named for linking Kintargo to its shadowy northern neighbour of Nidal via the scholastic district of Villegre. The gate and road form an awkward but necessary trade route, as due to Kintargo's distance from Cheliax's central heartlands, goods from Nidal are often cheaper.

When Kintargo was under Chelaxian rule, this route also granted the fell influence of Nidalese culture another inroad into Cheliax. After Kintargo and Ravounel won their independence from Cheliax in 4716 AR, Lord Mayor Jilia Bainilus has engaged in active diplomacy with Nidal.

properties.Name: Nirodin Villa
properties.text: Nirodin Villa is a stately townhouse in the northwest of Magnimar's Alabaster District. Situated directly next to Kaddren Villa, it is the seat of House Nirodin, and run by Cheiskaia Nirodin, the family's matriarch.

properties.Name: No-Horn
properties.text:
The No-Horn is a low quality tavern in Magnimar's Dockway neighbourhood. It typifies the sort of establishment that pops up periodically near the Bazaar of Sails, only to close again in short order. It is named for its sign, which depicts a hornless unicorn being tormented by drunken devils.

The structure itself is a rickety and leaning thing constructed from an old ship's hull. The establishment's barkeep is an ornery man missing both of his ears. Patrons can expect cheap food and drink here, but both are of an extraordinarily low quality.

properties.Name: Nogortha Necropolis
properties.text: The Nogortha Necropolis (also known as the Necropolis of Nogortha) is a vast burial site located in central Andoran between the Arthfell Mountains and Nogortha Peaks, southwest of the city of Oregent. These barrow mounds are the final resting place of hundreds of barbarians who once inhabited the Arthfell Forest but who were finally defeated in 1707 AR by Taldor's campaign of western expansion led by General Khastalus. Many of the burial mounds have been emptied by grave robbers or are being excavated by Pathfinders, although many also remain to be explored.

properties.Name: Norboro Ashes
properties.text: Norboro was the second town built on the cursed island of Whyrlis Rock, in the Shackles. It was founded only 6 months after its sister town of Heskott Bay. At about the same time that the residents of Heskott Bay vanished into thin air, the town of Norboro turned to ash. The location is now known as the Norboro Ashes.

properties.Name: Nordein Glacier
properties.text: The Nordein Glacier is located in the central Fog Peaks of southern Galt. The mountain on which the glacier sits contains a hidden valley that is slowly being swallowed by the ice. Legends claim that an evil spirit called the Jarl of the North Wind lives near the glacier.

properties.Name: Nystra
properties.text: Nystra is a ghost-town in the far-eastern reaches of the River Kingdoms. Once a thriving community centered around the cultivation and production of the fine silk produced by the insectoid silk gargoyles, or silkgoyles, its inhabitants were totally wiped out in a revenge plot by the Taldan druid Tharl Grimull in 4664 AR.

properties.Name: Oakrib Inn
properties.text: Oakrib Inn is the site where the Silver Ravens negotiated the details of Ravounel's secession from Cheliax. This large inn near the head of the Yolubilis River was once a popular stopping point for those traveling through the Menador Gap. Since the destruction of Menador Keep and the closure of the Gap, the inn's owner Olradi Ormovor has reinvented it as a luxury tourist destination and historical heritage site, complete with dramatic reenactments of the tense negotiations.

properties.Name: Obelisk of Wonders
properties.text: The Obelisk of Wonders is a mysterious ruined monument on the island of Kepre Dua in the Shackles. It is carefully guarded by the elven witch Kaala Raingold, who believes she receives revelations from it.

properties.Name: Observatory
properties.text:
A 20-foot-square stone platform in the middle of an otherwise featureless plain in southern Katapesh, the Observatory would be of little interest if not for its spectacular magic.

The platform's craftsmanship indicates that it is of dwarven workmanship. In the centre is carved an ornate butterfly, the religious symbol of Desna, while in each corner of the platform stands a pillar. The site is clearly dedicated to the goddess of dreams and travel, and when a person lies on her religious symbol and looks up at the sky, it is vastly magnified. Between the four corner pillars, the night sky appears much closer and clearer, stars pulse, and distant meteors fly past as if mere feet above.

It is no surprise this site is seen as holy and attracts worshippers, astronomers, and prophets all seeking inspiration.

properties.Name: Odd Stories
properties.text: Odd Stories is a bookshop located at 100 Roseguard Road in Otari, on the Isle of Kortos. Its proprietor is the human wizard Morlibint.

properties.Name: Odde & Daughter Herbs
properties.text: Odde & Daughter Herbs is a good example of the semi-organised chaos that has come to embody Old Kintargo. The shop itself has been out of business for years but has since become the informal venue for street vendors and downtrodden merchants. A local cambion vendor of dubious-quality street meats named Ryk had taken up semi-permanent residence in the building selling his strangely delicious wares most days. The building is also rumored to be haunted.

properties.Name: Okerra Estate
properties.text: Okerra Estate is home to Nicolaus Okerra as well as his daughter Selli Okerra and serves as the seat of House Okerra. It is a small and cozy citadel, especially when compared with nearby estates like the Palace of Birdsong, that sits overlooking the town of Pensaris.

properties.Name: Old Detmer
properties.text: Old Detmer is the nickname given by the locals to the underwater ruins of the city of an ancient civilization. Standing stones and antimagic wards scattered around the area make it difficult to explore fully.

properties.Name: Old Fang
properties.text: A cheap and cheerful shore-front inn and taproom in the Dockway region of Magnimar, the Old Fang tavern, sometimes just called the Fang tavern, is typical of the many inns that crowd that part of the city. The taproom of the inn is decorated with all sorts of nautical paraphernalia courtesy of the owner's late husband. The Old Fang is run by a woman called Ol' Mam Grottle and is a particular favorite drinking hole for many of the locals.

properties.Name: Old Forest Tower
properties.text:
The Old Forest Tower is one of the aeon towers that Aroden placed around the Isle of Kortos. The tower is a 300-foot-tall mudbrick step pyramid with a flat 10-foot-wide top and four uneven tiers.

The tower is located in the Swardlands on the Isle of Kortos in the Immenwood.

Unlike the other Aeon Towers, this tower contains a shrine to Aroden inside.

properties.Name: Olivine Tomb of Djederet II
properties.text: Little is known about the Olivine Tomb of Djederet II, located in Osirion during its First Age in what is now Thuvia. Its namesake pharaoh Djederet II was the nephew of Hakotep I and succeeded him as Osirion's ruler in -1611 AR, and is known for reverting many of the Sky Pharaoh's works.

properties.Name: Olmer's Smithy
properties.text: Since at least 4715 AR and as of 4724 AR, Olmer's Smithy is one of the few remaining blacksmiths in Old Kintargo, most having moved to either Jarvis End or Yolubilis Harbor. Olmer's Smithy is owned by the gruff, stubborn dwarf Olmer whom it is named after. He has built up a small but loyal following over the years, but his poor social skills have hindered this. Olmer's has a magical chain shirt for sale that has languished unsold for years now.

properties.Name: Ongongte Overlook
properties.text: Ongongte Overlook is a narrow bluff in the southwestern corner of Mgange Cove in the Shackles that is considered a holy site to the worshipers of juju.

properties.Name: Orcmoot
properties.text: The Orcmoot is the yearly meeting near the dromaar town of Averaka on the remote island of the Flintyreach in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. At Orcmoot, the residents discuss their goals and visions for the island. Suota Iron-Tongue is the moderator of the Orcmoot.

properties.Name: Oroskirr
properties.text: Oroskirr, also known as the Opal Island or the Ever-Watching Eye, is a strange opalescent dome that rises from the waters of the Nyvyrd in northern Iobaria. The dome glows and crackles with energy every night, and draws lightning to its surface during thunderstorms. Its surface has never been breached, but locals presume it is the source of the Nyvyrd's unusually warm waters.

properties.Name: Osprey
properties.text:
The Osprey is one of the ten remaining pilings of the Irespan in Magnimar. It is the shortest of the ten, standing only 100 feet high.

There is an entrance into the upper piling. The church of Abadar is rumored to operate a prison here. Locals believe that political prisoners and others that are best hidden away are held here.

properties.Name: Osprey Club
properties.text: The Osprey Club, located in the Naos district of Magnimar, caters to a restrictive clientele of the richest families in the city. Gambling, drinking, and smoking are common activities here; there is also a brothel, for those so inclined. The exterior of the club is guarded by an iron fence to keep the onlookers outside. Green and gold magical lights illuminate the outside every night. The club is currently run by Kayasi Zivatchi.

properties.Name: Our Lady of Blessed Waters
properties.text: Our Lady of Blessed Waters is a monument rising out of the Seerspring Garden in Magnimar's Keystone district. Nobody knows who built this bronze statue of woman who many believe is a spirit living in the Seerspring. Religious scholars maintain they can concentrate better after spending time studying the statue.

properties.Name: Outcast Fishery
properties.text: The Outcast Fishery is a series of warehouses and dry docks supporting Magnimar's fishing industry. Members of the guild also have access to an on-site tavern, the Left-Handed Lobster. About one-third of Magnimar's navy uses the facilities here. The fishermen have a rivalry with the local merchant vessels, but seem to have lost the attention of their primary patron, House Valdemar.

properties.Name: Ovorikheer Pass
properties.text: Ovorikheer Pass is part of the Path of Aganhei as it descends from the high ice of the Crown of the World into the catchment basin of Ruun Uvas in Tian Xia.

properties.Name: Oxjaw Falls
properties.text: The Oxjaw Falls is a 40-foot-tall cataract formed by the Crook River east of the Slave Trenches of Hakotep, near the headwaters of the river. The Crook drops suddenly from the highlands into the lower reaches of the Brazen Frontier region of Osirion. Oxjaw Falls create a moist and verdant pocket within a rocky grotto. The lizardfolk that live at the base of the cataract worship and guard an ancient altar set into the grotto's mossy walls. At the top of the cataract the water flows through deep channels between flat rocks (resembling the ox's teeth) that allow a slippery crossing for travelers on foot. It is the only safe foot crossing west of the Shallows of Ipeq and has the advantage of being away from the Ipeq guards and gossipy fisher folk.

properties.Name: Painted Flutes
properties.text:
The Painted Flutes is a vast canyon nestled within the Barrier Wall mountains of western Katapesh. The valley is named for the unique geological phenomena found within, including dozens of hoodoosâ€”tall, wind carved pillars of rock that look like totem polesâ€”that are made of a variety of layers of different, brightly-coloured rocks as a spectacular landscape. The wind howls through the valley and when it reaches the right speed in creates haunting music like some sort of giant wind instrument.

Due to the forces of erosion constantly changing its shape, as well as its strong winds, the direction and duration the song created by the hoodoos is never the same twice. The valley attracts many bards and other musicians to hear its wondrous song. The valley is also inhabited by clans of janns and wandering air elementals who roam the deep canyons.

properties.Name: Palace Mortales
properties.text: In the southern deserts of the country of Katapesh, a giant, curving ribcage of a beast rises from the sand. Over the years, travelers have used the giant ribcage as shelter. Sometimes they refer to it as Palace Mortales.

properties.Name: Palace of Birdsong
properties.text: The Palace of Birdsong is one of the traditional estates of Taldor's current ruling family, House Stavian. It is located at the heart of the Stavian Barony in Meratt County of Taldor's Tandak Prefecture, near Lotheedar.

properties.Name: Palace of Ivory and Bone
properties.text: The Palace of Ivory and Bone is a perverse, desecrated fortress within the holy lands of the Divine Garden region of eastern Vudra.

properties.Name: Palace of Virtue
properties.text: The Palace of Virtue is a monastery in eastern Molthune, located in the northern foothills of the Menador Mountains. It houses several bronze dragons in human guise who act as advisors to its leaders.

properties.Name: Palace of the Brumal Lords
properties.text:
The frozen Palace of the Brumal Lords is where the three Brumal Lords are magically sealed, as they have been for the past 1,400 years. The three fey Baeloc, Nojec, and Yahlo were once allied with Baba Yaga, but after the Holvirgang Uprising they retreated here and refused any attempts at peace. So Queen Jadwiga used the Lock of Pajari to seal them within its walls.

Gremlins are the only creatures that can still get in and out of the palace, and will sometimes raid nearby villages.

properties.Name: Palace of the People's Council
properties.text: The many chambers of the Palace of the People's Council serve as the meeting places and offices of the People's Council, Andoran's legislative body. Located in the Liberty District, at the western end of the Field of Concord in the capital city of Almas, the ground floor of the palace contains a massive amphitheater packed with marble benches in which the council members meet to debate Andoren laws. The rest of the building is filled with the council members' offices and other personal spaces.

properties.Name: Pale Mountain
properties.text: The Pale Mountain is located in northwest Katapesh near the junction of the Brazen Peaks and the Barrier Wall. It is avoided by travelers as numerous kholo tribes are active in the area. The Carrion King is the ruler of these tribal worshipers of Rovagug.

properties.Name: Palette Falls
properties.text: The Palette Falls waterfall is where the green waters of Emerald Creek and the orange-hued Ironpass River merge before flowing into the Inkwater River. This area, located on the Nesmian Plains in Nirmathas, is the only region that mottled palette berries grow, which can be turned into a unique spice. The unusual water coloring has led to otters with speckled green fur. The pelts of these otters are sold at high prices in Canorate.

properties.Name: Path of Commencement
properties.text:
The Path of Commencement is a winding mountain path between Isger and Druma located southwest of Petitioner's Port and features exquisite dwarven stonemasonry, including the expertly carved stone bridge which resembles two dwarven kings reaching toward each other with hammers.

Originally constructed during the empire of Tar Taargadth and nearly four thousand years old, the Path of Commencement name was named during its restoration, which was paid for by the Druman Kalistocrats in the aftermath of Aroden's death and in anticipation of Isgeri refugees coming to Druma via the path.

properties.Name: Paupers' Graves
properties.text:
Paupers' Graves is a small graveyard three miles east of Sandpoint along the old Varisian Kaspakari (traditional coastal route along the Lost Coast). It was used as a graveyard by the poor of Sandpoint and the laborers from Magnimar who built the town. Usage dwindled once the Sandpoint Boneyard was opened to all regardless of ability to pay.

Several years ago Jediah Kheln robbed the cemetery of its medallion of the Empyreal Lord Ashava. Kanker, ghoul priest of Kabriri, tricked Kheln into this theft. Kheln was repaid by Kanker with his death and transformation into a ghoul. Since then Kheln has turned the graveyard into his personal domain, building an underground warren for himself, his ghoul thralls, and his feral ghoul hounds.

The warrens extend throughout the region, reaching under Devil's Platter and even to the old smuggler's tunnels beneath Sandpoint. Kanker presides over an ancient temple to Kabriri somewhere in the tunnels.

properties.Name: Pavilion of Falling Flowers
properties.text: The Pavilion of Falling Flowers is the primary academy of Jininese swordfighting and magical combat. Admission is highly selective, especially for outsiders.

properties.Name: Pediment Building
properties.text: The Pediment Building contains the Office of the Lord-Mayor, plus Magnimar's primary court and the Halls of Virtue, as well as its only prison. The latter is located beneath the building: a prison known to all Magnimar as "The Hells". The Pediment Building is located atop the wealthy Summit region in the Capital District near the Usher's Hall. The building itself is large and intimidating, its vast exterior topped with imposing architecture and scowling gargoyles. Its inhabitants are scarcely less intimidating: the stern faced judges of Magnimar's Justice Court.

properties.Name: Penitents
properties.text: The Penitents are a group of 18 religious pilgrims who are stranded on the island of Hesmene's Grotto in the Shackles. They are led by the paladin Jayhalle Messierre, and include worshipers of both Erastil and Abadar. Messierre does his best to keep the arguments and petulant bickering between the members of the Penitents to a minimum, all the while fending off the unusual and deadly creatures found on the island. They occasionally come into conflict with the Merry Pranksters, a group of pirates who are also stranded on the island, and even more rarely join forces with the buccaneers to fight against their common foe, the rusalka Blue Hesmene.

properties.Name: Pergamon Pass
properties.text: Pergamon Pass is a route through the south of the World's Edge Mountains in Taldor. The closest settlement to the pass is the town of Dalaston.

properties.Name: Petronax Estate
properties.text: Petronax Estate is the Petronax family home, made up of three multi-story structures. Vayde Petronax, the family patriarch, rarely leaves this estate.

properties.Name: Pho Yim
properties.text:
Pho Yim, sometimes written Mount Pho-Yim, is an enormous volcano located in the south of Tang Mai that looms over the nation's capital of Surat Prakan and is a part of the vast Kullan Dei mountain range. While Pho Yim is currently not active, it does smoke ominously and it is rumoured that its molten fury is only held at bay by the harmony of the five sorcerous rulers of Tang Mai. Nevertheless, During the Age of Ascendancy, the volcano did erupt explosively destroying much of Tang Mai in 7099 IC and, some say, in consequence of the invasion of the country by Lung Wa some years previously.

The local hero Ankilhi used the fires of Pho Yim to forge a tetsubo out of the remains of the graveknight Pnao Kilnak.

properties.Name: Pidderack Shaft
properties.text: The Pidderack Shaft is a mysterious vertical shaft found on the Nesmian Plains. Named for the family of farmers who discovered it when digging a new well, there is no established depth to the shaft, and the worked stone that lines the shaft gives no hints to its history. On the winter solstice, unusually large ghostly spiders emerge from the shaft. The farmhouse that surrounds the shaft has long been abandoned.

properties.Name: Pig
properties.text:
The Pig is a run-down tavern in the working-class Rag's End neighborhood of Magnimar's Beacon's Point district. A former slaughterhouse, the building housing the Pig had been condemned for years before being converted into a drinking establishment. Even though the wind whistles through its many holes and leaks, it has never been able to completely rid itself of its abattoir smell.

The Pig is patronized mostly by butchers who work nearby and who are used to the smell. It serves few drinks and even less food, but is known for brineskin curls, a pickled pig-skin dish soaked in brine and blood, that can turn the stomach of even the most veteran butcher.

properties.Name: Pillar of Palamia
properties.text: The Pillar of Palamia is an ancient obelisk made from basalt believed to be a monument to a forgotten god in the northwestern Whisperwood of central Cheliax. Others claim that it is a god's prison, and that the Pillar sticking into the ground is itself the nail holding in the trapped deity.

properties.Name: Pillars of Kreth
properties.text:
The Pillars of Kreth are located on the plains just west of the Flood Road in northern Belkzen. The Pillars are a series of eleven dolmensâ€”massive vertical standing stones topped with flat lintels. The site was discovered by the orc Kreth but the orcs are superstitious by nature and they have never revisited the Pillars of Kreth since then. The first ten dolmens are each between 8 and 9 feet in height, 3 feet wide and 2 feet thick. The linels are 3 feet thick, overhanging the stones beneath them by approximately a foot on all sides. The easternmost dolmen is only around 4 feet high. The stones seem to have been worked by primitive hand tools and contain numerous symbols and pictograms that correspond to no known language. Some of the symbols are clearly stars, comets, and planets. The eleven dolmens forms an irregular tunnel that once a year aligns with the red planet Akiton. During this time the sky above the Pillars turns strange colors, and a vibration can be felt from half a mile away. As the vibrations become stronger, a torus of churning auroral light rises a mile above the site and a pulse of energy passes through the first ten dolmens and strikes the top of the easternmost one. Anything on top of the last dolmen dissapears for ever.

Pathfinders who have studied the Pillars of Kreth believe that they could be a kind of interplanetary transportation device, similar to the Doorway to the Red Star in the Mwangi Expanse or the Maze of the Open Road in Galt.

properties.Name: Pillars of Rovagug
properties.text: The Pillars of Rovagug are a set of mountains in the far north of the World's Edge Mountains in Taldor.

properties.Name: Pit of Raugsmauda
properties.text:
The Pit of Raugsmauda is located on Motaku Isle in the Shackles. It was the former subterranean lair of the infamous sorcerer Raugsmauda.

It was assumed that Raugsmauda was gone forever but, in 4512 AR, a group of adventurers descended into the Pit of Raugsmauda and discovered the sorcerer, now transformed into a vicious lich. The adventurers fought Raugsmauda, who fled westward and eventually settled on a small, uninhabited, cave-riddled volcanic isle that now has the name of Raugsmauda's Reach.

The upper levels of the Pit have long been plundered over the years, but much of the massive dungeons in the Pit's cavernous depths remain unexplored, and potentially hold Raugsmauda's treasures and horrors.

properties.Name: Pit of Zedoran
properties.text:
The Pit of Zedoran is a vast sinkhole within the depths of the Northern Fangwood. Streams of water carrying leaves and organic debris cascade down its sides, and layers of moss and lichen cover hanging vines and ancient roots. The thick forest canopy allows little sunlight to reach the moss-covered earth.

The pit is named for the green dragon Zedoran who as of 4722 AR still laired here. At the edge of the central pit is a wooden cage lift, manually operated by Zedoran's minions. There are two cages, one at the top and the other at the bottom of the pit, each large enough to hold eight humans.

properties.Name: Pjallarane's Stone
properties.text:
Pjallarane's Stone is a rock formation in Irrisen's province of Thronehold. According to legend, Baba Yaga turned her rebellious daughter Pjallarane to stone hereâ€”and the formation does bear a remarkable resemblance to a woman clinging to a tree and begging for mercy. However, most scholars believe Pjallarane departed Golarion with her mother, just like all the other former Queens of Irrisen.

The stone does seem to have some strange arcane power, however, although no one has ever been able to access it. Some believe the stone might hold the key to banishing Irrisen's eternal winter, although there is scant evidence for this.

The local snow goblins view the stone as a holy site, and occasionally bury offerings to Baba Yaga nearby.

properties.Name: Plain of Ten Thousand Swords
properties.text: The Plain of Ten Thousand Swords in Numeria's Felldales is the haunted site of a bitter conflict from centuries past. The swords of thousands of Kellid warriors jut from the ground, each cursed with the bitter spirit of a warrior slain in the pointless war and bound to their weapon.

properties.Name: Plains of Conflict
properties.text: The Plains of Conflict is a designated battleground in the Cradle region of the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra. The mahajanapadas of the region boast swathes of incredibly fertile and valuable farmland, but many are also frequently at war with each other. To protect the farmlands from the effects of battle, the vast Plains of Conflicts were left unsettled and reserved for combat. The mahajanapadas of Kaurata and Pandata have been involved in intermittent hostilities there for centuries and shows no sign of abating.

properties.Name: Porthmos Prison
properties.text:
Porthmos Prison is located in Porthmos Prefecture in eastern Taldor, hard against the World's Edge Mountains and near the town of Sardis. Once called Edgeside Keep, it was built by Taldor as a border fort on the edge of the Whistling Plains, but was damaged in an earthquake in the 47th century AR, deemed irreparable, and abandoned. Shortly thereafter it was taken over by the Grand Duke of Porthmos Prefecture, Thestro Briarsmith who needed a place to send political prisoners.

The prison is unusual in that it is almost wholly run by the prisoners themselves. The only interaction the guards have with the inmate population is supplying food and keeping them from escaping, all done from the safety of two 60-foot tall crenelated inner and outer walls that ring the prison. The rest is left up to those incarcerated inside, who typically band together into gangs for mutual protection.

Ancient enchantments prevent magical means of entrance and escape. Tunneling is also fraught with peril due to the local bulettes and chokers. Some smuggling does occur via the sewer system.

properties.Name: Pug's Contraptions
properties.text:
Pug's Contraptions is a clockwork-creation business and tinker shop in the northwest of Magnimar's Ordellia district that generally deals in small contraptions such as toys, unique locks, and other baubles. It is run by old Morgamer Pug, a halfling who is in direct competition with the much-larger Golemworks.

Pug has carved himself out a small niche in only dealing in smaller, clockwork machines, but would love to cut into the Golemworks' business. To this end, he has an ongoing agreement with Venture-captain Sheila Heidmarch of the city's Pathfinder lodge to buy any construct her agents may come across in their journeys. The guildsign for the store is a pig whose mouth is stuffed with lockpicks, a remnant of the owner's first business (which he still practices when he can't sell clockworks) of creating locks and other small metalworks such as bird cages.

properties.Name: Pulgari Estate
properties.text: The Pulgari Estate was built by Bridden Pulgari in the hopes of contacting Mammon through it, taking advantage of a portal to Hell beneath the estate. The ritual failed, and the portal is now permanently open, gaining the attention of infernal and celestial beings alike, such as Ambithas, a gate archon.

properties.Name: Pulura's Fall
properties.text: Pulura's Fall is a former waterfall located in the Sarkoris Scar, northeast of the ruins of Iz. Maybe one of the only places not fully controlled by demons in the Wounded Lands while the Worldwound was open, a temple of Pulura led by the powerful cleric Eliandra stood in the dried-up waterfall.

properties.Name: Pure Temple of the Maharajah
properties.text: The Pure Temple of the Maharajah is built over the spring that is the source of the River Sald in the small eastern hills of Jalmeray. The structure is white and gold and is maintained by bound genies and a huge number of slaves and their duty-bound overseers. The temple is dedicated to Khiben-Sald, the ancient ruler who founded Jalmeray. Every four years, thousands of people make their way up the Sald from the city of Niswan to pay respects to his memory. Even though the maharajah is not buried here (and some claim that he is still alive), the people treat the Pure Temple as if it was his final resting place.

properties.Name: Pyramid of Doom
properties.text: The Pyramid of Doom is a site in southern Osirion. It is located to the west of the Salt Hills.

properties.Name: Pyramid of Kamaria
properties.text:
The Pyramid of Kamaria is the burial place for the Pharaoh Kamaria the Brazen, the only Osirian ruler to have openly worshiped the god Rovagug. It sits on the outskirts of the southern Osirian city of An, and dominates the settlement's southern skyline. The upper levels of the pyramid have long been cleared-out by tomb robbers, but are the home of a large cult of Rovagug; even they do not enter the lower trap-infested levels, however. The pyramid's central shaft dominates these dungeons, and it reaches all the way down to the Bloodcleft in the Darklands realm of Nar-Voth. A tribe of degenerate grimlocks is known to dwell near the shaft's base, and they occasionally trade strange artifacts and monstrous pets for slaves and food with the cultists above.

The first major task of pharaoh Gebessek IX, after the assassination of his despised mother, was to exterminate every Rovagug cultist in the pyramid, the entire population of the city of An, and seal the sublevels of the pyramid with potent magic and wards.

In the reign of pharaoh Remeses IV the cult of Rovagug sought to return to the pyramid. Remeses IV initially dealt harshly with the cult, now known as the Cult of Rovagug Made Visible and led by Eshemel Bhalloc, but later decided it was better to allow them to re-establish themselves within the pyramid rather than have them organise elsewhere in secret. This policy has been followed by subsequent pharaohs.

properties.Name: Pyre
properties.text: The Pyre is a headland which extends into the Varisian Gulf just southwest of Sandpoint. Before Sandpoint was settled, Varisians used this area for rituals, including the Swallowtail Festival.

properties.Name: Pyre Crest
properties.text: Pyre Crest is a volcano in the area of Brazen Peaks that remains uninhabited by the kholo that otherwise litter the range. Not even scrubs grow on the scorched sides of Pyre Crest though the eruption that covered the sides of the mountain in lava occurred centuries ago. Blackened tracks of hardened magma cover the surface of the mountain like veins.

properties.Name: Queen Peak
properties.text: Queen Peak is the eighth-tallest peak of the Five Kings Range at 14,831 feet. It is located in the southern parts of the range between Mount Gustus and Mount Onik.

properties.Name: Queen's Processional
properties.text: The Queen's Processional is a location one must pass in order to enter the Cove of the Queen on route to the mythical Holy Isle found in the Shackles island known as Besmara's Throne.

properties.Name: Quldari's Vault
properties.text: Quldari's Vault is an enormous vault buried deep in the depths of the grasslands of Xopatl. Quldari's Vault was created by Quldari, a beastkin who was one of the last remaining hero-gods of Xopatl's ancient history. Seeing that this era of the hero-gods was finally coming to an end, Quldari created an enormous solid obsidian vault that he said contained everything Xopatl would need to survive in the future. The mages of Xopatl were finally able to open the first door in -2311 AR but, to their surprise, found nothing of value in the first chamber. Since then, in total, thirty three doors have been opened and, so far, no treasure has ever been found, only more obstacles and doors.

properties.Name: Qumarin
properties.text: The remnants of the lost and accursed city of Qumarin are located in the southern Meraz Desert of Qadira. Its location has been largely forgotten except for a few reclusive girtablilu tribes and it is avoided by everyone.

properties.Name: Rachikan
properties.text:
The ruins of the ancient Jistkan city of Rachikan were discovered in 4709 AR by the Pathfinder Eldis Grone among the Pillars of Anferita in southwestern Cheliax.

It is the site of a Grand Athenaeum expedition led by Marianix Karn.

properties.Name: Ralthorn Manor
properties.text:
Ralthorn Manor was once the summer home of a minor Cassomiri noble family in the Meratt County region of the Tandak Prefecture. Now, it is little more than ruins. House Ralthorn was one of Taldor's many minor noble houses; they had made their money in shipbuilding in Cassomir and spared little expense in building their lavish summer estate in the more bucolic Meratt County. Around 20 years after the estate's completion, it was struck by one of the region's rare earthquakes, which collapsed most of the manor.

It was over a month before anyone came to investigate, and those who did discovered all of the family had been crushed to death in their beds. Although the family's remains were excavated and removed for proper burial, rumours persist that the family still haunts the site. Hunters who venture near the manor report ghostly child-like figures that play amongst the remains of the orchard, watched by a stern woman who seems to manifest from the remains of crushed stone.

properties.Name: Ranage's Circle
properties.text:
Ranage's Circle is a tight-knit circle of massive cypress trees in the heart of the Mwangi Jungle. It was planted 1,000 years ago by druids of the Jambala Jaeg tribe. The ancient magic of the circle protects against evil creatures and hostile wildlife, making it a safe resting place for those who know how to find it. The tree at the centre of the circle has a split trunk, which is wrapped tightly around a black stone. According to legend, the stone is the prison of Golokango, who is either a demon or a powerful jungle spirit. The central tree is barely alive, and according to the legend is a arboreal regent druid who sacrificed most of its life force to seal the prison. Some tales even claim that the guardian is a sibling of Dimari-Diji, the incredibly ancient arboreal regent of Osibu.

Among its guardians is Temteki, an earth elemental that resembles a tree.

properties.Name: Raschka-Tor
properties.text: Raschka-Tor is the lair of the most fearsome family of red dragons in the entire Hold of Belkzen. The family consists of four red dragons, two still only wyrmlings. They were one of the greatest threats to anyone traveling across northern Belkzen until the idea of leaving them tribute at Covenant Rock caught on. The dragons live in a mountainside cave known as Raschka-Tor which is orc for fire mountain. Rumour has it that their lair is in fact just the entrance to a vast city carved within the mountain itself. However, due to the dragons' dislike of nosy adventurers, no one has yet been able to verify these rumours.

properties.Name: Rastel
properties.text:
The ruined city of Rastel was once a thriving settlement of the now-extinct nation of Rastel. The ruins stand upon the banks of the Upper Korir River, in the Korir Plains in the Mwangi Expanse. In common with all ruins of the Rastel culture, the ruined city of Rastel shows signs of fire, conflict, and cannibalism.

Today, the ruins are home to a small number of cambions of Zenj descent. They carry out the traditional Zenj practice of ancestor worship, and include their fiendish ancestors within this. Among these are a group of fiends the cambions refer to as the Waiting Ones, who they believe are asleep beneath the city.

properties.Name: Rat
properties.text: The Rat is one of the ten remaining pilings of the Irespan in Magnimar. Standing 250-feet high, there is an entrance near sea level and it is still connected to the bridge deck. Magnimar's least-successful Sczarni gang, Doolun's Lads, are based out of a series of chambers within The Rat.

properties.Name: Raven's Watch
properties.text:
Raven's Watch was a fort constructed on the northern banks of the Turandarok River in the Ravenroost tors of Varisia's Sandpoint Hinterlands. The prison was abandoned when Sandpoint grew large enough to support its own garrison and jail, and rumours about a haunting or a curse have swirled around the prison since.

Though the above-ground portion of the prison quickly crumbled into ruin, the lower portions, where the guards were said to have left some prisoners, remain largely intact. A band of bandits aligned with the cult of Lamashtu are now said to have taken up watch within the prison's ruins.

properties.Name: Ravenous Sphinx
properties.text: The Ravenous Sphinx is a dungeon ruin located in the Parched Dunes that is connected to Nethys. It holds a copy of the Living Library and was discovered and unearthed by the Pathfinder Colm Safan in 4708 AR.

properties.Name: Razghora's Camp
properties.text: A large number of displaced goblinoids gathered by the hobgoblin Razghora settled at Razghora's Camp in Druma.

properties.Name: Records Hall
properties.text: Records Hall, located in the aristocratic district of The Greens, once stored all records of Kintargo's nobility. However, in the decades since House Thrune's ascension, the once impeccable records have been altered, redacted, and ravaged, and the collection is a shadow of its former self.

properties.Name: Red Kestrel Imports
properties.text:
Red Kestrel Imports had existed in Magnimar since 4702 AR. Its red warehouse in the northern portion Ordellia district flies the flags of the six nations it operates out ofâ€”Absalom, Cheliax, Osirion, Katapesh, Sargava, and, of course, Magnimar.

As of 4712 AR, it was run by Anton Ghanafini.

properties.Name: Red Rune Canyon
properties.text:
Red Rune Canyon, located in the eastern Tusk Mountains of the Realm of the Mammoth Lords, is an interconnected maze of canyons tainted by the relentless expansion of the Worldwound. Festering black boils and sores weep red bloodlike mud from its walls. The canyons change form under the demonic influence, with blasphemous runes etched into Golarion's surface. The evil of Red Rune Canyon drives any living creature who enters it mad.

Larisa, a cambion sorcerer, arrived to Red Rune Canyon in 4713 AR. Using blasphemous sacrifices at each new moon, she gained control of the glyphs inscribed by the canyon. Each sacrifice calls forth a new symbol and siphons power from the distant Worldwound. When she bends the canyon into her grand final rune, she will get rid of her mortal blood and metamorphose into a full demon.

The reshaping of the Red Rune Canyon has weakened the barriers between Golarion and the Outer Rifts. At each of Larisa's rituals, a new gate is forced open for a few seconds, oozing demons out into the Tusk Mountains.

properties.Name: Redroof Market
properties.text: Redroof Market satisfies the mercantile needs of the lower-class Redroof district of Kintargo. While Redroof Market contains all the essentialsâ€”butchers, greengrocers, etc.â€”it is most renowned for its array of clothing merchants who sell everything from Chelaxian wares to more exotic foreign styles. It is also renowned for offering a range of leather goods and for its cobblers.

properties.Name: Reiver's Right
properties.text: Reiver's Right is a former logging camp that has been long abandoned. The former loggers here became victims of a forest blight and were transformed into trees, and the blight still remains here.

properties.Name: Renchurch
properties.text: The haunted fortress-monastery of Renchurch in the damned Ustalavic province of Virlych is one of the headquarters of the undead-obsessed Whispering Way. It is overseen by the Gray Friar, a powerful huecuva cleric of Urgathoa.

properties.Name: Resa
properties.text:
